This will improve the quality of both universities and students, thus placing people in positions which suit them most.
llm: The purpose of education has long been a contentious issue among individuals and society as a whole. While some argue that education should be accessible to all, I firmly believe that it is more beneficial to reserve this type of training for a select group of exceptional learners. By focusing solely on talented students, academic institutions can maintain their high standards of education quality.The primary reason for limiting educational opportunities to gifted students is that it enables universities to cultivate a pool of exceptional talent. By only accepting high-achieving students, universities can provide them with the necessary tools and resources to excel in their fields, ultimately producing better-equipped individuals who can contribute significantly to society. This approach ensures that the most promising minds are nurtured and developed, leading to breakthroughs and innovations that can drive progress and advancement.Furthermore, concentrating on talented students allows universities to tailor their programs to meet the needs of these exceptional learners. By doing so, they can provide a more specialized and effective education, one that caters to the unique requirements and abilities of these students. This, in turn, enables them to reach their full potential and make meaningful contributions to their respective fields.Another significant advantage of this approach is that it enables universities to allocate their resources more efficiently. By focusing on a smaller, more talented pool of students, universities can invest more in each individual, providing them with the necessary support and guidance to succeed. This targeted approach ensures that resources are not wasted on students who may not be as committed or capable, ultimately leading to a more productive and effective use of resources.In conclusion, while some may argue that education should be accessible to all, I firmly believe that it is more beneficial to reserve this type of training for a select group of exceptional learners. By focusing solely on talented students, academic institutions can maintain their high standards of education quality, cultivate exceptional talent, and allocate resources more efficiently. Ultimately, this approach will lead to better human resources for sophisticated purposes, driving progress and advancement in various fields.

question: Agree or disagree? Universities spend money on improving facilities (labs and general requirements) better than hiring famous teachers.Ê
human: There is a hotly debated issue over whether universities should spend money on improving facilities is more than hiring famous teachers, and this topic can be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to prefer that schools should invest in renewing facilities, while other seem to believe that famous teachers is more conducive to students. After deeply pondering over this issue, I develop my own perspective as well. I favor the former; that is, I prefer to spend money on improving facilities. The first and foremost reason lies in an inevitable fact that the more advanced facilities we have, the more chances we can increase our knowledge. For example, library is a good place for students to study or research. They can concentrate on the subjects with a tranquil ambience; also, there are a lot of references for students to utilize. With this convenient and versatile facility, students can improve their learning condition. Therefore, we can commence to agree that certain facilities are beneficial to students. Moreover, another equally crucial aspect is that students are not always staying in classrooms. They have numerous activities in school. Consider a circumstance in which a student who is a member of jazz ensemble in their school. He must need a better auditorium for him to have an extraordinary performance. With this distinguished performance, the student would acquire an unforgettable and valuable experience burring deeply in his mind. Hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that students would prefer school to spending on improving facilities.Admittedly, on the other hand, there might be some people proclaiming that schools should spend money on hiring prestigious teachers because they can impart their students well. However, according to my limited understanding, I just doubt the credibility of that saying owing to its imprudence. A student is good or not do not depend on whether he has a good teacher but is decided by his effort on study. It is useless to hire a super famous teacher to teach those who behaviors as sluggards. Based on the reasons demonstrate above, I believe that improving facilities is the best way for school because the advantages of this are relatively greater than that of the other. In other words, students can procure more advantages from better facilities. It is not to say, of course, that other points of view are completely without merit. Still, I an firmly convinced that the reasons I have proposed in favor of my sentiment are much more tenable and cogent.
llm: The debate over whether schools should prioritize investing in renowned teachers or upgrading facilities has been ongoing. While some argue that having famous teachers is the key to a successful educational experience, I firmly believe that improving facilities is the most beneficial approach for schools.On one hand, having famous teachers can undoubtedly bring numerous benefits to students. For instance, these educators often possess exceptional teaching skills, extensive knowledge, and a strong reputation that can motivate students to learn. Additionally, famous teachers can attract more students to a school, enhancing its reputation and potentially leading to increased funding. However, the advantages of famous teachers are somewhat limited. Once they leave or retire, the school may struggle to maintain its reputation and attract new students.On the other hand, upgrading facilities offers a multitude of long-term benefits that can positively impact students' learning experiences. Modern and well-maintained facilities provide students with a comfortable and conducive environment that fosters engagement, motivation, and productivity. For example, a school with state-of-the-art laboratories, libraries, and sports facilities can provide students with hands-on learning experiences, access to vast resources, and opportunities to develop their skills. Furthermore, improved facilities can also enhance the overall safety and well-being of students, which is essential for their academic success. Unlike famous teachers, upgraded facilities remain a permanent asset to the school, continuing to benefit generations of students to come.In conclusion, while having famous teachers can bring certain advantages, I firmly believe that improving facilities is the best approach for schools. The benefits of upgraded facilities far outweigh those of famous teachers, providing students with a supportive and stimulating environment that can have a lasting impact on their educational journey. By prioritizing facility upgrades, schools can create a solid foundation for academic excellence and set themselves up for long-term success.

question: Do you agree or dis agree with the following statement? High schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Some people state that high schools should allow students to study what they want to. They believe this motivates students to study. I think, however, students should study a broad range of subjects from literature to mathematics. I believe that tertiary education should make students prepare for specialization at university. In addition, it should be to some extent paternalistic to prevent students from avoiding hurdles.To begin with, students have to find one or more fields of study in which they are really interested. They should not decide their future major without trying a broad range of subjects, otherwise they might miss valuable encounter with the subject. For instance, a would-be mathematician student may be strongly intrigued by philosophy and make a success in the field.Next, students should obtain knowledge from a variety of academic fields. General education plays a significant role in specialized education. Science today, for example, is said to be more and more specialized, but in order to solve a problem scientists have to combine knowledge from chemistry to physics. In addition, although textbooks used in higher education are labelled particular subjects, in fact they require basic understanding of other subjects. For instance, you sometimes need knowledge about physics to read a text on chemistry. Therefore, high school students should learn broadly and prepare future learning at university.Last but not least, students have tendency to shun difficulties. They might avoid tough courses, but instead attend mainly Mickey Mouse courses and enjoy themselves too much. This might result in limited choices in the future. Therefore, schools should be responsible for their future and protect them.In summary, students should find interesting subjects and acquire general knowledge to prepare higher education at tertiary education. Besides, high school must be responsible for their future with well-planned curriculum.
llm: As students navigate the complex world of tertiary education, it is crucial to remember that their field of study should be one that sparks genuine interest and passion. In order to determine which field is right for them, students should not limit themselves to a narrow scope of subjects. Rather, they should explore a broad range of disciplines, allowing themselves to discover their true strengths and interests.Specialization at university is a natural progression of a student's academic journey. However, this process should begin much earlier, during the tertiary education phase. By offering students a wide array of subjects to explore, tertiary education provides the perfect foundation for specialization. Students should be encouraged to delve into various fields, from arts and humanities to sciences and mathematics.By doing so, students can identify areas that captivate their imagination and align with their academic goals. This approach enables them to make informed decisions about their future major, rather than rushing into a specialization without proper exploration. Moreover, exploring multiple subjects fosters a deeper understanding of the interconnectedness of disciplines, allowing students to appreciate the complexity and richness of knowledge.Tertiary education should, therefore, provide students with a solid foundation for specialization at university. By allowing students to sample a diverse range of subjects, tertiary education sets the stage for students to discover their true academic passions. As students embark on their academic journey, they should be encouraged to remain open-minded and curious, embracing the opportunity to explore and discover their ideal field of study.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Games are as important for adults as they are for children. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: As people grow up, the arguments about the importance of games arise. Some people think that, adults need playing games as children do. However, in my opinion, games are no longer too important for them for several reasons.The first reason is that games become unnecessary for people when their careers begin. Someone may argue that games help adults relax and become more balanced in life. But, more often, the pressure of work and family commitment force them to abandon their lifelong hobbies, and as a result, they cannot spend enough time and effort to their favorite games as they did in 15 or 20 years ago. For example, in my country, except for a minor part of professional athletes, the majority of people stop playing games seriously as soon as they find a decent job. They often feel that such games become more troublesome than enjoyable for their daily lives.Another reason should be mentioned is that adults often do not pursue games as a competitive activity, while children are always keen on competition and winning. For youngsters, maintaining their desire to win often develops many outstanding characteristics whether they participate sport events or not. For example, my younger sister likes fencing, and thanks to her desire to win, she never gives up when facing a difficult situation, or even becoming hurt. On the other hand, adults often consider such behaviors as childish and drop them immediately. In fact, a competitive person usually finds it difficult to cooperate with friends and colleagues. Because of that, they no longer play games for any moderate achievements, and gradually lose their interest in such activities.To sum up, I think adults do need to play games, but their styles are often distinct from children's, which are often less competitive and more enjoyable. Along with the high requirement for family and work, games are just some leisure activities for adults, not something necessary as they are meant to be for children.
llm: The idea that adults should engage in playing games, just like children, has gained some traction in recent years. However, in my opinion, this notion is not entirely accurate for several compelling reasons.First and foremost, the pressures of work and family commitments often force adults to abandon their lifelong hobbies, including playing games. As people enter adulthood, their responsibilities multiply, leaving them with limited time and energy to devote to leisure activities. The demands of career advancement, raising a family, and managing a household can be overwhelming, making it challenging for adults to prioritize playing games. Unlike children, who have the luxury of free time and a carefree schedule, adults must often sacrifice their personal interests for the sake of their professional and familial obligations.Furthermore, the type of games that adults engage in may not be the same as those enjoyed by children. Adults may prefer more intellectually stimulating activities, such as strategy games or puzzles, which serve as a form of mental relaxation and stress relief. In contrast, children's games are often designed to promote physical activity, social interaction, and imagination. While these benefits are essential for children's development, adults may not require the same level of physical activity or social interaction, making games less of a priority.Additionally, adults have a wide range of other hobbies and interests that they can pursue in their free time, such as reading, traveling, or learning a new skill. These activities can provide a sense of fulfillment and personal growth, making games less necessary for their overall well-being. In conclusion, while playing games can be a fun and engaging activity, it is not essential for adults. The pressures of work and family commitments, combined with the availability of other hobbies and interests, make games a lower priority for adults.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Modern technology is creating a single world culture. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: There are many different opinions regarding world culture. Some people think that all the countries in the world cannot have a single culture. However, in my view, a single modern culture is being created by modern technology for the following reasons.Firstly, most of the countries have the same educational system based on technology. Teachers give topics to the students who should research on the internet to find data, and then students should type their research by using computer and even give a presentation by using PowerPoint. For example, students who are studying in Iran use the same software, Microsoft, to type their homework or have presentation compared to Canadian students.Secondly, new technology has created some similar jobs all around the world. Computer technology is a growing job in most of the countries, and students are being encouraged to study in this field. For example, many immigrants in Canada who have the degree in computer technology fields can easily go to Canadian universities and find jobs with good salaries. This example shows that jobs that are related to technology are in demand in most of the countries.Some people might argue that there are some cultures such as making foods which are unicq in each culture, and technology cannot affect them. This point has some merits on the surface; however, many countries such as Canada, the USA, and British have many restaurants which serve many foods form different countries and cultures. In fact, cooks can find many new food recipes easily on the Internet. For example, two days ago, I went to a Canadian restaurant, and I ate noodle, sushi, which are Chinese foods, and Greek salad.To sum up, new technology has affected cultures of the world, and we can see many similarities in many cultures. In fact, new technology has influences on educational system, jobs and foods in the world.
llm: The advent of modern technology has profoundly impacted cultures around the world, bridging geographical divides and fostering a sense of global homogenization. One of the most striking consequences of this phenomenon is the emergence of a single, modern culture that transcends traditional cultural boundaries.A compelling example of this trend is the ubiquity of software applications such as Microsoft, which has become an indispensable tool for students worldwide. Whether in Iran or Canada, students rely on the same technology to complete their homework, prepare presentations, and collaborate with peers. This shared experience has created a sense of familiarity and commonality among young people from diverse cultural backgrounds, blurring the lines between traditional cultural identities.The proliferation of social media platforms, online marketplaces, and streaming services has further accelerated this process. People from different parts of the world can now access the same information, consume the same entertainment, and engage in similar online activities, creating a shared cultural lexicon. This has led to a homogenization of cultural practices, as local customs and traditions are influenced by global trends and vice versa.Moreover, the internet has enabled the free flow of ideas, fostering a global cultural exchange that was previously unimaginable. People can now learn about and engage with different cultures, adopting and adapting elements that resonate with them. This has given rise to a new, hybrid culture that blends local traditions with global influences, creating a distinctive, modern cultural identity.In conclusion, modern technology has given rise to a single, modern culture that is characterized by shared experiences, global connectivity, and cultural exchange. As people from diverse backgrounds interact and engage with each other online, they are creating a new, hybrid culture that reflects the complexities and diversity of our increasingly interconnected world.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: Nowadays it is much easier to achieve success with the help from one's family than what is like before
human: There are many factors that contribute to one's success. However, which factor is the most influential one is open to debate. Some people believe that nowadays the assitance from family is quite a essential factor in one's success. It seems that one can achieve success more easily with the help from his or her family. I agree with this statement. In my opinion, family plays a more important role in helping one to pursuit success. There are a couple of reasons.First of all, more and more people have the opportunity to receive education from university. Since our parents receive better education than our grandparents did, they can provide more advices and helps in our career. In the past, seldom people have the chance to attend a collage. For example, my grandparents did not get a education even in high school, so when my father had difficulty in solving a problem in his childhood, he had to go to his teacher for help. Things have changed a lot. I grow up in a better condition than my father did. Whenever I have problems, I can always ask my parents for help. They can solve the problem quickly because they have learned quite a lot. What is more, family members can help us in many other aspects. For example, when I did not know what major to choose when I attend university, my father told a lot about different majors. He shared his own experience with me, which helped me quite a lot. Parents are quite experienced than their child, they can guide them toward the right direction. Besides, parents can told their children as many as they can. What they want is help their child to make a progress.In a word, our parents and other family members can help us a lot in our life. I believe that with the help of our family, we can achieve success quite easily.
llm: The role of family in achieving success has been a topic of discussion in recent years. While some people argue that family assistance is essential for success, I firmly believe that family plays a more significant role in helping individuals pursue their goals.Firstly, a supportive family provides a stable and secure environment that allows individuals to focus on their aspirations. Growing up in a loving and encouraging family setting instills confidence and motivation, which are crucial for overcoming obstacles and staying committed to one's goals. For instance, a child who receives consistent support and guidance from their family is more likely to develop a strong sense of self-belief and perseverance, essential qualities for achieving success.Secondly, family members often possess valuable knowledge and experience that can be shared with their loved ones. Parents, siblings, and other relatives can offer insightful advice, mentorship, and networking opportunities that can greatly benefit an individual's career or personal pursuits. Additionally, family members can provide emotional support during times of struggle, helping to alleviate stress and anxiety that can hinder progress. This emotional safety net can be particularly important during periods of uncertainty or failure, allowing individuals to bounce back and continue striving for their objectives.Furthermore, a strong family network can also provide access to resources and opportunities that may not be available otherwise. For example, a family member may have connections in a particular industry or be able to provide financial support, enabling an individual to pursue their passions without undue burden. By having a supportive family, individuals can tap into these resources and increase their chances of success.In conclusion, while some people may view family assistance as essential, I firmly believe that family plays a more critical role in helping individuals achieve success. By providing a supportive environment, valuable knowledge, emotional support, and access to resources, family members can greatly contribute to an individual's pursuit of their goals. As such, it is imperative to recognize and appreciate the significant impact that family can have on one's journey to success.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction (such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
human: There are many different opinions regarding hobbies. Some people would rather watch TV. However, in my view, reading fiction is more enjoyable than watching movies for the following reasons.Firstly, fiction books pay more attention to details. In fact, we can know characters, places, and times of a novel very well during reading it. Most of the novels describe not only main characters but also other people in the novels, where each scene is happening. For example, after I read animal farms which is a story of Russian revolution, I could understand the leaders and different segments of the Russian people. However, a movie just gives us a very small review of its stories and characters.Secondly, reading a novel is more convenient. Some novels have around 100 pages and readers cannot finish them in just one hour. Yet these people can continue to read their novels wherever they find free time such as in bus or trains. For example, I have started to read a novel since last week. I do not have enough time to read a novel in one day, so I usually read it when I am coming home from English class. In contrast, I cannot watch a complete movie because I can just sit in front of TV for 15 minutes and after that, I have to study.Some people might argue that people enjoy watching TV when they know they can learn many things such as learning a language by watching movies. This point has some merits on the surface; however, movies are not a good idea to learn a language for beginners since characters in movies speak very fast and unclear for language learners. For these learners it is better to start by reading some novels which are more comprehensible and enjoyable.To sum up, reading fictions is more pleasant because these books have more depth, are much easier to use, and more useful for language learners.
llm: Reading Fiction vs. Watching Movies: A Comparative AnalysisWhen it comes to leisure activities, people often find themselves torn between reading fiction and watching movies. While both mediums have their unique charms, reading fiction offers a more enjoyable experience than watching movies for several compelling reasons.Firstly, fiction books pay closer attention to details, allowing readers to immerse themselves in the narrative more effectively. Unlike movies, which often sacrifice depth for brevity due to time constraints, novels can explore complex characters, plot twists, and themes with greater nuance. This richly detailed storytelling enables readers to engage more intimately with the story, fostering a deeper emotional connection with the characters and their journeys.Secondly, reading a novel is more convenient than watching a movie. With the busy lives we lead, it can be challenging to dedicate two hours to watching a movie in one sitting. In contrast, fiction books offer the flexibility to read at one's own pace, whenever and wherever. Many novels are compact, with some spanning only around 100 pages, making them easily digestible in shorter intervals. This adaptability is particularly advantageous for students, who often find themselves with limited time to spare. Unlike watching a movie, which requires an uninterrupted block of time, reading a novel can be done in short bursts, allowing readers to fit it into their busy schedules.For instance, if I have only 15 minutes to spare before studying, I can easily read a chapter or two, whereas watching a movie is impossible in such a short timeframe. This flexibility makes reading fiction a more practical and enjoyable option for those with hectic lifestyles.In conclusion, reading fiction surpasses watching movies in terms of attention to detail and convenience. Whether it's the immersive experience offered by detailed storytelling or the flexibility to read at one's own pace, reading fiction provides a more enjoyable leisure activity for those seeking a engaging and practical pastime.

question: Several languages die every year. Many people feel this is a positive trend and that a world with fewer language promotes harmony and understanding between people. Analyze both sides of this argument and provide your opinion.
human: Today, English is commonly used language across the world. Its usage is increasing day by day. As a consequence, various local languages are becoming extinct. Some people argue that, this is a positive change and would help people to easily communicate. While there are others who disagree with this and are more concerned about dying local languages. In my opinion, I believe using single language through out the world is a positive change which is helping the world to become a better place to live.A world with fewer languages helps us interact with each other in a better way. Due to globalization, many people are traveling for professional trips. So, communicating in single language will reduce the problems of travelers in daily activities like ordering food in a restaurant or in going around places. Furthermore, students who migrate for better education would not have to go through lot of stress as they can easily make new friends and can be part of any discussions which is otherwise not possible in a world with multiple languages; this in turn makes it easy to adjust in new environment. Single language also reduces misunderstandings between people. Adding to that, exchange of knowledge in different sectors of research like electronics, medical, astronomy etc would become easier.On the other hand, few people are worried about the dying local languages. These languages are the basis for the origination and initial communication between different cultures. They represent local culture. As the usage of these languages decrease, culture also changes accordingly. Further, these languages are tightly coupled with history; all the olden day literature and scripts will be impossible to decipher if these languages are lost.To conclude, I believe change is inevitable and that usage of one language across the world is a positive one. We have to accept these changes for a world to be a better place. Communication in single language would improve the productivity of the world and brings everyone on to the same page.
llm: The notion of adopting a single language across the globe has sparked intense debate among linguists, anthropologists, and cultural enthusiasts. Some argue that this would be a positive change, facilitating communication and fostering global understanding. Proponents of this idea contend that a single language would alleviate the challenges faced by travelers in their daily activities.One of the primary advantages of a single language is the ease of navigation in unfamiliar territories. Travelers would no longer struggle to communicate with locals, making everyday tasks like ordering food at a restaurant or asking for directions a seamless experience. This would undoubtedly enhance the overall travel experience, allowing individuals to fully immerse themselves in foreign cultures without the burden of language barriers.Furthermore, a single language would mitigate misunderstandings between people from diverse linguistic backgrounds. In a world where everyone speaks the same language, the risk of misinterpretation and miscommunication would be significantly reduced. This, in turn, would foster greater collaboration, cooperation, and mutual understanding among nations, ultimately contributing to a more harmonious and peaceful world.However, it is also worth considering the potential drawbacks of a single language. The loss of linguistic diversity would inevitably lead to the erosion of cultural identities and the homogenization of traditions. Additionally, the imposition of a single language could be seen as a form of cultural imperialism, where dominant languages are imposed upon marginalized communities.In conclusion, while the adoption of a single language may seem like a panacea for the challenges of global communication, it is crucial to weigh the benefits against the potential costs. A single language may facilitate travel and reduce misunderstandings, but it is essential to preserve the rich tapestry of linguistic diversity that makes human culture so vibrant and unique.

question: Elderly people think that the way they spent their life was simpler and better than today. Do you agree or disagree? Provide you reasons and real life example
human: Changes are inseparable parts of this world which normally humans are responsible for by manipulating the environment they live in. Sometimes these changes adversely affect our lives that make elderly people think they used to live in a better world than the modern world the younger generation are experiencing. I utterly disagree with this opinion due to technological and medical reasons.We live in an era that technology is developing in the speed of light, steering the world toward a much more convenient place. A clear-cut example that supports this idea is the invention of smart phones. The strong navigation system installed on the phones has been rescued lives of many who left alone in remote areas like forests or deserts. Moreover, some people criticize social networks as tools that have ruined true relationships and friendships by reducing face-to-face communication. In my opinion though, social networks such as Facebook could foster the ties between friends and family members who are obligatorily far away from each other by keeping them in touch, the thing that was impossible less than 20 years ago. The phenomenal progress in medical science in the last decade was a huge achievement for human being to make the world a healthier and, thus, a happier place to live in. Today, even some disabled people with serious vertebral injuries can start doing physical activities like walking again thanks to the continuingly efforts of biomechanical engineers and neurologists. The advancement in drug delivery systems is another example that could save lives. To be specific, scientists could invent ways to lead drugs directly to the damaged organs of the body, which is a miraculous breakthrough. In general, the increase in the average age of human from 50 to around 75 years through last decades is a strong evidence to show how successful human was in medicine.In conclusion, even though the people from older generation may claim they had better life as there were stronger bonds between family members and friends, I think they are wrong, since they judge the contemporary age through a personal prejudice. In light of the above-mentioned facts, one can easily conclude that in the current world living standards stand in a much higher level and people are in better conditions socially and physically.
llm: The world is undergoing a transformative era, marked by unprecedented technological advancements at a breakneck speed. This relentless progress is redefining the fabric of our lives, propelling us towards an era of unparalleled convenience. Among the most significant beneficiaries of this technological boom is the field of medical science.Over the past decade, the strides made in medical science have been nothing short of phenomenal. Groundbreaking discoveries, innovative treatments, and cutting-edge technologies have cumulatively contributed to a significant improvement in healthcare. The advent of advanced diagnostic tools, precision medicines, and gene editing technologies such as CRISPR have empowered medical professionals to tackle complex diseases with enhanced efficacy. Furthermore, the integration of artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms has streamlined clinical processes, enabling quicker diagnoses and more personalized treatment plans.The impact of these advancements on human health has been profound. Life expectancy has increased, while the incidence of previously debilitating diseases has decreased. Moreover, the quality of life for individuals living with chronic conditions has improved dramatically, thanks to novel therapies and better disease management strategies. These achievements are not only a testament to human ingenuity but also a reflection of our collective pursuit of a healthier and happier world.The far-reaching consequences of these medical breakthroughs extend beyond the realm of healthcare. A healthier population is more productive, innovative, and economically resilient. It is a cornerstone of a society that is not only better equipped to tackle challenges but also more inclined to pursue happiness. In conclusion, the phenomenal progress in medical science over the past decade is a milestone in our collective journey towards a more convenient, healthier, and happier world.

question: Some people say that all secondary school and higher school students should be taught how to manage money as its an important life skill. Do you agree or disagree with this argument?
human: There is no doubt that money has become key ingredient in various walks of our life than before. Teaching financial management to juvenile students is always a topic of debate. Some people feel that teaching money management skill to teenage students will help them realise the importance of money, while few feel that exposing children to money math at this age may turn fatal. In my view, I agree to that fact that higher school students should be made aware of the money management.The reason why I think teenage students need to understand the money management basics is, primarily when secondary school students attain the age of undergoing graduation, students ought to stay in hostels or with friends and away from family, during such situations when money management is taught at an early age students will have increased sense of responsibility and confidence. For example, while I was a kid my father used to maintain expense log for the month, I was asked to do the same for my keep track of my pocket money expenses, during my future course of life this became a practice and helped me in planning my expenses.In addition, if financial management is taught at an early age, students will have better sense of understanding of their family financial background and status, students coming up with unrealistic whims and fancies are minimized. For example, buying a gaming console may not be a big deal for a student from an affluent financial background. However, for a student coming from middle class buying a gaming console may not be the need of the hour. Hence, having exposed to money management at a high school level will help them in prioritizing the financial commitments efficiently.In conclusion, I think students understanding the money management techniques will have more positive effects than negative impact. However, the teaching should be in a constructive manner and students should not feel that they are being bullied for every expense.
llm: The question of whether to teach financial management to juvenile students has sparked a contentious debate. While some argue that introducing children to money management at a young age can have adverse effects, others firmly believe that it is a vital skill that should be imparted to high school students. In my opinion, I strongly agree that higher school students should be made aware of the importance of money management.First and foremost, the reality is that money is an integral part of our daily lives. From a young age, children are exposed to various forms of advertisements and marketing tactics that lure them into spending. By teaching financial management in schools, students can develop the necessary skills to make informed decisions about their financial resources. This includes understanding the value of money, the importance of saving, and the consequences of overspending.Moreover, teaching financial management to high school students can help them develop a sense of responsibility and independence. As they grow older, they will be expected to make financial decisions that will impact their future. By equipping them with the necessary knowledge and skills, they can make informed choices about their education, career, and personal life.Another significant benefit of teaching financial management to high school students is that it can help them avoid debt and financial pitfalls. Many young adults struggle with debt and financial insecurity due to a lack of understanding of personal finance. By educating them on the basics of money management, they can avoid common financial mistakes and build a stable financial foundation.In conclusion, while some may argue that teaching financial management to juvenile students can have negative consequences, I firmly believe that it is a crucial life skill that should be imparted to high school students. By doing so, we can empower them with the knowledge and skills necessary to make informed financial decisions, develop a sense of responsibility, and build a stable financial future.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Smoking should not be permitted in restaurants, and state laws that prohibit it should be upheld.
human: Generally speaking, smoking is never been good for human's body. There are so many researches done to prove that a cigar contains harmful ingredients for human's body. Although many smokers claim that they need to smoke in order to work more effectively or to think more creatively, those reasons never proves that smoking has any benefits for human's body. In my opinion, smoking should not be permitted, especially in public places like restaurants because it will make the non-smokers breathe uncomfortably.First of all, restaurants are places where people come and pay some money to enjoy their meals. Smoking in restaurants will absolutely disturb other people in enjoying their meals. They will not be able to enjoy their meals while breathing in smoke around them. Secondly, restaurants are places that people usually come with their families. This means, there will be children, grandparents, as well as pregnant women inside the restaurants. Smoking in restaurants can give a bad example to the children. Children have a high potential to imitate what adults do because they have really high curiosity towards something. Smoking in restaurants also can affect the elders' health, especially if they have problems with their hearts and lungs. The most dangerous people that would be affected by smoke are the pregnant women because they will breathe in the contaminated air and it will disrupt the growth of the babies.Last but not least, passive smokers will have a lot of health risks. When they are around the active smokers, they will inhale hazardous smoke. Stroke, heart disorders, hearing loss, and cancers are some diseases that can attack passive smokers. Personally speaking, it is unfair for passive smokers because they do not smoke but they have same health risks as the active one.In conclusion, smoking should not be permitted in restaurants because there will be a lot of people get disadvantaged. State laws that prohibit it should be upheld so the restaurant' management can make a clear rule in their restaurants because everyone has a right to enjoy their meals.
llm: Smoking should be strictly prohibited in restaurants due to its adverse effects on non-smokers' comfort, health, and the overall dining experience. Restaurants are establishments where people gather to enjoy a meal, relax, and socialize. However, when smoking is permitted, it creates an uncomfortable environment for non-smokers, who are exposed to second-hand smoke involuntarily. This not only spoils their dining experience but also puts their health at risk.Furthermore, restaurants are frequented by people of all ages, including children, grandparents, and pregnant women. Permitting smoking in these establishments sets a bad example, especially for children, who may be influenced to take up the habit. Moreover, smoking in restaurants can have serious health implications for these vulnerable groups, including respiratory problems, cardiovascular diseases, and birth defects.The issue of passive smoking is another significant concern. Non-smokers who are exposed to second-hand smoke in restaurants are at risk of developing the same health problems as active smokers, despite not smoking themselves. This is unfair, as they have no control over their exposure to smoke and are still subjected to its harmful effects. In fact, studies have shown that passive smoking can cause lung cancer, heart disease, and other serious health issues.In conclusion, smoking should not be permitted in restaurants. It is essential to protect the health, comfort, and well-being of non-smokers, particularly vulnerable groups such as children, grandparents, and pregnant women. Restaurants should be smoke-free zones, ensuring that all patrons can enjoy their meals in a healthy and comfortable environment. By banning smoking in restaurants, we can promote a healthier and more considerate community.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Growing violence in films has affected youngsters in a negative way?
human: It's obvious that violent behavior is growing more in films in recent 20 years. This matter has been considered as a way to advertise a film. From my point of view, I believe that violence in movies has negative effects on youngsters mostly on their behaviors, emotions & study.In the first place, children behaviors are the most concerning matter which parents are always trying to do their best. Nowadays children are more involved in TV programs. Imagine an actor who is a child’s favorite is doing violent roles. In this case, the child would imitate the actor's behaviors in order to look like to him. Thus, unexpectedly the violent behavior has effected on child’s behaviors.Meanwhile, human beings are very sensitive, especially of youngsters. For instance, dying is always a disappointing happening. Furthermore, killing is worse. Therefore, if these scenes are in TV, they would probably have their negative effects on the viewer who could be a child.Finally, beside all above mentioned items, the study of youngsters shall always been controlled. For example, a child watches a frightening movie. On the other hand, he has to study for the exam. In this condition, because he is thinking about the movie or whatever has happened in it, it is obvious that he wouldn’t be able to concentrate on his study perfectly. Hence, the study of a youngster would affected terribly.In conclusion, I certainly can say that growing of violence in films have definitely negative effects on youngsters mostly on their study, emotions and behaviors. Therefore, I think this matter should be controlled by parents or somehow by directors.
llm: The proliferation of violent behavior in films has become a disturbing trend over the past two decades. It has reached an alarming level, where filmmakers are using violence as a marketing tool to attract audiences and generate buzz around their movies. However, this approach has severe consequences, particularly on the younger generation. From my perspective, the depiction of violence in movies has far-reaching negative effects on youngsters, impacting their behavior, emotions, and academic performance.Exposure to violent content in films can desensitize youngsters to the consequences of aggression, leading to a rise in aggressive behavior. Children and adolescents who are repeatedly exposed to violent scenes may begin to view violence as an acceptable means of resolving conflicts, rather than seeking peaceful solutions. This can result in a surge in bullying, fights, and other forms of aggression among young people. Furthermore, the glorification of violence in movies can also contribute to a decline in empathy and compassion among youngsters, making them less likely to understand and appreciate the feelings of others.The emotional well-being of youngsters is also at risk due to the prevalence of violence in movies. Exposure to violent content can lead to increased anxiety, fear, and stress levels among children and adolescents. This can result in a range of emotional and psychological problems, including nightmares, bedwetting, and depression. Moreover, the constant bombardment of violent images can also lead to a decline in self-esteem and confidence among youngsters, making them more vulnerable to peer pressure and social influences.Lastly, the depiction of violence in movies can also have a detrimental impact on the academic performance of youngsters. Exposure to violent content can reduce concentration and attention span, making it difficult for youngsters to focus on their studies. Moreover, the constant exposure to violent images can also lead to a decline in interest in academic pursuits, as youngsters become more attracted to the thrill and excitement of violent content.In conclusion, the growing trend of violence in movies has severe consequences for youngsters, impacting their behavior, emotions, and academic performance. It is essential for filmmakers to take responsibility and consider the potential impact of their movies on young audiences. By promoting alternative and more positive forms of entertainment, we can help to mitigate the negative effects of violence in movies and promote a more positive and peaceful environment for our youngsters.

question: Agree or disagree: In order to be well-informed, a person must get information from many different news sources.
human: Nowadays information plays an important role in our world. It has become a product, which can be sold, bought, or stolen. Some people say: "information is power". That's why it is so important to be well-informed. I consider the statement above to be right for several reasons.The first reason is that by using different sources of information we can guarantee its reliability. Some people may disinform you on purpose, that's why it is rather unwise to make conclusions before you are confident of the information. For example, Russian news announced that the war between Osetia and Georgia had been initiated by Georgia, however, european news announced that it was initiated by Russia. After a while the situation became clear, but before that a lot of people had already condemned the actions of Russia.Secondly, it is very important to know facts about some events or problem, not only estimations, because it can help you to make your own conclusion or estimate. Sometimes it can be really difficult to find out the facts, especially in the internet, that's why you have to look through different sources before you manage to find some reliable facts. It is possible to make a wrong decision because you have just used someone's personal opinion as a source of information, but it was actually wrong. For example, several years ago in Moscow salt became two times more expensive only in one week, because people thought that soon there would be no salt in the shops. The gossip-based information dramatically influenced the prices and only after official announcement the "salt-panic" was over. To conclude, I want to say that it is very important to be confident of the information, which you use, especially when your conclusion or decision may have a great influence.
llm: The age-old adage "information is power" holds significant weight in today's fast-paced, knowledge-driven world. The importance of being well-informed cannot be overstated, as it empowers individuals to make informed decisions, form opinions, and navigate the complexities of modern life. One of the key reasons why being well-informed is crucial is that it allows us to separate fact from fiction, ensuring that our understanding of events and issues is rooted in reality rather than speculation or misinformation.To guarantee the reliability of information, it is essential to consult a diverse range of sources. Relying on a single source or perspective can lead to a skewed understanding of a topic, whereas consulting multiple sources provides a more comprehensive and balanced view. This is particularly important in today's digital age, where misinformation and disinformation can spread rapidly through social media and other online platforms. By cross-referencing information and evaluating the credibility of sources, we can increase the accuracy of our knowledge and make more informed decisions.Knowing facts about events or issues, rather than relying on estimates or speculation, is also vital. Facts provide a solid foundation for understanding, allowing us to analyze and interpret information with confidence. In contrast, estimates or speculation can lead to misconceptions and misinterpretations, which can have serious consequences. By seeking out verifiable facts and data, we can gain a deeper understanding of the world around us and make more informed choices.In conclusion, the importance of being well-informed cannot be overstated. By consulting multiple sources, verifying the reliability of information, and seeking out facts, we can empower ourselves to make informed decisions, navigate the complexities of modern life, and truly harness the power of information.

question: Some people argue that there is no point in persevering old buildings when land is so valuable in our cities. Others believe that old buildings are important part of our heritage and should be preserved. Discuss both these views and state your opinion.
human: The preservation of old buildings always is a large question for governments because conflict between the issues of housing for citizens and the protection of our culture. In my opinion, all of the old building which contribute to our sense of culture should be conserved.There are different reasons which persuade that people should not restore old buildings. As a result of the rapid urbanization process, in which rural people must go to urban centers to look for job opportunities, the question of the preservation of old buildings has become more pressing. Because of that need, governments can construct more accommodation instead of preserving old buildings. Besides that, the preservation is very expensive because all components of old buildings have historical values. Old buildings are an essential part of history. Tourist often decide to discover the culture of a country when they visit through those old buildings. Therefore, managers of cities can earn more money from the attraction provided by old buildings and that amount can be spent on their conservation. Furthermore, the preservation of old buildings is also a ways to conserve our culture and everyone can learn much from them. Old buildings should be used as the culture museums and provide accommodation with more convenient for people who live there. . Many cities have development strategies as a city contains both unique and modern beauty, and that preservation help to finish half of work.	Overall, both of those view have strong arguments: the need for housing or the expense of restoration contrast with our desire to conserve culture and attract tourism. So I think we should restore those building because old buildings process the most outstanding feature of areas which contain them.
llm: The preservation of old buildings is a perennial concern for governments, often sparking debate between the competing interests of providing housing for citizens and protecting cultural heritage. In my opinion, it is essential to conserve all old buildings that significantly contribute to our cultural identity.On one hand, the demand for housing is a pressing issue that governments cannot afford to ignore. As populations continue to grow, the need for affordable and accessible housing becomes increasingly urgent. Demolishing old buildings to make way for modern developments may seem like a pragmatic solution to address this shortage. However, this approach comes at a significant cultural cost.Old buildings are not just mere structures; they are tangible links to our past, embodying the history, traditions, and values of our ancestors. They provide a unique window into the cultural, social, and economic context of bygone eras, allowing us to learn from and appreciate the achievements of previous generations. By preserving these buildings, we can safeguard our cultural heritage and ensure that future generations can continue to draw inspiration and knowledge from them.Furthermore, old buildings can be adaptively reused, incorporating modern amenities while retaining their original character. This approach not only preserves our cultural legacy but also provides innovative solutions to the housing crisis. For instance, converted historic buildings can be transformed into boutique hotels, art galleries, or museums, generating revenue and creating jobs while maintaining their cultural significance.In conclusion, the preservation of old buildings that contribute to our cultural heritage should be prioritized. By conserving these structures, we can protect our collective memory, promote cultural understanding, and inspire future generations. While the pressure to address housing needs is real, it is essential to adopt a balanced approach that reconciles these competing interests, ensuring that our cultural legacy is preserved for years to come.

question: Nowadays, many young people say that mobile phones are the most important thing in their life. Do you think the popularity of mobile phones to young people is a good or bad development? Give relevant examples from your own experience.
human: Nowadays, many young people consider mobile phone as the most important thing in their lives as it keeps them constantly organized and it provides much convenience for them to reach out their families and friends. Despite all these positive aspects, I think that the popularity of mobile phones to the young generation is a bad development.First of all, many young owners of cellular phones are struggling at school because they are distracted most of the time with their phones. Games and applications installed in phones have occupied much of their time, leaving them lesser time for their studies and other school activities. Similarly, internet capable phones help influence the young ones to become more interested in chatting and social sites rather than doing school works. In my college days, I was once addicted to a certain game on my cellular phone. I have spent most of my time trying to reach a higher level to show-off to my friends. That goal has led me to my lost in interest on doing my homework and I ended up failing one subject in that semester.Secondly, juveniles who possess mobile phones have great tendencies to become materialistic. They would not only purchase a phone because of its functionality but also for its brand. Relatively, these do not come at a significant and inexpensive cost. Furthermore, most of these juveniles are students so they would need their parents to support them financially for what they want. An illustration of this unfortunate trend can be seen almost everywhere these days, wherein most teens at an early age own phones which are worth twice the salary of their parents. This clearly shows that the negative impacts brought about by mobile phones are harmful to a person’s education and character. Therefore, I highly discourage the young ones to be overly dependent on mobile phones.
llm: The widespread use of mobile phones among young people has become a ubiquitous phenomenon in today's society. Many young individuals consider their mobile phones as an indispensable part of their daily lives. However, despite the numerous benefits that mobile phones offer, such as instant access to information and connectivity with others, I firmly believe that the popularity of mobile phones among the young generation is a detrimental development.Firstly, the excessive use of mobile phones has a profound impact on the academic performance of young people. Many students are struggling in school due to the constant distraction posed by their mobile phones. The temptation to check social media, play games, or text friends can be overwhelming, leading to divided attention and poor academic results. As a result, young people are failing to reach their full potential, and their future prospects are being compromised.Secondly, the possession of mobile phones has been linked to the development of materialistic tendencies among juveniles. The constant bombardment of advertisements and social media posts showcasing the latest gadgets and trends can foster a sense of entitlement and a desire for the latest technology. This can lead to an excessive focus on material possessions and a decline in values such as hard work, thriftiness, and contentment. Furthermore, the pressure to keep up with the latest phone models can create a sense of anxiety and stress among young people, as they feel compelled to constantly upgrade their devices.In conclusion, while mobile phones offer many benefits, their popularity among young people is a bad development. The negative impact on academic performance and the promotion of materialistic values are just two of the many reasons why I believe that young people should be discouraged from excessive mobile phone use.

question: Some people believe that there should be fixed punishments for each type of crime. Others, however,argue that the circumstances of an individual crime, and the motivation for committing it, should always be taken into account when deciding on the punishment.
human: Generally reason behind punishment is to reduce the crime from a nation and to build a fear in the mind of offenders. Some people think that it does not matter what is reason behind committing a crime therefore there should be fixed punishment for a specific crime. Alternatively I believe that it should taken into consideration the situation and conditions, that forces to a person to be a criminal.First of all if there will be a fixed punishment for each type of crime then it will lead to increase the crime because the punishment will be clear in the mind of professional criminals and they will not feel fear while committing a crime. Secondly, laws and rules are there for people therefore it is necessary to have a look behind crime for instance "a women steals feed for her child should be treated same as a women, who steals for her drug addiction". The person who committed crime first time and the professional criminals should not be imprisoned at same place.On the contrary, fixed punishment will reduce the time taken by judges to give their judgement and it will be effective economically for the Government. Everyone should be treated equally because sometimes we see that a poor person who do not have much money for hiring a good lawyer they get imprisoned even without committing a crime and when they come back to the society they become a professional criminal. Therefore fixed punishment will reduce the space between poor and rich people and everyone will understand the importance of each other.To conclude, Government should decide for punishment case by case basis. In doing so crime can be eliminated from a nation and it is a responsibility of every individual to be in the favor of truth and respect the laws of our constitution.
llm: The debate surrounding fixed punishments for crimes has been a longstanding one, with proponents on both sides presenting compelling arguments. On one hand, the implementation of fixed punishments can have unintended consequences, potentially leading to an increase in criminal activity. Professional criminals, who are well-versed in the law, will be fully aware of the punishment they face if caught. This knowledge can embolden them, as they will be able to weigh the risks and rewards of their actions with precision. In some cases, the fixed punishment may not be severe enough to deter them, leading to an increase in crime.On the other hand, fixed punishments can have several benefits. One of the primary advantages is the reduction in time taken by judges to deliver judgments. With a clear and predetermined punishment for each type of crime, judges can quickly and efficiently dispense justice, without the need for lengthy deliberations. This not only saves time but also reduces the burden on the judicial system, allowing it to function more smoothly.Furthermore, fixed punishments can be economically beneficial for the government. By streamlining the judicial process, the government can save on the costs associated with lengthy trials and deliberations. Additionally, with a clear and predictable punishment system, the government can better allocate resources, focusing on prevention and rehabilitation rather than lengthy and costly trials.In conclusion, while fixed punishments may have some drawbacks, such as potentially increasing crime among professional criminals, the benefits of a streamlined judicial process and economic efficiency cannot be ignored. A balanced approach, taking into account the severity of the crime and the circumstances surrounding it, may be the most effective way to implement fixed punishments. Ultimately, the goal of the justice system should be to deliver fair and effective justice, and fixed punishments can be a useful tool in achieving this goal.

question: Many people think that cheap air travel should be encouraged because it gives ordinary people the freedom to travel further. However, others think that this leads to environmental problem, and so air travel should be more expensive in order to discourage people from having it. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
human: In recent years, many airlines offer to their customers more and more number of cheap flights. People have various different views about cheap air travel. Although there are good arguments in favour of this trend should be encouraged, I personally think that cheap flight can make many serious problem.It is undeniable that cheap air fares have broadened travel possibilities for many people, particularly for the lower income group. These days, millions of people can travel around the world for work or pleasure. They can develop their careers, broad their knowledge, and interact with many other people from varied cultural backgrounds. Moreover, travels also help to promote the tourist industry development, boost the economy and job markets of many countries.On the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. Apparently, more flights could mean bigger and busier airport that may be grown the air pollution for people who live and work close to it. However, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. Burning plane fuel can releases carbon dioxid into environment that cause the Earth to heat up. In fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce CO2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to reins the airlines. In conclusion, I would argue that the drawbacks of cheap air fares outweigh the benefits. However, it does not mean that air travel should be more expensive. Instead, people should be aware of their responsibility to reduce the emissions caused by their lifestyle choices.
llm: The advent of cheap air fares has revolutionized the travel industry, opening up a world of possibilities for many people, particularly those from lower-income groups. With affordable flights, individuals who previously couldn't afford to travel can now explore new destinations, experience different cultures, and connect with others across the globe. This increased accessibility has bridged geographical divides, fostering global understanding and economic growth.However, the proliferation of flights has also led to the expansion of airports, resulting in busier and more congested airspaces. This, in turn, has significant environmental implications. The increased air traffic has led to a surge in air pollution, affecting the health and well-being of people living and working in close proximity to airports. The constant stream of takeoffs and landings releases a cocktail of pollutants, including particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, and volatile organic compounds, which can exacerbate respiratory issues and other health problems.Furthermore, the burning of plane fuel releases carbon dioxide into the environment, contributing to climate change. As the Earth's temperature continues to rise, the consequences of global warming become increasingly apparent, from melting polar ice caps to extreme weather events. The aviation industry's carbon footprint is significant, accounting for around 2.5% of global greenhouse gas emissions. While cheap air fares have democratized travel, it is essential to acknowledge the environmental costs associated with this trend.To mitigate these effects, the aviation industry must prioritize sustainability. This can be achieved through the adoption of cleaner fuels, more efficient aircraft designs, and optimized flight routes. Additionally, governments and regulatory bodies can implement policies to reduce emissions, such as carbon offsetting schemes and taxes on polluting fuels. Ultimately, striking a balance between accessibility and environmental responsibility is crucial to ensure that the benefits of cheap air fares are not overshadowed by their ecological costs.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific examples to support your answer.Ê
human: There are undeniable advantages to both life in a big city and in a small town. The former offers more excitement and convenience while the latter offers a cleaner, quieter and often friendlier place to live. However, despite the advantages of small town life, I prefer to live in a big city for several reasons.On the one hand, I have always wanted to find a job in a big company which locates in a prosperous city area. To make it convenient, I will absolutely choose a place to live that is not too far from my workplace. What's more I can save plenty of money on transportation if I choose to live in the city.On the other hand, life in a big city will not be so dull as in a small town. You can enjoy modern life and have more access to the advanced facilities. For instance, you can visit museums to learn history, and go to a more equipped library to enjoy reading, or you can go to a sports center for exercising. But a small town may be less developed to satisfy all these kinds of needs.Furthermore living in big cities means more exposure to stimulation, like all kinds of information. If one can efficiently acquire the information, then, there might come along more opportunities for him to achieve his goals. For example, there are various advertisements here an there, whether on the leaflets or on the big screen showing things of all sorts in commercial zones. If one is seeking a job right in the city or planing somewhere to travel, or just wants to buy a product in a dependable store, he might refer to what he has seen or heard from the advertisements to make a relatively wise choice. There is also another obvious advantage of living in a big city considering the chance of receiving better education of our offspring. Schools in big cities may receive more funds from whether the local comities or the government, which may make them more equipped with advanced teaching facilities and attract more excellent teachers. Our children thus will have a better chance of pursuing high-quality education which is very important for their future development. In conclusion, if I want to live a more convenient life with more access to modern facilities as well as with more exposure to various opportunities, and have my children receive a better education, a big city is the place to live in.
llm: The debate about whether to live in a small town or a big city has been ongoing for years. While some people prefer the tranquility and close-knit community of a small town, others, like myself, prefer the fast-paced and dynamic lifestyle of a big city. Despite the advantages of small town life, I firmly believe that living in a big city is the better choice for me, and here's why.First and foremost, finding a job is a top priority for me, and living in a big city makes it much easier to achieve this goal. With a plethora of companies and industries concentrated in one area, the job market is highly competitive, and opportunities are abundant. Moreover, many big cities offer a range of accommodation options, making it possible to find a place to live that is conveniently located near my workplace, saving me time, money, and stress.Another significant advantage of living in a big city is the access to modern facilities and amenities. From state-of-the-art hospitals and medical facilities to world-class shopping malls and entertainment centers, big cities offer a level of convenience and luxury that is hard to find in smaller towns. Additionally, the diversity of restaurants, cafes, and cultural events in big cities means that I can enjoy a wide range of cuisines and experiences that cater to my interests.Finally, living in a big city means being constantly exposed to stimulation and information. With the internet, social media, and 24-hour news cycles, I am always connected to the world and up-to-date with the latest developments. This constant flow of information keeps my mind engaged, and I feel like I am always learning something new. Furthermore, the diversity of people and cultures in big cities means that I am constantly meeting new people, hearing different perspectives, and broadening my understanding of the world.In conclusion, while small towns have their charm, I firmly believe that living in a big city is the better choice for me. With its abundant job opportunities, modern facilities, and constant stimulation, big city life offers a level of convenience, luxury, and engagement that I couldn't find in a small town.

question: Salary increases and promotions to new positions are not the only ways to reward employees for good work. What other rewards for good work can be effective in encouraging further good work? Use specific examples to support your response.
human: It is unquestionable that salary increases and promotions to new positions are very common way to reward employees for good work. Besides the methods, from my point of view, providing professional training can be effective in encouraging further good work. My arguments for this point are listed follows.Firstly, training time can provide employee interesting time outside working office to refresh their mind. Clearly, in company we always have to deal with so many stressful situations such as negotiating with difficult customer, complaining from boss, etc. Therefore, we can unleash uncomfortable in training classes by making new friends, joking in class, enjoying new knowledge.Secondly, employees fell that they are valuable if they are trained. In this case, the employees know that their company is investing on them for future development of their company. So obviously, they will think about develop long term career with their company. For another thing, employees will be very proud of themselves when they are provided training while others don't have this opportunity. Thirdly, providing training will make employees happy with their current job because it help them improve their professional business knowledge. Having professional training help employees gain more confidence in their business, so I believe that they will finish their jobs with excellent result. Of course, excellent working result will make them very happy as well as their boss.In conclusion, providing professional training as a reward for good work has many advantages. Training can help employees refresh their mind as well as make them happy, focus on work. Taking into account of all these factors, we may reach the conclusion that training can be effective in encouraging further good work.
llm: Title: Rewarding Employees: The Power of Professional TrainingIn today's competitive business landscape, recognizing and rewarding employees for their outstanding performance is crucial for driving motivation, productivity, and job satisfaction. While salary increases and promotions to new positions are indeed common and effective ways to acknowledge good work, I firmly believe that providing professional training is another vital aspect that can significantly encourage further good work.On one hand, salary increases and promotions serve as tangible rewards that employees can appreciate, as they often translate to a higher standard of living and increased job security. These rewards can motivate employees to strive for excellence, as they provide a clear incentive for hard work and dedication. However, these methods may not necessarily foster personal and professional growth, which is essential for long-term job satisfaction and success.On the other hand, providing professional training offers a more holistic approach to rewarding employees. By investing in their skills and knowledge, organizations demonstrate a genuine interest in their employees' career advancement and well-being. This, in turn, boosts employees' confidence, job security, and motivation, as they feel valued and empowered to take on new challenges. Professional training also enables employees to stay up-to-date with industry developments, enhancing their overall performance and contributions to the organization.Moreover, professional training can have a ripple effect, leading to a more skilled and adaptable workforce. As employees acquire new skills and expertise, they become more versatile and better equipped to handle diverse tasks and responsibilities. This, in turn, enhances the organization's overall performance, innovation, and competitiveness.In conclusion, while salary increases and promotions are essential rewards, providing professional training is a valuable complement to these methods. By investing in their employees' growth and development, organizations can create a more motivated, skilled, and productive workforce, ultimately driving business success and sustainability.

question: Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
human: Attending university's classes is one of activities that students have to do. However, class is not the only source of knowledge. Students also learn from other sources such as experience, libraries and other people. I think going to classes should be optional for students for the following reasons.Firstly, the reason why university students should not be required to attend class is sometimes the students in the university can learn better from other sources outside the class room. Student can also study by themselves in the library and focus on only the topic they do not understand. For example, I have a close friend who was in the same department with me in the university. She learned quickly and understood everything in class so fast. Thus, she rarely went to class but spent most time to understand confusing topic. Finally, she got very good grade when she was graduation.Secondly, students should not be required to attend classes because they can manage the time spending on classes to do other benefit things if they already understand topic in the class very well. In my experience, many times I did not attend biology class because my university does not require the students to attend classes. Also, I had already studied all biology topics before attending university. As a result, I spent the time of biology class to do my Chemistry research and got A+ for both biology and chemistry.
