By studying the successes and failures of our predecessors, we can gain a deeper understanding of the world and avoid repeating the mistakes of the past. For instance, the mistakes of historical leaders can serve as cautionary tales, while their successes can inspire us to strive for greatness. Moreover, the past is a treasure trove of knowledge in various fields of study, from science and technology to art and literature.By embracing the past, we can also gain a deeper appreciation for the present and a clearer vision for the future. We can learn from the triumphs and tribulations of those who came before us, and use this knowledge to inform our decisions and shape our worldviews. Moreover, the past can serve as a source of inspiration, motivating us to build upon the achievements of previous generations and push the boundaries of human innovation and progress.In conclusion, the past is not a relic to be discarded, but a valuable resource to be tapped. By learning from the successes, mistakes, and knowledge of the past, we can create a brighter future for ourselves and for generations to come. Rather than ignoring the past, we should make full use of it, harnessing its wisdom to build a better world, one lesson at a time.

question: Governments spent a lot of money for traveling outer space. Do you think the investment is reasonable? Give your own opinion and reasons to support you claim
human: Space exploration, for discovery of out of space, has been possible for human in the 20th century. The United state and Russia are the important countries that spend large budgets for the research of this subject. In my opinion, spending the budget for space exploration is an important activity to save living of humanity in the future. Many governments believe that space exploration is an activity that wastes the budget, while the essential challenge of humanity in the future would be the discovery of a new place for the living. In 20th century, although human being succeeded to achieve out of space by means of new technologies such as rockets, but finding a new place for living in another planet is impossible until now. In during history, our planet is threatening by many of other planets or stars and it is an enormous danger for living of humanity. Therefore, it is very significant to find a new place for living in other planets. Space exploration has used as a tools for military power in the cold war. In the future, many countries will try to prevent attach of other countries by using and invention new missiles. In the past, the space race happened between the United Stated and the Soviet Union. Both countries tried to send man to the moon and show their power to each other. As a result, space exploration will use as a military power for many countries.In summary, spending budget for space exploring is not the waste budget, because it may helps to save civilization of humanity. Although exploring space used for discovery of other planets, nowadays most of governments have used many rockets for military purposes and therefore the purposes of exploring space has altered.
llm: Space exploration has long been a cornerstone of human innovation, with the 20th century marking a significant milestone in our quest for discovery beyond Earth's bounds. As we ventured into the unknown, space exploration evolved into a multifaceted endeavor, encompassing scientific inquiry, technological advancement, and even military prowess. In my opinion, allocating a substantial budget for space exploration is crucial for ensuring the long-term survival of humanity.During the Cold War era, space exploration became an integral tool for military power, with the United States and the Soviet Union engaging in a heated space race. This rivalry not only accelerated technological progress but also underscored the strategic importance of space dominance. However, beyond its military applications, space exploration has yielded numerous benefits for humanity.By investing in space exploration, we expand our understanding of the universe, uncovering secrets that can have a profound impact on our daily lives. For instance, research on space weather and solar flares has improved our ability to predict and prepare for natural disasters. Moreover, the technological innovations born from space exploration, such as satellite communications and GPS, have revolutionized the way we navigate and interact with one another.Moreover, space exploration holds the key to addressing some of humanity's most pressing challenges, including resource depletion and climate change. By exploring and potentially harnessing the resources of other planets and celestial bodies, we can mitigate the strain on our planet's finite resources. Furthermore, understanding the effects of climate change on a universal scale can provide valuable insights into preserving our own planet's delicate ecosystem.In conclusion, space exploration is a vital investment for humanity's future. While its military applications are undeniable, its scientific and technological benefits hold far greater promise for the advancement of our species.

question: Do you agree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.Ê
human: Television is one of the greatest innovations that we use every day. Besides, watching television has some cons and at the same time has very good pros. However, while some people argue that TV has devastated communication among friends and families, I believe it has done the opposite. I think TV programs are among the popular topics in every day talk as well as a great time for gathering. In addition Modern TV has smart system that let you be connected with people.First, it's true watching TV take a lot of your day, nevertheless it makes people meet and start a conversation about what they watch at other times like weather forecast and sport programs.Second, people like having meals while they are watching TV. Families usually tend to watch television either with each other or friends. For example my friends and I used to sit together and enjoy watching movies using VHS player at nights. It was fun and a little bit similar to the cinema. Third, TV can be one of communication ways. Moreover, TV can be connected to multimedia devices that have smart operating system like Google TV, WDTV using Skype, tango and other apps. In addition Teenagers can play games online with their friends; therefore we can communicate with each other through TV. To sum up, TV may take some of your time away from your family and friends but it can also make family get together and help to get in conversation. As well as it's one way of recent communications, based on that I think TV helps you to get connected with people.
llm: The advent of television has revolutionized the way we consume information, entertainment, and connect with others. While some argue that television has eroded communication among friends and families, I firmly believe that it has had a profoundly positive impact on our interpersonal relationships.Television has bridged geographical gaps, enabling people to connect with others across the globe. With the rise of satellite TV and international broadcasting, we can now access a vast array of programs from different cultures and countries. This has fostered a sense of global citizenship, allowing us to engage with diverse perspectives and ideas. Moreover, TV has enabled families to bond over shared viewing experiences, creating common topics of conversation and strengthening relationships.Furthermore, television has democratized access to information, making it possible for people from all walks of life to stay informed about current events, news, and educational programs. This has facilitated meaningful discussions and debates, encouraging critical thinking and intellectual exchange among friends and family members. TV has also provided a platform for people to engage with each other through live events, such as sports, music festivals, and award shows, which often spark lively conversations and communal enthusiasm.In addition, television has played a vital role in shaping our cultural identity and preserving our heritage. Through documentaries, historical dramas, and cultural programs, TV has helped to raise awareness about our collective past, promoting a sense of shared history and values. This, in turn, has fostered a deeper understanding and appreciation of our cultural diversity, bringing people closer together.In conclusion, while some may argue that television has undermined communication, I firmly believe that it has had a profoundly positive impact on our relationships. By bridging geographical divides, democratizing access to information, and promoting cultural exchange, TV has brought people closer together, fostering a sense of community and shared experience. As a ubiquitous part of our daily lives, television continues to play a vital role in shaping our connections with others.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship.Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: There is an argument regrading weather letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship. It is widely accepted by many people that a mistake will return sometimes terrible result. However, I believe that friendship is more important than mistake by a friend, although mistake is terrible. In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my opinion. First of all, a mistake does not last for a long time but a friendship lasts forever. Anybody does not remember mistakes. If someone remembers mistake, he or she has a closed mind. I want to say that mistakes will be forgotten quickly. For example, my friend Lee made a mistake that he broke my precious gift. However, I forgot about it just after two days, and I felt at peace with him. Some people might say I am silly, but I think mistake is more forgettable than friendship. Second, Everybody makes mistake. However, if you end a friendship whenever your friend makes a mistake, there will be no friends around you. I agree if a friend makes very a big mistake, we will need to end a friendship. However, when the mistake friend made was not a big problem, we need to understand friend and forgive it because a friend is a gift of our life. According to a research, 85% of people answered that a best gift is a friend.I think that a mistake can not brake friendship if it is not a big because friendship is forever and gift our life.
llm: The age-old adage "to let sleeping dogs lie" is a common phrase that echoes in our minds when we're faced with the dilemma of whether to intervene in a friend's decision-making process. The argument rages on: is it better to let a friend make a mistake and learn from it, or to take action and risk potentially destroying a friendship? As a staunch supporter of non-interference, I firmly believe that letting a friend make a mistake is the better choice. In this essay, I will present two compelling reasons that solidify my opinion.Firstly, allowing a friend to make a mistake fosters personal growth and accountability. When we intervene, we deprive our friends of the opportunity to learn from their errors and develop essential problem-solving skills. By letting them navigate their own mistakes, we enable them to take ownership of their decisions and develop a sense of responsibility. This, in turn, promotes self-awareness, resilience, and emotional intelligence – all of which are crucial for personal development. By contrast, constant intervention can create a culture of dependency, where our friends rely on us to bail them out of trouble, rather than learning to extricate themselves.Secondly, intervening in a friend's decision-making process can lead to unintended consequences that may irreparably damage the friendship. When we offer unsolicited advice or attempt to correct our friends' mistakes, we risk coming across as judgmental, controlling, or even condescending. This can lead to feelings of resentment, hurt, and frustration, ultimately straining the relationship. By choosing not to intervene, we demonstrate our trust in our friends' ability to make decisions, which strengthens the bond of our friendship and fosters a sense of mutual respect.In conclusion, while it may be tempting to intervene in a friend's decision-making process, it is often better to let them make mistakes and learn from them. By doing so, we promote personal growth, accountability, and a stronger, more respectful friendship.

question: One of the best ways that parents can help their teenage children prepare for adult life is to encourage them to take a part-time job.
human: Nowadays, the society has become exceedingly competitive than ever before, parents have the responsibilitis to teach their children to survive and to be indepedent from them, just as animals teach their offspring skills of finding foods. Parents can use many methods to guide them to achieve that, for example, asking them to do some housework or clean the rooms by themselves. In my views, I agree that it is the best way for teenage children to take a part-time job to prepare their adult life for several reasons.First of all, when children get a job, they are able to earn money by themselves, instead of getting pocket money from their parents. Thus, it is an oppertunity to learn how to deal with money. Take me as an example, when I was 16, I found a job during summer vacation and earned some money by own. At the beginning of the semester, I was told to buy a text book. Unfortunately, I spent most of my salary hanging out with my friend. Therefore, I finally realized that I should learn to make a plan before I spend my money, and that did influence me in my life now.Secondly, by taking a part-time job, they certainly have to be responsible for anything they have done. For instance, if a student get a job in a company but he is frequently late for work, the company may reduce his payment or even fire him. To compare with the school life, they might suffer only a small punishment at school. Under the circumstances, he will learn that he has to obey the rule and take responsibility for their work.In conclusion, to help their children to adapt adult life, parents should let them experience it as much as they can. Due to the reasons given above, to encourage children taking a part-time job is a good choice for them to get prepared for adult life.
llm: Title: Preparing for Adulthood: The Importance of Part-time Jobs for TeenagersAs a society, we often emphasize the importance of education in shaping the future of our youth. However, I firmly believe that taking a part-time job is equally crucial for teenage children to prepare them for adult life. In my view, this is the best way for teenagers to transition into adulthood, and I will outline several reasons to support this argument.First and foremost, having a part-time job allows teenagers to earn money independently, rather than relying on pocket money from their parents. This newfound financial freedom not only teaches them the value of hard-earned money but also encourages them to manage their finances responsibly. As they earn their own income, they learn to prioritize their spending, save for the future, and make smart financial decisions.Moreover, a part-time job provides teenagers with essential life skills, such as time management, discipline, and responsibility. When they report to work, they must adhere to a schedule, meet deadlines, and comply with company rules. If they are frequently late or underperform, they may face consequences, such as reduced payment or even termination. These experiences teach them the importance of punctuality, accountability, and reliability, essential qualities for success in their future careers.Furthermore, part-time jobs expose teenagers to real-world scenarios, enabling them to develop problem-solving skills, teamwork, and communication. They learn to interact with colleagues, customers, and supervisors, fostering their interpersonal skills and confidence. By navigating the challenges of a part-time job, teenagers gain valuable insights into the workforce, preparing them for the demands of adult life.In conclusion, taking a part-time job is an invaluable experience for teenage children. It not only teaches them financial responsibility but also instills essential life skills, such as discipline, accountability, and teamwork. As they navigate the workforce, they gain a deeper understanding of the adult world, ultimately preparing them for a successful transition into independent adulthood.

question: It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
human: It’s certainly better for children to grow up in a big city. Of course you need to choose a good neighborhood. I hold this belief because of two main reasons, academic and social reasons.Some people thinks that if a child grows up in a big city they will be all day at home at the computer or at the video-game, but this is not true if you live in a neighborhood with other people about your age as I did. My friends and I used to play soccer, bike, climb trees and do a lot of other stuff every day. We did play video-games, but that wasn't our main activity. In a big city there are more kinds of people and more things to do.I have a friend that grew up in the countryside. He said that he had to study a lot to pass the test to enter the university. This is another downside of growing up in the countryside. In a big city you have more qualified teachers and a better access to technology.Growing up in the countryside is not such a good experience, you won’t know a lot of people, there are gossips everywhere, and your life will be really limited. If someday I have children, I’m absolutely sure that they will grow up in a good neighborhood of a big city and they will be very happy about it.
llm: Living in a big city or the countryside are two different lifestyles that offer distinct experiences and opportunities. As a young adult, I have come to realize that the city offers a more vibrant and diverse environment, while the countryside presents a more restricted and studious lifestyle.In a big city, there are numerous kinds of people from various backgrounds and cultures, making it a melting pot of diversity. The city also offers a wide range of activities and entertainment options, providing endless possibilities for leisure and personal growth. From cultural events to recreational activities, the city has something to offer for everyone. On the other hand, the countryside is characterized by a more limited and tranquil environment. While it may be ideal for studying and focusing on academic pursuits, it lacks the excitement and diversity that the city has to offer.However, one aspect that is common to both the city and the countryside is the presence of gossip. Regardless of where one lives, gossip and rumors can spread quickly, affecting one's reputation and personal life. This is a challenge that one must face in either environment.Despite the similarities, the city and countryside differ significantly in terms of opportunities and lifestyle. Growing up in the countryside requires a strong focus on studying to pass the entrance exams to enter university, which can be a daunting task. On the other hand, the city offers a more balanced lifestyle, with opportunities for education, entertainment, and personal growth.As I look to the future, I am certain that if I have children, they will grow up in the city. The city offers a more dynamic and stimulating environment that will allow them to grow and develop into well-rounded individuals. While the countryside may be ideal for focused studying, the city provides a more comprehensive and exciting lifestyle that I believe is essential for a child's development.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: I completely agree that parents are the best teacher. Children normally think that their parents are somehow special and that makes them the most important people in the children’s lives.Firstly, the things that parents say have great power to their child. More power than any friend or other adult could have. For example, if someone tells a kid that something is wrong and they shouldn't do it, but his father told him/her that it was right, the kid will listen to the father instead of the other person, even if his father is wrong.Secondly, a child normally spends more time with their parents than with other people, so their parents have more time to teach him/her than anybody else. They have more contact and more intimacy with their children. Lastly, children usually mirror themselves on their parents. That’s as important thing because even if the parents don’t intend to teach their children something, they are always observing and learning by themselves. So, if there is a man that beats his wife and treats her bad, his child probably is going to be rude and treat girls bad.All in all, I agree that parents are the greatest teachers and I think that they should be very careful with what they say and do in front of their child, because it can define who he is going to be.
llm: The influence of parents on their children cannot be overstated. The things that parents say have great power over their child, often carrying more weight than the words of friends or other adults. This is largely due to the significant amount of time children spend with their parents, providing them with ample opportunity to impart their values, beliefs, and life lessons.Unlike other relationships, where interactions may be limited to specific settings or periods of time, the parent-child bond is constant and ongoing. Children typically spend more time with their parents than with anyone else, including friends, teachers, or extended family members. This proximity allows parents to have a profound impact on their child's development, shaping their thoughts, feelings, and behaviors in ways that may not be possible for others.Moreover, children often mirror themselves on their parents, adopting their mannerisms, attitudes, and values. This is a natural process, as children look to their parents as role models and strive to emulate them. As a result, the things that parents say and do take on added significance, as children are constantly observing and learning from them. Positive reinforcement, encouragement, and constructive feedback from parents can foster a sense of self-worth, confidence, and resilience in children, while negative comments or behaviors can have the opposite effect.The power of parental influence is a double-edged sword, highlighting the importance of thoughtful and intentional communication. Parents have a unique opportunity to shape their child's worldview, values, and character, and it is essential that they use this influence wisely. By being mindful of the impact of their words and actions, parents can help their children develop into capable, compassionate, and responsible individuals, equipped to navigate the challenges of life. Ultimately, the profound influence of parents on their children serves as a reminder of the significant responsibility that comes with parenting, and the enduring legacy that parents leave on their child's life.

question: Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: The Technology has developed a lot. With that development, food can be prepared more easily and it can taste a lot better than it used to. With that change, people’s lives are a lot better for several reasons. Some good reasons are about having more time and being able to prepare better food without being a good cook.Firstly, people normally have lots of things to do. Because of that, they don’t have much time to spend in the kitchen. But being able to prepare a tasty food just putting it into the microwave or into the oven is awesome. For example, if an engineer needs to make a project, but he needs to deliver it tomorrow, he could save hours preparing a food with the microwave instead of cooking everything from scratch.Secondly, when someone wants to prepare a good food alone for some reason, some time ago he/she would need to be a very good cook to prepare that food, but nowadays is very easy to prepare a healthy and tasty food. For example, if a guy wants to prepare a dinner to his girlfriend, he could just buy some food that comes with instructions. Normally you just need to put it into the oven and wait some time.All in all, that ease to prepare food has improved people’s lives. And that happened mainly because of the development of the technology. But people should be careful with what they eat, because some industrial foods are very bad for their health, so they should buy only food from well known brands.
llm: The rapid development of food processing technology has revolutionized the way we prepare and consume food. With the advancement of industrial food production, meal preparation has become faster and more convenient. The introduction of automated machinery and advanced preservation techniques has enabled mass production of a wide variety of foods, making them more accessible and affordable for the general population. As a result, food can be prepared more easily and efficiently, saving time and effort for individuals.Moreover, industrial food production has also led to significant improvements in food quality and taste. Advanced processing techniques and ingredient manipulation have enabled the creation of a wide range of flavors and textures, making food more enjoyable and diverse. Furthermore, the use of preservatives and additives has extended the shelf life of food products, allowing for global distribution and consumption of a vast array of cuisines.However, with the benefits of industrial food production come significant health concerns. Many processed foods are high in unhealthy ingredients such as saturated fats, added sugars, and sodium, which can lead to a range of diet-related health problems, including obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular disease. Additionally, the widespread use of artificial additives and preservatives has been linked to various health issues, including allergies, intolerances, and even cancer.Therefore, while the development of industrial food production has undoubtedly made food more convenient and enjoyable, it is essential for individuals to be mindful of their dietary choices. It is crucial to read food labels carefully, be aware of the ingredients and nutritional content, and opt for whole, nutrient-dense foods whenever possible. By making informed choices, individuals can reap the benefits of industrial food production while protecting their health and wellbeing. Ultimately, a balanced and mindful approach to food consumption is necessary to fully harness the advantages of modern food technology.

question: Students should be required to take regular standardized tests to prove that they are learning
human: The issue at hand is if the schools should require students to take regular standardized exams. This issue is important because nowadays many people cast doubt on it. However, I believe that standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge.Firstly, standardized tests are preferable due to the fact that they help teachers to fairly grade the students. For example some students are not so active on the lessons, cause they are already familiar with the issue. Therefore, exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students. In addition, many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class, so the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them.Additionally, standardized tests can be good chance for students to apply their knowledge on practice. Since, some students may get used to simply rewriting solved problems from the blackboard, so they will never try to solve problems on their own. However, standardized tests offer them such chance. Thus, it is clear that schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as this option helps to both sides.Finally, I think that requirement to take standardized tests is the right choice, since in this case teachers can compare the level of knowledge of different students. In any class there will be students who will show low academic performance, so teachers could work with them more intensively. I support the points of those who say that standardized tests are required over those who don’t because if the teacher would know the level of each student he would fairly share his time to all of them.Ultimately I feel that schools which obligate their students to take standardized tests are right. I belive this, due to the fact that these schools can qualitatively check if they are giving an appropriate education to their students.
llm: The debate about whether schools should require students to take regular standardized exams has been ongoing for years. While some argue that these exams are unnecessary and create undue stress for students, others believe that they are essential for evaluating student performance and ensuring academic fairness. In this essay, we will argue that standardized exams are a necessary part of the educational system and should be continued.One of the primary reasons why standardized exams are preferable is that they help teachers to fairly grade students. By administering a standardized exam, teachers can assess students' knowledge and understanding of a particular subject in a fair and objective manner. This is particularly important in a classroom setting where teachers may have preconceived notions or biases about certain students. Standardized exams eliminate these biases, ensuring that students are graded solely on their academic performance.Furthermore, many teachers rely heavily on exam results when grading a class. Standardized exams provide teachers with a clear and objective measure of student performance, allowing them to accurately assess student understanding and assign grades accordingly. This is particularly useful in large classes where teachers may not have the time or resources to thoroughly assess each student's performance. By relying on standardized exam results, teachers can ensure that grades are assigned fairly and consistently.In conclusion, standardized exams are a necessary part of the educational system. They provide teachers with a fair and objective measure of student performance, allowing them to accurately assess student understanding and assign grades accordingly. While some may argue that these exams create undue stress for students, the benefits of standardized exams far outweigh the drawbacks. Schools should continue to require students to take regular standardized exams to ensure academic fairness and accuracy in grading.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A university education should be provided free of charge to all interested scholars
human: A famous proverb “Knowledge is power” has demonstrated the value of education. I believe that universities should provide free of cost education to the interested scholars because now-a-days universities with good name charge high fees and this leads one to think about affordability. I have observed that many of the interested scholars failed to get the admission in good universities because they have to think about work along with the studies, and this left them with only one choice, which is work.University is more likely to become a money making business, the issue of affordability has become crucial to the students. In today’s world education is getting expensive, and people are tending to apply for self-finance education in order to get the admission. Whereas, the scholars are facing a lot of difficulties apart from their high requirements of previous education, they has a lot to face the other difficulties and burden while getting admission such as accommodation, food, traveling, clothing, etc.Moreover, it is hard to get manage two things at a time for instance, working and studying is not an easy job for the scholars, they need to concentrate on their studies. MPhils and PhDs scholars are probably engage in the research work, which takes their full concentration and surveys. The idea of free of charge education inspires those scholars who really want to put their efforts and get a degree from best universities.Therefore, universities have to look over the issues face by most of the scholars; their message should be spread education, not making money, and motivate those scholars who want to get education. Their notion should be inspirational in such a way which makes our society educative and increase our literacy rate.
llm: In today's world, education has become a costly affair. The rising expenses associated with pursuing higher education have led to a growing trend of students opting for self-financed education. This phenomenon has sparked an interesting debate about the concept of free education and its potential impact on students' motivation.On one hand, the idea of free education may seem like a utopian dream, but it has the power to inspire scholars who are genuinely passionate about learning. When education is free, students are not burdened by the weight of financial constraints, and they can focus solely on their academic pursuits. This freedom from financial stress allows them to concentrate on their studies, explore their interests, and develop their skills without any hindrances.Moreover, the notion of free education has the potential to bridge the gap between the haves and have-nots. In a world where education is free, students from underprivileged backgrounds can have equal access to quality education, thereby leveling the playing field. This can lead to a more meritocratic society where students are judged solely on their academic prowess, rather than their financial means.However, critics argue that free education is not a sustainable model, as it would require significant government funding and may lead to a lack of accountability among students. While these concerns are valid, it is essential to recognize that the benefits of free education far outweigh the drawbacks.In conclusion, the idea of free education has the power to inspire students who are genuinely passionate about learning. It has the potential to create a more inclusive and meritocratic society, where students are not burdened by financial constraints. As the world grapples with the challenges of rising educational costs, it is essential to explore innovative models of free education that can make quality learning accessible to all.

question: Some people think university professors should spend more time doing research while others think they should spend more time educating students. What is your view?Ê
human: Although professors in a university are basically teachers who do the most important thing, teaching, we cannot ignore one more influential aspect that they are always busy with, doing research. In my opinion, a professor should spend more time doing research rather than educating students for a few reasons following.A professor means a researcher or an expert of a specific science subject. He or she should always keep the passion in her field so that he or she could push him/herself forward all the time. And then he or she can do better in teaching works. For instance, the most impressive professor during my studying in university is Mr. Yang who keeps in researching and reading. He is also the one who gave us inspiration and taught us the way to study more efficient by ourselves. All of my classmates gave him a rank of AAA, the excellent teacher.As for students, we can get what we want to know from textbooks, webs or teachers. But we can only turn to our professors when we want to take part in a research and to get ourselves promoted. If a professor doesn't get any researching works, he cannot give us the opportunity. In addition, a professor who is concentrate in his or her research is thinking and creating new ideas all the time. He or she may stimulate us students to come up with some creative sugesstions. That is good for both of the professor and students.Finally, all professors in the university are fortune of the society. They are the leaders almost in every fields of science, arts, culture and so on. Without their research, there will be no new technologies come out quickly. Without their research, there will be more artcrafts being ruined by nothing. Without their research, there will be less information of our ancestors to be known on the earth.In conclusion, a professor should do their research all the time during their careers as a teacher in university. And it's worth to spend more time on it than on teaching.
llm: Professors in a university are often perceived as simply teachers, whose primary role is to educate students. However, this perspective overlooks the significant impact of their research endeavors. While teaching is undoubtedly a crucial aspect of their job, it is imperative to acknowledge that professors' research activities are equally, if not more, important.There are several reasons why professors should allocate more time to research rather than solely focusing on educating students. Firstly, research drives innovation and progress in various fields. By dedicating more time to research, professors can make groundbreaking discoveries, develop new theories, and contribute to the advancement of their discipline. This, in turn, benefits society as a whole, as new knowledge and technologies emerge from their findings.Secondly, research is a key factor in maintaining a university's reputation and ranking. Institutions that prioritize research are more likely to attract top talent, secure funding, and establish themselves as leaders in their field. Professors who actively engage in research activities not only enhance their own expertise but also elevate the university's profile, making it more attractive to prospective students and faculty.Lastly, research informs and enhances teaching. Professors who are actively involved in research can draw upon their experiences and findings to create more engaging, relevant, and up-to-date course materials. This, in turn, benefits students, who gain a more comprehensive understanding of the subject matter and are better equipped to tackle real-world problems.In conclusion, while teaching is a vital aspect of a professor's role, it is essential to recognize the significance of research in driving innovation, maintaining a university's reputation, and informing teaching practices. By allocating more time to research, professors can make meaningful contributions to their field, benefit society, and ultimately, enrich the educational experience of their students.

question: How do television or movies influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
human: There is no doubt that television or movies influence people’s behavior and they influence us in both bad ways and good ways. But I think in general television and movies influence our behavior in bad ways more than in good ways. They make people to eat more rubbish food, spend less time with their friends and family, and be someone that are not themselves. There are a lot of people eating foods or snacks when they are watching television. Most of the foods they eat are fat foods like chips or pizzas. It is not rocket science to know that these foods are not good for people’s health. Many companies know about this behavior and use advertisements on television to make people buy more of these foods. In turn, people will consume these rubbish foods more and we have to deal with a lot of fat diseases.Television and movies also make people to spend more time on their couch than with their family and friends, especially children. They communicate less with their parents because a lot of their time is used watching television and movies. When people are watching television or movies together, they also talk less to each other, compare to when playing social games, such as parlor games, together.Television and movies nowadays contain a lot of advertisements. These advertisements build ideal images that make people to feel bad about themselves and want to be more like these images. When people see beautiful women and men on the advertisements, they think that they are ugly. Thus they spend a lot of money to buy a lot of beauty products or go to gym to get better appearance or body. When a cool hero characters in a movie smokes and yet a lot of people like him, then people who idolize him may also begin to smoke although they don’t prefer it.I think television and movies are entertaining but most of the time they influence people’s behavior in bad ways. If you want to stay healthy, be yourself and spend time with your family and friends, then you should spend less time watching these media.
llm: The influence of television and movies on people's behavior is a widely debated topic. While some argue that they have a positive impact, it is evident that their negative effects far outweigh their positive ones. In this essay, we will explore how television and movies negatively influence people's behavior.One of the most significant negative influences of television and movies is their impact on people's eating habits. Advertisements for junk food and sugary drinks are prevalent on television and in movies, making them appealing to viewers, especially children. This has led to an increase in consumption of unhealthy foods, contributing to the growing problem of obesity and related health issues. People are more likely to grab a bag of chips or a sugary snack while watching a movie, rather than preparing a healthy meal.Another way in which television and movies negatively influence behavior is by reducing social interaction. Spending excessive time watching television or movies can lead to social isolation, as people spend less time with friends and family. This can have serious consequences, including depression, anxiety, and loneliness. In contrast, engaging in social activities and spending time with loved ones is essential for building strong relationships and maintaining mental health.Television and movies can also influence people's behavior by promoting unrealistic expectations and encouraging them to adopt a false persona. The portrayal of perfect bodies, luxurious lifestyles, and unrealistic relationships can lead to low self-esteem, body dissatisfaction, and a distorted view of reality. People may feel pressured to conform to these unrealistic standards, leading to a loss of individuality and authenticity.In conclusion, while television and movies may have some positive influences on behavior, their negative effects far outweigh their positive ones. They promote unhealthy eating habits, reduce social interaction, and encourage people to adopt a false persona.

question: Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people like to visit museums when they travel to new places, other people don't like to visit museums. I personaly tend to visit museums when I'm in a new place because it's good for me know about the culture, tradition and history of other places.The first reason why people are willing to visit museums when they travel to a new territory is that museums provide a tremendous amount of information about different aspects of the history and culture of that place, as I said back. And also taking the chance for making friends. Visit museums can bring you the opportunity to establish relations and knowledge to participate in conversations. And that kind of knowledge speaks very highly of you.However, other people visit museums are the most boring expirience of a trip. My cousin Pedro literaly hates to visit museums but he really enjoyed his visit to the famous London - Madame Tussaud museum, it was kind of art entertainment but also that visit helped him to understand the artist works, and in addition he started to respect and admire other types of arts that offers in other museums.In coclusion, the museums are a visual source to know the history, tradition and culture of any place in the world. I think it's fun and educational.
llm: Museums have long been revered as treasuries of knowledge, offering a glimpse into the rich history and culture of a particular region. Beyond their educational value, museums also provide a unique opportunity for social interaction, allowing visitors to forge connections and foster meaningful relationships with like-minded individuals.As one navigates the hallowed halls of a museum, they are immersed in a wealth of information that spans centuries, civilizations, and artistic movements. From ancient artifacts to contemporary exhibitions, museums present a vast array of cultural and historical relics that not only educate but also captivate the imagination. By engaging with these exhibits, visitors can gain a deeper understanding of the context and significance of the artifacts on display, broadening their knowledge and appreciation of the world around them.Moreover, museums offer a shared experience that can facilitate social connections and friendships. As strangers gather around a particular exhibit, they are presented with a common topic of discussion, allowing them to engage with one another and establish relationships. These conversations can range from casual observations to in-depth analyses, providing a unique opportunity for individuals to share their perspectives and learn from others.By participating in these conversations, visitors can expand their knowledge and gain new insights, while also developing essential communication skills. Furthermore, the shared experience of visiting a museum can create a sense of camaraderie among strangers, allowing them to connect with others who share similar interests and passions.In conclusion, museums provide a rich and multifaceted experience that extends beyond mere education. They offer a platform for social interaction, allowing visitors to forge connections, establish relationships, and participate in conversations that can broaden their knowledge and understanding of the world. As such, museums remain an indispensable part of our cultural landscape, providing a unique opportunity for individuals to engage with others and enrich their lives through the shared experience of discovery and exploration.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: In a busy and crowded world, we should not expect people to be polite to others.
human: Once a celebrity said: A man's manner is a mirror that reflects his virtues. Recently, the social environment we lived with busy noises and crowded spaces in case that people pay less attentions on their behaviors and manners. They are being rude towards others. Due to this phenomenon, someone suggests that we should not expect people to be polite to other. Obviously, I do not agree with such kind of altitudes, the explanations I explored would be stated as following.First of all, a person with good manner will give others a fine personal impression. Through those impressions, a person was easily to get acquired with others and blended with the community that surrounded him as soon as possible. For example, I worked in a new company, if I am a guy with good manners and treating everyone well, my new colleagues will accept me, even then I will be approved by the employers. In opposite situation if I am being rude, I can not get along well with each other. Finally, I will be fired and have no other choice but lost my job.Secondly, people will get respect from politeness within each other. Politeness and tender words not only can help the speaker to earn a good reputation but also that encourage the listeners who were in need. A successful corporation must have a relationship with respect and pleasure. There are many more facts have improved that people with politeness are easily to be succeed, because from their behaviors, they made their partners or opponents to find their own individual dignity.Finally, the society needs a civilized environment and orders. And a degree of social civilization depend on its people's qualities. In order to create a better living environment for ourselves and our offsprings, our behaviors must be asked with politeness and good manners. Benefit from those effective measures, there may be an obvious effect on the reducing of criminal rate.All in all, I suppose that people should be polite to others in a such busy and crowded world.
llm: The age-old adage, "a man's manner is a mirror that reflects his virtues," holds profound truth. The way an individual conducts themselves, through their behavior, speech, and body language, serves as a window into their character, values, and intentions. A person with good manners exudes a certain charm, creating a favorable impression on those they interact with.Politeness and tender words, in particular, are essential components of good manners. When employed, they have a profound impact on both the speaker and the listener. For the speaker, courteous language and demeanor can earn them a reputation as a kind, considerate, and compassionate individual. This, in turn, fosters respect, trust, and admiration from others, leading to stronger, more meaningful relationships.Moreover, the listeners, especially those in need, greatly benefit from encountering individuals with good manners. A gentle tone, empathetic words, and a listening ear can be a balm to the weary soul. It can provide solace, reassurance, and encouragement, helping to uplift and motivate. When we treat others with kindness and respect, we create a ripple effect, inspiring them to do the same, and contributing to a more harmonious and supportive community.In contrast, a lack of good manners can lead to strained relationships, misunderstandings, and conflict. When we prioritize politeness and tender words, we not only reflect positively on ourselves but also create a positive impact on those around us. As we navigate our daily interactions, it is essential to remember that our mannerisms have the power to inspire, uplift, and bring people together.In conclusion, good manners are indeed a mirror that reflects our virtues. By embracing politeness and tender words, we not only project a positive image but also contribute to a more compassionate and supportive environment. As we strive to become better versions of ourselves, it is essential to prioritize good manners, recognizing the profound impact they can have on ourselves and those around us.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
human: There is a famous old saying that failure is the mother of success. For that reason, some people advocate that some difficulties people met at their early ages will become an invaluable fortune in their future lives. However, some people think it isn't supposed to be that case. From my point of view, I am in favor the former statement that some tough experiences people met before will be helpful in their life path.To start with, hardship makes people realize how to cherish and compliment the common but wonderful little things happened in their life such as, a shining weather, a delicious breakfast and etc. People who have such nice spirit usually know how to find the true love in their life instead of being seduced by greed as to lose themselves in the end. As a result, experiences of difficulties teach them how to keep a nice mood and have confidence all the time.What's more, people who experienced lots of difficulties will be calmer when they are in troubles. Because they already have such experiences of overcoming some difficulties, they are conscious of what to do and how to do when fierce crisis happens. Those people are more likely to achieve their ambitions in their career because they are aware of how to lead people to reach success despite what kind of difficulties are getting in their way.So, to sum it up, both not afraid of difficulties and appreciating common but pleasant things in their lives drive me to believe that most tough experiences in people's life path will be a priceless treasure to them. Remember if you are afraid of encountering difficulties, then you will be in the troubles all the time.
llm: The notion that the difficulties people encounter in their early years will ultimately become an invaluable fortune in their future lives is a topic of much debate. While some may argue that these challenges can be detrimental to one's development, I firmly believe that they can indeed have a profoundly positive impact on an individual's life path.To begin with, hardship has a way of teaching people to appreciate the small, yet wonderful things in life. When one is faced with adversity, they are forced to re-evaluate their priorities and find joy in the everyday moments that often go unnoticed. This ability to cherish and compliment the little things in life is a valuable asset that can bring a sense of happiness and contentment to one's life. For instance, a person who has experienced financial difficulties in their youth may learn to appreciate the simple pleasures of life, such as spending time with loved ones or enjoying nature, rather than relying on material possessions for happiness.Moreover, people who have faced numerous difficulties in their lives tend to be calmer in the face of trouble. Having already overcome significant challenges, they are better equipped to handle future obstacles with ease. This sense of calm and composure can be a powerful tool in both personal and professional settings, allowing individuals to make rational decisions and navigate complex situations with greater ease. Furthermore, the experiences of overcoming adversity can instill a sense of resilience and determination, driving individuals to push through challenges that might otherwise seem insurmountable.In conclusion, I firmly believe that the difficulties people encounter in their early years can indeed become an invaluable fortune in their future lives. By teaching individuals to appreciate the little things in life and equipping them with the calm and resilience needed to navigate challenges, these experiences can have a profoundly positive impact on one's life path.

question: Life in a city is much better than life in the countryside
human: As far as I am concerned, I agree with the statement that life in a city is much better than life in the countryside.Firstly, in the city there is much better education system. This means, that the schools and the universities have well equipped classes and the famous professors would like to work in such places.In addition, I believe that city provides more work opportunities than the countryside. There are not only more jobs, but they are also well-paid. Of course living in a city is more expensive, but incomes are higher too.Moreover, in the urban areas there are also more citizens what means, that the culture diversity is huge. Meeting and knowing new people's tradition is an unforgettable experience, which could influence on one's previous habits.Furthermore, the city has well-organised lines of transport. The buses and trains are more frequent than in the countryside, so the city provides better communication.However, in the countryside there are many places to rest, because of its location. Moreover, peaceful and close to the nature areas could help to avoid worries and sadness.Taking all into account, I think that living in the city is much better nowadays, because of the opportunities it gives. Today living in the rural places is in most causes connected with agrarian lifestyle, which for me is without perspective. If I could decide I would chose living in the city for sure.
llm: The debate about whether city life or rural life is superior has been ongoing for years. While both options have their advantages and disadvantages, it is clear that city life offers a more comprehensive and dynamic experience.One of the primary reasons why city life is more appealing is the superior education system. Cities have more resources and better-funded schools, which provide students with a wider range of academic and extracurricular opportunities. Additionally, cities offer more job opportunities, with a diverse range of industries and career paths available. This diversity is also reflected in the cultural landscape of cities, where people from different backgrounds and ethnicities come together to create a vibrant and dynamic community. With more citizens living in close proximity, cities offer a unique cultural experience that is hard to find in rural areas.In terms of communication, cities also have an advantage. With more frequent bus and train services, it is easy to get around and connect with others. This infrastructure also facilitates the exchange of ideas and innovation, making cities hubs of creativity and progress.On the other hand, the countryside has its own unique advantages. The peaceful and serene environment provides a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of city life. With more open spaces and natural scenery, the countryside is an ideal place to relax and unwind. Furthermore, the slower pace of life in rural areas can be beneficial for those looking to escape the stresses of modern life.In conclusion, while both city and rural life have their advantages, the benefits of city life are more significant. The superior education system, diverse job opportunities, and vibrant cultural scene make cities an attractive option for those looking to live a dynamic and fulfilling life.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Your job has more effect on your happiness than your living environment does.
human: With the development of the economy, people become more and more rich. They start to pay attention to mental requirement like happiness. While I accept that job can offer happiness to some people, I believe that living environment is more important than job for most of us.Admittedly, job can bring us happiness. People can receive a sense of values and respected from job. If people receive respect from others, they will feel achievement and self-confidence. In addition, job can provide money to us. However, people should concern more about their living environment than job. First, for most of us, job is only a tool to maintain our lives. Few people can feel happiness from their job because they have to continue to work more than 30 years. For example, Workers in the FOXCONN factory, which is the main manufacture of APPLE Company, just repeat one action more than 8 hours every day. These labor works cannot provide workers with a lot of happiness because they feel tired and frustrated after long hour work. Second, beautiful environment is one of basic physiological needs, which are the most fundamental requirements for people. Without beautiful environment, people are not able to feel happiness and will fell anxiety. Nowadays, the fast development of economy is gradually destroying our environment very quickly. Factories released a huge amount of wasters into river and soil. In order to build city and factory, people destroy huge forests. In China, some residents who live in nearby some toxic factories became sick because these factories release a lot of toxic water and wasters into environment around people. Even though local residents benefits from an increasing number of jobs which are provided by those factories, they cannot feel happiness from high-paying job yet because most of them suffer from cancer or other diseases.In conclusion, it is far better to protect our living environment rather than focus on job or work since the goal people is for good livers.
llm: The increasing affluence of society has led to a shift in priorities among individuals. As people's basic needs are met, they begin to focus on more abstract mental requirements, such as happiness. While some may find happiness in their careers, I firmly believe that one's living environment plays a more significant role in determining overall satisfaction for the majority of people.On one hand, a fulfilling job can undoubtedly bring joy and a sense of accomplishment to some individuals. A career that aligns with one's passions and values can provide a sense of purpose and motivation, leading to increased happiness. However, this is not the case for everyone. Many people find themselves stuck in unfulfilling jobs, struggling to make ends meet, or working long hours that leave them exhausted. For these individuals, happiness is not derived from their job, but rather from their living environment.On the other hand, one's living environment has a profound impact on their overall well-being. A safe, comfortable, and beautiful home can provide a sense of security and tranquility, allowing individuals to recharge and relax after a long day. Access to nature, community spaces, and social connections can also greatly contribute to one's happiness. Moreover, a living environment that promotes physical activity, healthy eating, and adequate sleep can have a direct impact on both physical and mental health, leading to increased happiness.In conclusion, while a job can offer happiness to some, I believe that one's living environment is more crucial in determining overall satisfaction for most people. As society continues to prioritize mental requirements like happiness, it is essential to focus on creating living environments that promote well-being, rather than solely relying on careers to bring joy. By doing so, we can create a more balanced and fulfilling life that caters to the needs of both body and mind.

question: Some people like to communicate by e-mail and voice mail. Other people like to communicate by telephone or face-to-face. Which type of communication do you prefer?
human: Technology has been developing so quickly and becoming more perfect every day. Communication nowadays depends on technology pretty much. Voice mail, e-mail, telephone or just traditional way: face-to-face. However, I prefer e-mail due to 3 reasons: convenience, honest expression and fluency in communicating.Everyone agrees that e-mail has been a great way of communication. You can talk to others from thousands mile. For instance, if you are in Vietnam and another person is in the US - half of the Earth, no matter how far it is, you can keep contact. We will never have to worry if our mails will be sent to the right address. If the address is wrong, then you will know right away. Moreover, e-mail doesn't take too much time: just a click.In addition, writing e-mail helps people express honestly. Some people think that the face-to-face conversations make them feel stupid. Sometimes, their ideas are not expressed as exactly as they expect. For instance, I want to talk to my friend about a ticklish problem like her behavior, it's hard for me to face her and explain what she should do. Therefore, e-mail will be a good tool to help me speak out. She will just read my e-mail instead of listening to my voice which can make her annoyed. I don't have to worry about any other thing can make my opinion become unpersuasive.Last but not least, every communication needs fluency so people can understand each other exactly and remember it for a long time. Voice email or face-to-face conversations sometimes make reserve people feel not very confident. For example, when I face my parents, I can't speak out every idea and express consecutively. They may stop me, speak something against it and that makes me forget what I want to say. Anyone can meet this problem once in any conversation. E-mail helps me arrange my idea perfectly and make it persuasive. On the whole, to compare to all ways of communication, I really think that e-mail is the greatest way for major people to use. Its convenience saves our time. Additionally, honesty is necessary for every conversation and also fluency can't be missing for a persuasive expression.
llm: The advent of technology has revolutionized the way we communicate, offering a multitude of options for staying in touch with others. We can choose from voicemail, email, telephone, or traditional face-to-face interactions. While each method has its unique advantages, I firmly believe that email stands out as the most preferred mode of communication for me, owing to three compelling reasons: convenience, honest expression, and fluency in communication.Firstly, email offers unparalleled convenience. With the ability to send and receive messages at any time and from any location, email has made it possible to transcend geographical boundaries and time zones. This asynchronous nature of email allows me to respond to messages at my own pace, without the pressure of immediate responses that comes with phone calls or face-to-face conversations.Secondly, email provides a platform for honest expression. When communicating in person or over the phone, there can be pressure to respond impulsively, potentially leading to misunderstandings or miscommunications. Email, on the other hand, affords me the luxury of time to gather my thoughts, articulate my ideas, and edit my responses before hitting send. This thoughtful approach to communication fosters clarity and reduces the likelihood of misinterpretations.Lastly, email enables fluency in communication. Unlike face-to-face interactions where thoughts may be lost in the moment, or phone calls where ideas may be misunderstood due to poor reception, email allows me to craft and convey my thoughts in a clear, concise manner. This written record of our exchange also serves as a valuable reference point, reducing the risk of misremembering important details or actions.In conclusion, while technology has opened up numerous avenues for communication, I firmly believe that email is the most effective and preferred method for me. Its convenience, ability to facilitate honest expression, and fluency in communication make it an indispensable tool in both personal and professional settings.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: There are many interesting programs on television which anyone can enjoy at little cost. Compared to other hobbies such as going to theater or going to sports stadium, it is a very cost-effective hobby that gives viewer quiet a few indirect experiences. However, from my point of view, television has more bad than good because it has made people not to have conversation each other.To begin with, television shows make people forget what is really important. One who has favorite programs tends to be obessed with them when they are on air. Thus, they cannot make appointment or go out with their family or friends at that time since they think the programs are so crucial to their lives. One of my friends, for example, once cancelled an appointment to play basketball with in order to watch the favorite television show "Infinete Challenges". This is not only about basketball, but also about our friendship, which depends on how often we meet and have a chance to talk to each other. That is, watching television alone at home, my friend lost the opportunity to increase cohesion between us.Moreover, even when people watch television together, there is no chance for them to have conversation in front of television. Watching television program together is not that different from watching same program alone. Thus, it is not good for them to watch television if they want to improve their sense of closeness. To illustrate my point, it is reported that most of people don't converse with their family when they are watching television together. It is natural they behave in that way because television shows don't require any participation.In conclusion, I firmly believe that it is detrimental to communication among members in group, family or friends or whatever, to sit in front of television and just stare forward. It is because television not only makes people be obsessed with it but also makes their mouth close.
llm: The Impact of Television on Human InteractionIn recent years, the advent of television has revolutionized the way people spend their leisure time. While television has its benefits, such as providing entertainment, education, and information, its negative impacts far outweigh its positive effects. One of the most significant drawbacks of television is its impact on human interaction and conversation.Television has led to a decline in face-to-face conversations among people. With the abundance of TV shows and programs available, people are increasingly spending more time glued to their screens, leaving little time for meaningful interactions with others. This has resulted in a society where people are more comfortable interacting with their televisions than with each other. Social skills, such as active listening and responding, are being lost as people rely more on their TVs for entertainment and companionship.Furthermore, television shows often distract people from what is truly important in life. Many programs focus on materialism, consumerism, and superficial values, leading viewers to prioritize these aspects over more meaningful pursuits. For instance, reality TV shows often promote a culture of competition and individualism, while neglecting values like empathy, cooperation, and community building. As a result, people become so engrossed in their favorite programs that they forget to engage with their surroundings, neglecting their relationships, health, and personal growth.Another negative consequence of television is the obsessive behavior it fosters in its viewers. Fans of particular shows often become fixated on them, spending hours in front of the TV, waiting for the next episode. This obsession can lead to an unhealthy dependence on television, causing individuals to neglect their responsibilities, relationships, and overall well-being.

question: Some people like to communicate by e-mail or voice mail. Other people like to communicate by telephone or face-to-face. Which type of communication do you prefer and why?
human: Although many people prefer communicating by telephone or face-to-face, personally I believe that communicating by e-mails or voice mails is better. There are several reasons to support this idea which I would like to mention in this essay.Firstly, communicating by e-mail is easy. Many people have problems with calling a person that they are not acquainted with. In this case it is not so difficult to write an e-mail or to leave a voice mail because even shy people feel themselves more confident.Secondly, you can write an e-mail at any time of the day. As for me, I work and study at the university and I don't have spare time during the day. I get home at about midnight and I still need to answer some questions and to solve some routine problems. I might not have time to call a person or to meet with him or her in an appropriate time so for me it is better to leave a voice mail.Thirdly, when you write an e-mail you have enough time to think carefully about what you are writing and how it would be better to express yourself. For example, you can change the word order or you can choose more appropriate style to sound more polite. When you speak face-to-face you are not as able to control every word as you are when you write an e-mail.And finally, there is no chance to disturb people by sending them an e-mail. You should not worry about interrupting an important conversation or some other business.To sum up, I would like to say that for me both options of communicating are possible, but if this is an important and not urgent question I would prefer to answer it by means of internet or voice mail.
llm: The Rise of Digital Communication: Why E-mails and Voice Mails Reign SupremeIn today's fast-paced world, communication is key. While many people still prefer traditional methods of communication such as telephone or face-to-face interactions, I firmly believe that communicating through e-mails or voice mails is the better option. This essay will highlight the reasons behind my stance, providing insight into the benefits of digital communication.First and foremost, e-mails and voice mails offer an ease of communication that is unmatched by traditional methods. For many individuals, the prospect of calling someone they are not acquainted with can be daunting. Writing a voice mail or composing an e-mail, on the other hand, alleviates this anxiety, allowing for a more natural flow of communication. This is particularly significant in professional settings, where initial contact is often made with someone unknown.Another significant advantage of digital communication is its flexibility. Unlike traditional telephone communication, which is time-bound, e-mails can be written at any time of the day. This flexibility is especially beneficial for those with busy schedules, allowing them to manage their communications at their convenience. As someone who values flexibility, I find this aspect of digital communication particularly appealing. It enables me to stay in touch with others without being tied to specific times, enhancing both personal and professional relationships.In conclusion, the benefits of communicating through e-mails and voice mails far outweigh those of traditional methods. Not only do they offer ease and convenience, but they also cater to the increasingly fast-paced nature of our lives. As we move forward in this digital age, embracing these forms of communication will undoubtedly lead to more effective and stress-free interactions.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement "haste makes waste" use specific reasons and examples.
human: This saying is stating that every fast and not well thought decision is a wasted one. In my opinion, this statement is completely true, for these few reasons:For one thing, making a quick decision means that it's not very thought out, and that it hasn't been checked from all its aspects. Consequently, making quick decisions leads to probable bad results. For example: if someone decided to quit his job without really thinking about the alternative, or a plan B, he could end up being unemployed, because of his speedy decision.In addition, making a rushed decision could also mean that the person is missing out on a potential opportunity. In another word, if this person had waited and thought his decision through he wouldn't have missed out on the job opening in the same firm, but at a different position. Hence, he wouldn't have been unemployed.Not to mention, that hasty decisions, not only goes to waste, but also, could affect the entire life of the person. To put it differently, is that after this person has quit his job and became unemployed, he can no longer pay his bills nor buy what he needs for his everyday needs, thus, his life had taken a turn to the worst.As can be seen from this, is that a hurried decision is almost never a good one. That's why one should always study his decision carefully and slowly, to ensure that the decision that the person is making is the best for him.
llm: The old adage "haste makes waste" has been a guiding principle for many individuals throughout history. In today's fast-paced world, where instant gratification and quick fixes are often prioritized, it's easy to get caught up in making hasty decisions. However, the reality is that every fast and not well-thought-out decision is indeed a wasted one. Making quick decisions, without careful consideration and deliberation, often leads to probable bad results.When we rush into decisions, we often overlook crucial details, neglect to weigh our options, and fail to consider the long-term consequences. This impulsiveness can lead to choices that are not in our best interest, resulting in wasted time, resources, and opportunities. Moreover, hurried decisions can have a ripple effect, impacting not only our immediate circumstances but also our future prospects.The consequences of impulsive decisions can be far-reaching, affecting every aspect of our lives. For instance, a hasty decision in our personal relationships can lead to strained connections and damaged reputations. In our professional lives, a rushed choice can result in a mismatched career path, stifling our growth and potential. Even in our financial lives, impulsive decisions can lead to debt, financial insecurity, and a lifetime of regret.Furthermore, the cumulative effect of repeated hasty decisions can be devastating. A pattern of impulsive choices can lead to a lifetime of missed opportunities, unrealized potential, and lingering "what ifs." In extreme cases, a single rash decision can alter the course of our entire life, leading to a lifetime of regret and "if onlys."In conclusion, the wisdom of "haste makes waste" is a timeless truth that holds significant relevance in today's fast-paced world. By recognizing the pitfalls of quick decisions and adopting a more thoughtful and deliberate approach, we can avoid the waste and regret that often accompanies hasty choices.

question: Some people think that the automobile has improved modern life. Others think that the automobile has caused serious problems. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Nowadays the automobile is one of the most significant forms of transportation in everyday life. Many people own cars and use them daily, which clearly shows how important they are. Generally speaking, I definitely agree with the statement that cars have improved modern life, for several reasons.Firstly, people are now able to overcome long distances in a short amount of time, which leads to numerous advantages. For example in relationships. Many people are now able to maintain relationships over great distances because they can visit each other regularly by using their vehicle. From my personal experience I recall that my car has always been a great help to see my childhood friends very often although I lived in another city. I was also able to establish a relationship with a man living 89 kilometers away. Thanks to my car we could see each other at the weekends and are still a happy couple today. Without my automobile we would probably not have been able to develop a relationship.In addition, cars increase the chance of employment because people are able to drive to work and can work further away from home. Furthermore, they are more flexible. My father for example has always been working all around Germany and because of that earned more money.
