He used his car to drive to the other end of the country, worked there during the week and came home for the weekend. If he had no car, he wouldn't be able to see his family at the weekends so for him his automobile is a great benefit - not only in financial but also in social terms.Finally, the automobile allows people to travel more often and thus get to know the world. If people do not own cars they are likely to stay in their hometown or village most of their life. They are mainly using public transport and are thus limited in accessing certain areas. There are still places in nearly every country in the world that cannot be reached by public transportation and can only be visited by car. As a result, people who own a vehicle have greater access to more places and will see more of the world.In conclusion, the above stated reasons clearly outweigh the fact that cars cause a lot of pollution because they provide flexibility, which is important in nearly all areas of life. Travelling, social life and employment are highly dependent on the flexibility of a person and there is nothing in the world that makes more flexible than an own car.
llm: The automobile is undoubtedly one of the most significant forms of transportation in our daily lives. With millions of cars on the roads worldwide, it is evident that many people own and use them on a daily basis, highlighting their importance in our lives. The impact of the automobile on our lives extends beyond mere transportation, as it has revolutionized the way we live, work, and interact with one another.The automobile has made traveling easier and more accessible, enabling people to explore the world beyond their immediate surroundings. With a car, people can travel to distant places, explore new cultures, and experience the beauty of nature. This has not only broadened our horizons but also fostered global understanding and exchange. The automobile has also enabled people to commute to work, school, and other essential destinations, facilitating economic growth and social development.Moreover, the automobile has transformed the way we live and work. With the flexibility to travel whenever and wherever we want, people have more time for leisure activities, personal pursuits, and socializing. The automobile has also enabled the growth of suburbanization, allowing people to live in the outskirts of cities and commute to work, thereby improving their quality of life.In conclusion, the automobile is an integral part of our daily lives, and its significance extends beyond mere transportation. It has enabled us to travel, explore, and experience the world, thereby broadening our perspectives and fostering global understanding. As the world continues to evolve, the automobile is likely to remain a vital part of our lives, shaping the way we live, work, and interact with one another.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: It is better for children to choose jobs that are similar to their parents job than to choose jobs that are very different from their parents jobs.
human: When choosing a job, one need to consider it thoroughly. Whether to choose a job which is similar to parents' job or not, different people may hold different opinions. As far as I am concerned, I think choosing the job that is similar to parents' jobs could benefit to one's career. First of all, as parents are involved in the same environment, they could thus support much more to their children, such as domain knowledge and industry-related information. For example, my father is a software programmer, and he indeed teaches me a lot in programming and some computer knowledge. Whenever I met a difficulty, I would reach him for consulting. Because he has many experiences, I could save enormous time in finding solution. This truly makes me more competitive than my colleagues. If I worked in the different field from my father, I would have faced much difficulty than I do now.Nevertheless, since parents have worked in tens of years, they have accumulated a rich network in a certain industry. They have a deep insight in it and could provide much support to their children. For instance, they know which company has better welfare or provides better education. Moreover, their friends in the same industry can even help to write recommendation letters to some certain companies. It is undoubted that a good recommendation letter is extraordinary important in this competitive society. When others are still struggling in preparing their resume, one with a good recommendation letter has already passed the first stage in the interviewing process. Some may argue that as time is different, the condition of job market is completely different. Therefore, choosing a job similar to one's parents' is not always a correct decision. I agree with this opinion to some extent, but when it comes to the trend, no one can predict it correctly. The condition of job market changes enormously fast like a flash, so that there is no way to predict any job can be popular for 30 years or more.In considering whether one should choose a job similar to his or her parents', I have mentioned a few reasons that one can get more support from his or her parents if they are in the same industry. I believe parents can lead their children to a more smooth career path.
llm: Title: Following in Their Footsteps: The Benefits of Choosing a Job Similar to Your Parents'Choosing a job that is similar to your parents' can be a strategic career move, offering numerous benefits that can propel you towards success. One of the primary advantages of following in your parents' professional footsteps is the invaluable support they can provide. As they are already familiar with the environment and industry, they can offer domain-specific knowledge, industry-related information, and valuable insights that can help you navigate your career more effectively.Parents who work in the same field as their children can provide guidance, mentorship, and networking opportunities that can be instrumental in launching and advancing their careers. They can also offer practical advice on how to overcome common challenges, avoid pitfalls, and capitalize on opportunities. Moreover, their experience and connections in the industry can help their children secure internships, job placements, or valuable recommendations.Some may argue that the job market is constantly evolving, and what worked for their parents may not be applicable today. However, while it is true that the job market has undergone significant changes, the fundamental principles of success in most industries remain the same. Hard work, dedication, and a willingness to learn and adapt are still essential qualities for achieving success. Parents who work in the same field as their children can provide guidance on how to develop these qualities and navigate the changing landscape of their industry.In conclusion, choosing a job that is similar to your parents' can be a wise career decision. The support, guidance, and industry insights they can provide can help you navigate your career more smoothly and achieve success more quickly. By following in their footsteps, you can capitalize on their experience and expertise, and set yourself up for a successful and fulfilling career.

question: Should we pay professional athletes (entertainers) a high salary? (Do professional athletes deserve their high salary?)Ê
human: Professional athletes and entertainers earn a huge amount of money that is hard to imagine. Most of the people spending their whole life can never achieve this. This salary gap between those famous people and us leads to a question-do those professional athletes and entertainers deserve this money? From my prospect, I believe that they do deserve this high payment.First of all, a worker's salary can properly reflect his/her competence and value on his/her career. Therefore, those who are paid high salaries must exceed others and achieve something incredible in certain ways. They are not paid for no reason. As we are now live in a competent world, we must show ourselves to be great enough so as to convince the employer that we deserve a better payment. It's all the same in every profession. That's why the richest athletes usually correspond to the greatest athletes in their fields, namely Michael Jordan or Tiger Woods.Second, such high salaries can also guarantee and support the athlete's great performances. Most of us only see the luxurious side of a rich athlete and ignore how may difficulties they've gone through and how much cost they've thrown into investing themselves. They shall reap within their high salaries. In other words, if they are not paid high enough in order to conform to their performances, there might not be such brilliant performances for us to be amazed. Some people might argue that the gap between the rich athletes and normal people is so huge that it seems to be unfair. However, in my opinion, as long as everyone has equal chances to pursue his/her dreams and careers, that would be fair. Fairness is not about equal payments for everyone, but equal chances to acquire the same goal or accomplishment.In conclusion, high salary for athletes is what they deserve in accordance with their own achievements and also a guarantee for quality performances. It is a positive encouragement for many more talented people to contribute to the world of athletics and entertainment, giving us awesome performances to enjoy.
llm: The remuneration of professional athletes and entertainers is often a topic of heated debate. Many people find it hard to fathom the astronomical sums they earn, and some may argue that the vast chasm between their pay and that of ordinary individuals is unfair. However, from my perspective, I firmly believe that these athletes and entertainers deserve every penny of their substantial earnings.Firstly, a worker's salary is a direct reflection of their competence and the value they bring to their profession. Professional athletes and entertainers are among the crème de la crème in their fields, possessing exceptional skills and talents that captivate millions of fans worldwide. Their hard work, dedication, and passion for their craft have earned them a spot at the pinnacle of their industries. As such, their salaries should mirror their exceptional abilities and the immense entertainment value they provide.Secondly, the high salaries of athletes and entertainers serve as a guarantee for their outstanding performances. With lucrative contracts come immense pressure to deliver results, pushing these individuals to consistently improve and perfect their craft. Moreover, their substantial earnings allow them to invest in top-notch training facilities, coaches, and support staff, further ensuring they stay at the top of their game. This, in turn, benefits fans who get to witness breathtaking displays of athleticism and artistry.Furthermore, the salaries of professional athletes and entertainers have a trickle-down effect, boosting the economy and creating opportunities for others. They often invest in philanthropic endeavors, sponsor aspiring talent, and contribute to the growth of their respective industries.In conclusion, the enormous salaries of professional athletes and entertainers are a testament to their remarkable abilities and the value they bring to the world of sports and entertainment. While the pay gap between them and ordinary individuals may seem vast, it is a reflection of their hard work, dedication, and exceptional talents. They deserve every penny of their earnings, and their success has a positive impact on the world at large.

question: Should we require our young children (aged 5-10) to learn music and art in addition to math, science, history and language?
human: Every parents expect their children to be outstanding and successful. In order to achieve this, they start cultivating their children when they are very young. In addition to basic knowledge like language or science, music and art are usually on the must-learn list of the parents. In my opinion, I agree that children should learn music and art in a young age because they do contribute several merits to them. First, it's very suitable for children to develop senses of music and art when they are young. Children absorb things quickly and they bear exact the ability needed in music and art-imagination. Music and art are not like math or language which has more strict rules. They are more abstract, requiring creativity and imagination to be enriched. Children are privileged to have these abilities because they are given more freedom and their imagination has not yet been killed due to reality circumstances. Even if their performances are just some simple drawings and melodies, music and art still bring out children's joy of flying in imagination.Second, music and art are life-long cultivation worthy of investing. They teach us how to appreciate beauty and express feelings in a creative way. They are essential to our spiritual life. Therefore, even if children are not going to be great musicians or artists, learning music and art is still worthy because it can nourish your temper and serve as a leisure.However, some people might argue that parents shouldn't put so much stress on children, since learning too many skills seems to be a burden for them. In my opinion, it depends on how you value these learning activities to be like. If parents push their 5 years old child to play piano 8 hours a day just like a professional performer, that might be too much. In a child stage, music and art are more like an open door to introduce the art world than training area to acquire specific skills. In this way, it will not be such pressure on children. In conclusion, young age is the perfect time for children to learn music and art and they are indeed valuable to people not only in their young stage, but in every stage. Music and art can accompany a spirit as long as they are given the chance to enter his/her life.
llm: Music and art are often considered essential skills for children to learn, with many parents including them on their must-learn list. In my opinion, this emphasis on music and art education is not only suitable but also highly beneficial for young children.Developing a child's senses through music and art is a lifelong cultivation that is well worth investing in. From a young age, children are naturally curious and receptive to new experiences, making it the perfect time to introduce them to the world of music and art. Learning to play a musical instrument or creating art helps children develop their fine motor skills, hand-eye coordination, and creativity, all of which are essential for cognitive development.Moreover, music and art education can have a profound impact on a child's emotional and social development. Music, in particular, has been shown to have a calming effect on children, reducing stress and anxiety while improving their mood and focus. Art, on the other hand, provides an outlet for children to express themselves, communicating their thoughts and emotions in a healthy and constructive manner.In addition to these benefits, music and art education can also shape a child's temperament and character. By learning to appreciate and create music and art, children develop important life skills such as discipline, perseverance, and self-expression. These skills, in turn, help children develop a more positive and resilient temperament, better equipping them to navigate life's challenges.In conclusion, music and art are essential skills that every child should have the opportunity to learn. By introducing them to music and art at a young age, parents can provide their children with a lifelong cultivation that will nourish their mind, body, and soul. The benefits of music and art education are numerous and far-reaching, making them an invaluable investment in a child's future.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The best way for teachers to make students more interested in a subject is explaining how that subject will help in their lives outside school.
human: There are many ways of teaching. Some people believe that strictly and carefully presenting theories in the class is the best way of teaching, while others assert that involving applications on that theory will be more convincing. In my opinion, I agree with the second idea that the best way for teachers to make students more interested in a subject is to explain how that subject can help and apply to their lives outside school.First of all, by explaining how the subject contributes to daily life, students will have vivid impression on that subject thus become more interested and active in acquiring the knowledge on that subject. Take chemistry for example, merely memorizing the names of the substances and the structural formulas seems to be very boring, while representing where and how those chemical reactions really happen near students will raise their curiosity and lead them to digest those theories learned from the class. While I was in senior high school, my chemical teacher once showed us how the detergent dissolves oil by an experiment and later on taught us how to describe this process with formal structural formulas. This type of learning method is more fun and eventually the results are good. I connected the visual images of that experiment with the formula and I barely forget, even though now I'm not studying chemistry anymore.Second, by bridging the theories with daily life events, students are given the chance to apply knowledge to their lives and develop their own ability of problem-solving. This will address students' interests because it's the assignment that needs real life participation. For example, in law class, students are informed their rights and duties and they are taught how they can apply law to different situations that might happen upon them. When any one of the situations occurs, they can think independently and figure out how to react.In conclusion, using life experiences and examples to demonstrate the knowledge on a subject is an effective way to attract students' attention and keep them eager on learning, not only because it reinforces students' impression on the knowledge but also invites students to practice the knowledge out on their own.
llm: Making students interested in a subject is a challenging task for teachers. There are many ways to achieve this, but in my opinion, the best way is to explain how that subject can help and apply to their lives outside school.When students see the relevance of a subject to their everyday lives, they become more engaged and motivated to learn. By explaining how the subject contributes to daily life, teachers can help students make connections between the classroom and the real world. For example, in a math class, a teacher can explain how mathematical concepts such as percentages and ratios are used in shopping and cooking. This helps students to see that math is not just a abstract concept, but a practical tool that they can use in their daily lives.By making these connections, students will have a vivid impression of the subject and become more active in acquiring knowledge. They will start to see the value and importance of the subject, and will be more likely to ask questions, participate in class discussions, and seek out additional learning opportunities. Moreover, when students see the practical application of a subject, they are more likely to remember what they have learned, as they can relate it to their own experiences.Furthermore, explaining how a subject applies to daily life can also help to make the learning process more enjoyable and interactive. Teachers can use real-life examples and case studies to illustrate key concepts, making the subject more accessible and interesting to students. This approach can also help to break down the barrier between the classroom and the outside world, making learning a more holistic and integrated process.In conclusion, I firmly believe that explaining how a subject can help and apply to students' lives outside school is the best way to make them more interested in the subject. By making these connections, teachers can help students to see the value and importance of the subject, and to become more active and engaged learners.

question: Governments should focus its budget more on environmental protection than on economic developments.
human: Environmental protection and economic developments might be the biggest issues in the 21st century. They are both important because they are vital to human's future and welfare. However, since the budget and the recourse are limited, governments must choose between these two issues. In my opinion, I believe that tackling down environmental problems is of the first priority rather than economic developments. The following are reasons why. First, environmental protection is far more urgent than economic developments. All the living creatures live together on our mother Earth and she is the only one. Without Earth, whatever great civil constructions and economic achievements will end up in vain because we will all perish as she's gone. Just like a man that needs a healthy body, all the living creatures as a whole needs a strong planet as well. Second, the influence on environmental problems are boarder and more profound than economic issues. Environmental problems are global rather than local, which means that no countries can be spared from these problems. Take global warming for example, when the temperature increases, the whole globe is affected, suffering the hotter weather together. The melting ice mountain not only jeopardizes habitats of animals living in the polar region, but its effects of the rising sea level also endangers the residents living in the small island near the equator, since the rising sea water could drown them. Environmental issues can not be divided by nationality because all humans are simply entwined together by our only home-Earth.Some people might argue that economic issues are global and critical as well thus can not be put aside. They may say that if the economic is in a very bad situation, people would revolt instantly, while environmental problems seem to be more like chronic diseases that would not burst out right away. However, the truth is that we've been encountering so many sighs and warnings of global climate anomalies and other environmental crisis right now. It would be unwise to still deny the truth and keep focusing on economic developments and unfortunately, usually the economic developments are even the causes of environmental damages.In conclusion, environmental conservation is more essential than economic developments in the aspects of urgency and ranges of influence. As mentioned in the second paragraph, how can a man live happily if he is unhealthy? Similarly, how can we live safely and joyfully when our home is devastated by, ironically, by ourselves?
llm: The 21st century is faced with numerous challenges, but two of the most pressing issues are environmental protection and economic development. Both are crucial to the future and welfare of humanity, and finding a balance between the two is essential. However, in my opinion, tackling environmental problems should take precedence over economic development.The environment is the foundation of human existence, providing us with the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the food we eat. The degradation of the environment, caused by pollution, deforestation, climate change, and other human activities, poses a significant threat to our very survival. The consequences of environmental neglect are already being felt, with devastating natural disasters, unpredictable weather patterns, and the loss of biodiversity. If we do not take immediate action to protect the environment, the consequences will be catastrophic.On the other hand, economic development is essential for improving the standard of living and reducing poverty. However, economic growth at the expense of the environment is a short-sighted approach. The long-term costs of environmental degradation far outweigh the short-term economic benefits. Moreover, investing in environmental protection can actually drive economic growth, creating jobs and stimulating innovation in fields such as renewable energy, sustainable agriculture, and eco-tourism.In conclusion, while both environmental protection and economic development are crucial, the former should take precedence. The future of humanity depends on our ability to protect the environment, and neglecting this responsibility will have dire consequences. By prioritizing environmental protection, we can ensure a sustainable future, create new economic opportunities, and improve the welfare of all people. It is our responsibility to act now and make the necessary sacrifices to safeguard the planet for future generations.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? In twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Views differ considerably when it comes to the issue of whether cars will be less than there are today in twenty years or not. Some people believe that since the environmental concern has risen, the car use will decrease. While others think that a personal car is important for ones daily life. Both of the opposite arguments appear to be somewhat convincing and stand to reason. But as far as I am concerned, I agree with the idea, which is that there will be a decrease in cars use in the future. The following reasons will present my points.First of all, since the public transportation has improved, it is much convenience to take a subway or a bus. For example, I live in a city which always have a jam in the morning and doesn't have enough parking lots for the cars. So, with the stations increased people are willing to take a public transportation than drive on their own. Second, a driving car can make a lot of different pollutions to the world. So, with the risen of the aware to the environment, people will think more about whether to drive on their own or not. For example, instead of driving each one's car, if we put forty people in a bus, it will solve the traffic jam by decrease the cars use and also reduce the air pollution for the city.Although, I am agree with the idea that reducing of the car use will be achieve in twenty years. I think I still have to point out that there are some different points of view. People who hold different opinion may argue that a personal car uses is in need because a public transportation can't meet every place. Of course, it may be true when you want to go to some countryside or some other inconvenience places. However, no matter you are going to somewhere for a trip or you just simply live in some suburbs and so on, it always have some other ways that you can do, you can ride a bike, or even walk on your feet. It not only helps you to reduce the car use, but also good to your health. In this way, this won't be a problem at all.In conclusion, given the reasons described above, when the advantages and disadvantages of whether there will be fewer cars in use in twenty years or not are carefully compared, the best choice is obviously stand on my side, which is that the car use will definitely decrease in twenty years.
llm: The recent surge in environmental concerns has sparked a heated debate about the future of car use. While some individuals believe that personal cars will remain an indispensable part of daily life, others, including myself, foresee a decline in car usage.On one hand, there are valid reasons why people might think that car use will persist. For many, owning a car is a symbol of freedom and independence, providing a convenient means of transportation to work, school, and social events. Moreover, in areas with limited public transportation, cars are often the only viable option. Therefore, it is reasonable to assume that many individuals will continue to rely on their personal vehicles.However, I firmly believe that the growing awareness of environmental issues will inevitably lead to a decrease in car use. As people become more conscious of the detrimental impact of greenhouse gas emissions, air pollution, and urban congestion, they will start to seek alternative modes of transportation. Governments and cities are already investing heavily in sustainable infrastructure, such as bike lanes, public transportation systems, and pedestrian-friendly areas. These initiatives not only reduce carbon emissions but also promote healthier lifestyles and more livable communities.Furthermore, the rise of car-sharing and ride-hailing services, as well as the increasing popularity of electric and hybrid vehicles, indicate a shift towards more environmentally friendly transportation options. As technology continues to improve and costs decrease, these alternatives will become even more appealing to a wider range of consumers.In conclusion, while some people may view personal cars as essential to their daily lives, I am convinced that the growing environmental concerns will lead to a decline in car use.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? ItÕs not necessary for university students to attend class as long as they can pass their examinations.
human: In university education, students are given much independence in the ways of learning. Some students still rely on classes to keep up with the courses, while some students don't feel the need to attend classes because they believe that they can handle the exams. These different ideas of learning methods lead to a question whether it is necessary for university students to attend the class as long as they can pass their examinations. In my opinion, I believe that students should always attend class no matter what the outcome of the exam is. First, in terms of learning, attending class is more effective than simply studying alone to pass the exams. Classes are designed diligently for the students and professors absolutely bear more knowledge than the students. Professors not only have the knowledge, but also equip with experiences, knowing how to guide their students toward their academic achievements. Second, it's students' basic responsibility to attend class. Attending class is the most persuasive way for the students to show respect to the professor as well as themselves. Many professors grade their students with class attendances. In other words, class attendances are regarded as critical as examination performances. Those who even achieve high scores on exams could fail if they didn't show up in the classes.Some people might argue that if students already understand the contents on the class enough to pass the exams or they can study the course on their own. Why wasting time going to classes? Doesn't self-study more efficient? However, in my opinion, this is a rather immodest way of thinking. I believe that professors can always give students more than students themselves could because of the experiences and their qualifications as professors. Besides, even if students believe that they are so brilliant to surpass their professors, they can still go to the classes to discuss with professors and classmates. In conclusion, students can learn more thoroughly as well as showing respect for professors and themselves through attending classes. It's an essential learning process. Passing the exams is not the terminal purpose of learning. The learning process itself, however, is the most important and powerful way of evaluating a student.
llm: The university experience is often characterized by a newfound sense of independence, where students are given the freedom to manage their own learning. While this autonomy can be liberating, it also poses a challenge for some students who may not feel the need to attend classes regularly. As long as they can handle the exams, some students may think it's sufficient to simply study alone, bypassing the traditional classroom experience. However, this approach is not only misguided but also detrimental to their overall learning experience.Attending classes is far more effective than studying alone for several reasons. Firstly, classes provide a structured learning environment where students can engage with the material in a more interactive and immersive way. Lectures, discussions, and group work facilitate a deeper understanding of the subject matter, allowing students to ask questions, clarify doubts, and explore different perspectives. In contrast, solo studying can lead to a superficial grasp of the material, with students missing out on the nuances and complexities that a classroom setting can provide.Moreover, attending classes is not just about absorbing information; it's also about developing essential skills such as critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication. By participating in class discussions and engaging with peers, students can hone these skills, which are vital for success in their future careers. Furthermore, attending classes demonstrates a student's commitment to their education and their willingness to take responsibility for their own learning.In this regard, attending classes is not just a matter of personal preference, but a basic responsibility that students should uphold. By shirking this responsibility, students not only jeopardize their own academic success but also undermine the very purpose of university education. In conclusion, while independence is an essential aspect of university life, it should not be used as an excuse to neglect the importance of attending classes. Regular attendance is crucial for effective learning, skill development, and personal growth, making it an indispensable part of the university experience.

question: When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success." Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above?
human: What do you think when you see a beautiful building? And also when you see an airport? Do you think they have built by chance? Of course don't. Also it is ridiculous if you think world wide webs such as Google, Yahoo etc. created by chance. Howbeit some people think that luck is cause of a lot of success, but to be frank I cannot agree with them. I would explore my primary reasons here. To begin with, famous people are usually diligent people not lucky people. Hard work make you a professional man/woman which are powerful in his or her job. I mean, when you work hard you decrease portion of chance in your success. For example in football game it is said that penalty-kick need good chance to be goal. Statically the chance of being goal is fifty-fifty. But I think Ronaldo make a goal from a penalty-kick with more possibility than me. It is not for which Ronaldo is more fortune than me. Definitely it is for which he have more practice and exercise than me. He do a lot of exercise in football field every day, so it is not for which he is luckier than me.Moreover, we cannot always lean on our luck to be successful. I don't want to disavow the role of luck in success, but as you know it hardly accompany us. So, for example you prepare for TOEFL or other multiple-choice test which has four option to choose in every question. You cannot prepare for it without any study and Rely on your luck, even if you be a very lucky. If you pick up any choice by chance you would fail the exam. Undoubtedly it is wise advice which you have hard study to success on exam.Finally, you have to work hard to learn and to get a lot of information before doing a project in good way. The most fortunate people in the word cannot manufacture an automobile or build a high tower just by her or his chance. These plans is done by someone who is mastered in his/her work. Undoubtedly such people do work hard and have great experiences because of their hard works.In the end, I think any great success need great work not great luck, even though luck is one factor in reaching goal but its impact is extraneous and we must not reckon on luck in our plans.
llm: The Role of Luck in Success: A MisconceptionThe notion that luck plays a significant role in achieving success is a widely debated topic. Some people firmly believe that luck is the primary driver of success, while others argue that it is a minor factor. As a firm believer in the power of hard work and determination, I strongly disagree with the idea that luck is the primary cause of success.To begin with, when we look at famous and successful individuals, we often find that they are diligent and dedicated people who have put in countless hours of effort to reach their goals. Take, for example, Thomas Edison, who is famously quoted as saying, "Genius is 1% inspiration and 99% perspiration." His success was not due to luck, but rather his tireless work ethic and perseverance. Similarly, athletes, entrepreneurs, and artists who have achieved greatness have done so through their dedication and passion, not by chance.Furthermore, relying on luck to achieve success is an unreliable and unsustainable strategy. Luck is unpredictable and fleeting, and it is impossible to control or replicate. If we rely solely on luck, we will inevitably be disappointed and disillusioned when it does not materialize. On the other hand, hard work, determination, and resilience are qualities that we can cultivate and control, allowing us to achieve success through our own efforts.In conclusion, while luck may play a small role in success, it is not the primary driver. Instead, it is the diligent and dedicated individuals who put in the time and effort to achieve their goals who truly succeed. By focusing on developing our skills, working hard, and persevering through challenges, we can create our own success, rather than relying on chance.

question: Some people think that they can learn better by themselves than a teacher. Others think that it is better to have a teacher. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons to develop your essay.
human: Different people prefer different styles of learning. I think both learning by myself and learning with a teacher could be helpful. Learning with a teacher can prevent one from being confused and increase the rate and speed of learning. Another important point is that for practical subjects you have to have a teacher. On the other hand, sometimes I would rather learning on my own.A good and experienced teacher can help me learn faster and easier. Sometimes when learning a course by myself which is hard and confusing to understand and has few sources available, I get discouraged after spending a lot of time. In this situation, I'll look for a teacher and request for help from him or her. And then he or she will teach me the course efficiently in a short time and therefore I will learn faster and better and won't get discouraged and confused.There are some practical subjects that you can only learn them with a teacher or an instructor. For example, if you want to learn driving a car or some jobs like medicine and engineering and some sports like skiing and swimming, you'll have to find a teacher. It's almost impossible and inefficient to learn those things on your own. By the way, if you are going to learn some things by yourself, you may learn and understand them incorrectly! For example, from my own experiences, after I had started learning playing the guitar without a teacher, I got used to wrong habits regarding strumming and tempo, but after finding and learning with a tutor and identifying and eliminating those incorrect habits, I was able to play properly.There are some things that I prefer to learn them without a teacher because I won't have to spend extra money for a teacher and my time will not be wasted either because of going to classes. In today's world there are many great and useful sources available like books, electronic books, the internet and TV and satellite. I can utilize them as tutorials for many things. For instance, I can learn English or other languages by a lot of helpful books and many online websites. In sum, sometimes it is good to learn with a teacher and sometimes on my own. In my view, both can help and each of them has its own advantages and disadvantages.
llm: The age-old debate about the effectiveness of learning with a teacher versus self-directed learning has sparked intense discussion among educators and learners alike. While some argue that learning with a teacher is the most efficient way to acquire knowledge, others prefer to learn on their own. In my opinion, both methods have their merits, and it ultimately depends on individual preferences and learning styles.On one hand, learning with a teacher can significantly enhance the learning experience. A good and experienced teacher can provide personalized guidance, clarify doubts, and offer valuable feedback. This can prevent confusion and misinterpretation of complex concepts, allowing learners to grasp them more quickly and accurately. Moreover, a teacher can tailor the learning pace to suit the needs of the student, thereby increasing the speed and rate of learning. A teacher can also provide motivation, encouragement, and support, which are essential for learners to stay engaged and focused.On the other hand, I must admit that there are times when I prefer to learn on my own. Self-directed learning allows me to set my own pace, explore topics in-depth, and learn at my own convenience. Without the pressure of a teacher or a classroom, I can focus on areas that interest me the most and delve deeper into the subject matter. Additionally, learning on my own enables me to develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills, as I am forced to navigate through challenges and obstacles independently.In conclusion, while learning with a teacher offers numerous benefits, including increased speed and clarity of learning, I believe that self-directed learning also has its advantages. Ultimately, the most effective learning method is one that strikes a balance between the two. With the guidance of a good teacher and the flexibility of self-directed learning, learners can achieve a deeper understanding of the subject matter and develop essential skills for lifelong learning.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Working at home with a computer and a phone is better than working at a companyÕs office using the same equipment.
human: Due to the convenience of current technology, people can do their works everywhere as long as they have the equipment around them. People are no longer restricted in the office. This rapid progress in technology leads to the question whether it's better working at home with a computer and a phone than working at the company's office. In my opinion, I believe that working at home is worse and less efficient than working in the office.First of all, while working in the office, people can interact with their colleges instantly. They can either get help from colleges or discuss about the work together. Think about the big project that a group is working on, if any group member has new idea about the project, he/she can assemble his/her colleges right away and discuss. It's more efficient and straight-forward than talking in the phone. For another example, if one’s computer or Internet has any breakdown, he/she can call the MIS staff to fix.Second, working at home has many disadvantages that will no doubt lower the efficiency of works. For example, people are easily distracted while working at home. It's hard to concentrate on work if people can grab the TV remote or some junk foods right away. In addition, while people are working at home, there will be no one supervising them, thus raises the chance of loafing. Moreover, people who work at home are more likely to miss the important events happening in the office, like some announcements from the boss.In conclusion, working in the office is obviously better than working at home in terms of efficiency. It not only has the advantage of working with colleges but also it provides a real working atmosphere that can never be grasped if people choose to work at home.
llm: With the advancement of technology, it is now possible for people to do their work from anywhere, as long as they have the necessary equipment. This has led to an increase in remote work arrangements, where employees work from home or other locations outside of the traditional office setting. While some people may find this arrangement convenient and flexible, I firmly believe that working from home is less efficient and less beneficial than working in an office.One of the main drawbacks of working from home is the lack of face-to-face interaction with colleagues and supervisors. In an office setting, employees are able to easily communicate with each other, ask questions, and clarify any misunderstandings. This is not possible when working from home, where employees are isolated and may miss out on important discussions and decisions.Another disadvantage of working from home is the lack of structure and accountability. In an office, employees are more likely to stay focused and motivated, as they are surrounded by colleagues who are also working. At home, it is easy to get distracted by household chores, TV, or social media, leading to decreased productivity. Additionally, employees who work from home may feel less accountable to their employer, as they are not physically present in the office.Furthermore, employees who work from home are more likely to miss important events and announcements that take place in the office. For example, a boss may make an announcement about a new project or deadline, which may not be communicated to remote workers in a timely manner. This can lead to feelings of disconnection and isolation, as well as missed opportunities for growth and development.In conclusion, while technology has made it possible to work from anywhere, I believe that working from home is less efficient and less beneficial than working in an office. The lack of face-to-face interaction, structure, and accountability, as well as the potential to miss important events and announcements, make office work a more productive and effective arrangement.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? In order to succeed, you should be more like others than be different from everyone else.
human: Achieving success is everybody's goal for life and there are absolutely many different directions that can lead people to success. Some people choose to be normal to wait for chances, while some other people prefer to be different from everyone else. Which one is the promising way to succeed? In my opinion, I believe that once you are unique enough, you are already on the way to success.First, being positively different from everyone else usually means that you've achieved something that is superior than others. As living in a competent world, we are like playing a survival game. Only who has the sharpest weapon can survive. If you don't make yourself outstanding enough or you fail to distinguish yourself from others, you will be easily replaced and eliminated by someone who is better than you. Take myself for example, when I was in college, I was always chosen to be the presenter of group report because I was the only one in my group who could present the report thoroughly and fluently.Second, being unique can create your own value which can never be taken by others. In other words, once you are special and unique, pursuing success is a matter of actively creating the fashion rather than passively waiting for other people to recognize and appreciate you. Take the most popular and prestigious technology company- Apple- for example. The reason why it gains such a tremendous success is because it achieves some brilliant qualities that can never be caught up by other competitors. It has its operating systems that can run smoother than any other companies and its design always wins the popularity among consumers. It is the uniqueness of Apple design that creates its own value.In conclusion, being different and unique is the better way to achieve success. It not only shows your competence but also creates your own value, making you take the lead in your way towards success.
llm: In today's society, the emphasis on conformity often leads individuals to fear standing out from the crowd. However, being different from everyone else is often a hallmark of innovation and progress. Those who dare to be unique have achieved something superior to others, pushing the boundaries of what is possible and leaving a lasting impact.Embracing individuality allows one to create their own value, a value that cannot be taken away by others. This uniqueness is what sets one apart and makes them truly special. Take, for instance, Apple, one of the most popular and prestigious technology companies in the world. Apple's success can be attributed to its willingness to challenge the status quo and think outside the box. By introducing products that were vastly different from what was already available in the market, Apple was able to revolutionize the tech industry and create a loyal customer base.Steve Jobs, co-founder of Apple, was known for his unconventional approach to design and innovation. He refused to compromise on his vision, even when it meant going against the norm. This refusal to conform to traditional thinking led to the creation of game-changing products like the iPhone and iPad. Today, Apple is a household name, synonymous with innovation and style.In conclusion, being different from everyone else is not something to be feared, but rather something to be celebrated. By embracing our unique qualities and refusing to conform to societal norms, we can create our own value and make a lasting impact. As Apple's success has shown us, being different can be a powerful catalyst for innovation and progress.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The personal and work-related challenges that young people are facing are not different with their parents and grandparents faced when they were young.
human: While debating about generation issues, people always have different opinions. Some people believe that little things changed through generation, while others claim that generation differences are presented in every way. In my opinion, I believe that every prospective between generations alters and especially the challenges for this generation are significantly different from the last generation.First, under globalization and industrial integration, the work-related challenges for this generation are getting more complicated and challenging. The successful people are those who can quickly respond to this rapid-changing world. In the past, focusing on one skill was enough to deal with the problems because every industry was rather small in size and simple to manage. However, as those industries expand and become internationalized, people are required to equip with multiple skills to answer those challenges. For example, now there are more chances to do business with people around the world, so besides one's own profession, language ability is essential as well. For another example, financial crimes are rampant in the 21st century, thus surging up demands for those who excel at both laws and financial management. Second, this generation is encountering the self-recognition issue which could not be experienced by the previous generation. The past generation was given less freedom and was usually asked to follow the paths their parents had prepared for them. In contrast, young people in this generation are exposed to more creative ideas and rather think individually. They are eager for finding who they are and what they really want. It is fortunate that they can struggle with these sweet worries and these worries are indeed never easy for them. They have to make decisions between so many possibilities and they are responsible for taking the consequences. In conclusion, challenges for this generation are more complicated and diverse than the past generation, whether in career or in self-identification. It is hard to judge which generation's problems are more difficult but it is no doubt that until the next generation, there will be whole new challenges waiting for the next youngsters.
llm: The world is undergoing rapid transformations, and the challenges faced by the current generation are vastly different from those experienced by the previous one. The dawn of globalization and industrial integration has revolutionized the way we live and work, presenting a multitude of complexities that previous generations never had to navigate.On one hand, the work-related challenges have become increasingly intricate. With the advent of globalization, the job market has become more interconnected, and the competition for jobs has intensified. The rapid pace of technological advancements has also created a high demand for specialized skills, making it essential for individuals to continuously update their skills to remain employable. Furthermore, the gig economy and remote work arrangements have blurred the lines between work and personal life, leading to an always-on culture that can be overwhelming. As a result, the current generation is facing unprecedented pressure to adapt, innovate, and thrive in a highly competitive and dynamic work environment.On the other hand, this generation is grappling with the issue of self-recognition, which was not a significant concern for the previous generation. Social media has created unrealistic expectations and promoted the cult of perfection, leading to increased anxiety, depression, and self-doubt. The constant bombardment of curated and manipulated information has made it difficult for individuals to develop a sense of identity and self-worth. Moreover, the fear of missing out (FOMO) and the pressure to present a perfect online persona have exacerbated the issue of self-recognition, making it challenging for individuals to discern their true passions, values, and goals.In conclusion, the challenges faced by the current generation are distinct and multifaceted. The complexities of the modern work environment and the self-recognition issue are just a few examples of the unique obstacles that this generation must overcome. It is essential for individuals, educators, and policymakers to acknowledge and address these challenges, providing the necessary support and resources to empower this generation to thrive in an ever-changing world.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: I have my own reasons why I agree with the statement that successful people try new things and take risks. There are many viewpoints regarding what the main characteristics of successful people are. In my opinion, one of the main reasons for supporting this statement is that successful people can learn important and very valuable points from trying new things. The other reason is that great success requires taking great risks.There are always interesting and useful experiences that successful people can learn them only by trying new things. For example, if you want to know how to act effectively when communicating with people, you can try something new like salesmanship in various stores and places. By selling goods or other commodities you will face different people with different behaviors and personalities and as a result you will learn how to behave people in different situations and jobs in the future. These experiences can only be obtained by trying new things and can’t be always found in books. I do believe that great success requires taking great risks. If you want to gain very high profits in investments, you should use great and very high amounts of money in very risky financial decisions and dealings in which you may lose much amount of money. If you want to achieve a remarkable success in an important exam, you should risk studying all the time and sacrificing your free time and your favorite hobbies. The more you take risks, the greater your successes will be. If you don’t take any risks, you will have an ordinary life with average successes. That’s why it is important to take risks.In sum, I believe that success and trying new things and taking risks go hand in hand and to achieve success you should consider them.
llm: There are numerous perspectives on the characteristics that define successful individuals. While some may argue that traits such as intelligence, charisma, or luck are essential, I firmly believe that one of the primary factors contributing to success is the willingness to take risks and try new things.In my opinion, the ability to step out of one's comfort zone and experiment with novel approaches is a crucial aspect of achieving greatness. By embracing uncertainty and taking calculated risks, individuals can acquire valuable knowledge, skills, and insights that might not have been accessible otherwise. This mindset allows them to navigate unfamiliar territories, adapt to changing circumstances, and innovate in ways that others may not have considered.Moreover, I believe that great success requires taking great risks. Playing it safe and adhering to conventional norms can lead to mediocrity, whereas bold experimentation and risk-taking can lead to groundbreaking discoveries and achievements. Many of the world's most successful entrepreneurs, inventors, and thought leaders have been known to challenge the status quo and push boundaries, often facing criticism and setbacks along the way.However, it is through these experiences that they refined their ideas, developed resilience, and ultimately achieved their goals. By trying new things and taking risks, successful individuals demonstrate a growth mindset, a willingness to learn from failures, and an unwavering commitment to their vision. This, in turn, enables them to stay ahead of the curve, capitalize on opportunities, and leave a lasting impact on their respective fields.In conclusion, the willingness to try new things and take risks is a fundamental characteristic of successful people. By embracing this mindset, individuals can unlock new possibilities, foster innovation, and propel themselves towards greatness. As the famous saying goes, "nothing ventured, nothing gained."

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? For success in a future job, the ability to relate well to people is more important than studying hard in school. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: I think that No factor is important enough by itself to succeed in any situations. We should consider many factors and choose the best of them. I believe that both the ability to relate well to people and studying hard in school are important for success in a future job for following reasons:We need to know and learn about the theoritical basis of our future job. This can be done in school. In school, we are able to identify skills required for our future job and work on mastering and learning them. If we study them hard, we will have the chance of doing our job better and quicker in the future. For example, if someone wants to become a good industrial engineer, he should study his technical courses very well so that he will be able to utilize them well in his future job. As you can see, studying hard in school is an important factor to succeed in a job.One of the other factors for success in a future job is effective commuincation. By relating well to people, we are likely to have a lot of friends and therefore we will have a wide network of communication. Commuincation can bring many benefits. For example, if you need help with getting a job, by commuincating with people offering jobs whom you treat well and therefore they respect you as well, you can achieve your goal. Or, if you are a salesman in a store or any other place, by relating well to your customers, you will increase the chance of their coming back again and becoming your regular customers. So, relating well to people is also another important factor. In sum, though some people may disagree with me, as I explained my reasons and examples above, none of those factors are important and sufficient enough by themselves and we should notice to both of them because each of them has its own benefits.
llm: **The Importance of People Skills and Hard Work in Achieving Success**In today's competitive job market, it's not just one factor that determines success, but a combination of several skills and qualities. In my opinion, two essential elements that contribute to success in a future job are the ability to relate well to people and studying hard in school. Additionally, effective communication is a crucial factor that plays a significant role in achieving success.Relating well to people is a vital skill that can make or break one's career. When we can connect with others, build strong relationships, and communicate effectively, we are more likely to have a wide network of contacts that can open doors to new opportunities. This network can provide valuable advice, introduce us to potential employers, and offer support during challenging times. Moreover, people skills help us to work effectively in teams, resolve conflicts, and negotiate with clients, making us more attractive to potential employers.Studying hard in school is equally important as it lays the foundation for future success. A strong academic record demonstrates our commitment, discipline, and ability to learn and adapt quickly. It also provides us with the knowledge and skills required to perform well in our chosen profession. Employers often look for candidates with a strong academic background, as it indicates a willingness to put in the effort required to succeed.Effective communication is the glue that binds these two skills together. When we can communicate our ideas, thoughts, and feelings clearly and concisely, we can build strong relationships, negotiate effectively, and convey our value to employers. By combining people skills, hard work, and effective communication, we can set ourselves up for success in our future careers. In conclusion, while there are many factors that contribute to success, the ability to relate well to people, studying hard in school, and effective communication are three essential elements that can help us achieve our career goals.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The advertising is the main cause of unhealthy eating habits.
human: Advertising is becoming part of our modern society. They penetrate into people's life, affecting people's choices in different things. Therefore, it comes to the debate whether advertising has positive influences on people's life. Some people say that advertising must be blamed for the unhealthy eating habits, while others believe that there are still some other factors directing people's judgments. In my opinion, the advertising is not the main cause of unhealthy eating habits.First of all, advertising is not entirely decisive on personal eating habit. The key to forming a healthy eating pattern lies in people's concept of wholesome diets and self-control. It is sure that advertising always makes the products so tempting, regardless of whether they might bring negative effects on the human body. However, advertising is not the only information source for people. People can still acquire different viewpoints about foods from other sources, like news or magazines. As long as people are clear about how to maintain a healthy body and they persistently keep track of their eating habits, they can successfully prevent themselves from those temptations. It will be not persuasive if people just blame the advertising sector of a fast-food company for making them so fat and not reassess their own behaviors. Second, in the era when people are becoming conscious of a healthier lifestyle, some companies are actually aiming at this rising trend and start to promote healthy foods. In other words, advertising may even bring healthier eating habits to the people. Think about the recently popular organic foods that are claimed to grow in an environment without pesticide and those crude foods in which less salt or less sugar are added. These are the main traits that advertising is hitting on and the overall results are good. In these cases, the advertising industry bolsters people's awareness of having a healthy lifestyle. In conclusion, advertising is not the primary reason of unhealthy eating habits. There are the build-up of the concept about healthy eating habits and self-control that really matter. Besides, advertising might lead to healthier eating customs due to the growing awareness of living under a better lifestyle. It is inevitable to be exposed to the environment full of advertisements but it does not mean that our right to choose is taken away. We will always be able to decide our own lifestyles.
llm: The influence of advertising on modern society is undeniable, with its pervasive presence shaping our choices in various aspects of life. One area where advertising is often criticized is its perceived impact on unhealthy eating habits. While some argue that advertising is the primary driver of poor dietary choices, I firmly believe that it is not the main culprit. In my opinion, the key to developing healthy eating patterns lies in embracing wholesome diets and exercising self-control.Advertising often gets blamed for promoting unhealthy foods, but it is essential to recognize that individuals have agency over their food choices. Wholesome diets, which emphasize whole, nutrient-dense foods, are the foundation of healthy eating. People who prioritize these diets are less likely to be swayed by advertisements for processed or high-calorie foods. Moreover, self-control plays a crucial role in resisting the allure of unhealthy options, even when they are heavily advertised.Interestingly, advertising may even contribute to healthier eating habits. The growing awareness of the importance of living a healthy lifestyle has led to an increase in advertising for wholesome foods and wellness products. This shift in advertising trends can encourage people to make better choices, such as opting for organic produce or choosing restaurants that offer nutritious options. Furthermore, some companies are using their advertising platforms to promote healthy eating habits, such as highlighting the benefits of balanced diets or partnering with wellness experts to create informative campaigns.In conclusion, while advertising can influence food choices, it is not the primary cause of unhealthy eating habits. The responsibility for developing healthy eating patterns lies with individuals, who must prioritize wholesome diets and exercise self-control. As advertising continues to evolve, it is possible that it will play a more significant role in promoting healthy eating habits, ultimately contributing to a healthier society.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Nowdays there are different resources to entertain, educate and inform people. One of this resource is television; however television has some negative effects among some people. Therefore, I agree that Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Some People spend a lot of time watching television, others even eat watching television, and some others make of this media a priority.First of all, some people spend a lot of time watching television. Instead of spend time with family and friends, they like to seat on a chair for hours. I know someone who wakes up in the morning and before even eat he turns the television on, he even records the programs he cannot watch during work hours. Sometimes his wife wants to talk before they go to work, but he only let her talk during commercials. So, she is used to his habit that she prefers to write him an email. Time with the family is gold, some people have to realize that and take quality of time to talk to them.Another way television has destroyed communication is when some people cannot even seat at the table and have dinner with the family. This is the time, when if they have children, they can share everything about school, a project and even concerns. Also, when there is a dinner with friends, some people do not have a fluid conversation because the television is again in between them. When family or friends gather together to have a good time eating and talking, this is not the reality in some cases.Finally, some people make the television a priority. I remember a friend told me one day that because she was watching a telenovela I could not go to her house a certain time during the night. Honestly, I was in shock! How she could say that to me?. As I have said, television is a great tool to learn, entertain and inform what is happening, but I agree that television has destroyed communication among friends and family as soon as television become a priority, spend a lot of time watching it and eat in front of the television.
llm: The Impact of Television on SocietyTelevision has become an integral part of our daily lives, serving as a valuable tool for education, entertainment, and information dissemination. Since its inception, television has revolutionized the way we learn, relax, and stay updated about current events. However, excessive television viewing has been linked to several negative effects, which can have far-reaching consequences on individuals and society as a whole.On the positive side, television offers a wide range of educational programs that cater to diverse interests and age groups. Documentaries, historical dramas, and science shows can spark curiosity and foster a love for learning among viewers. Television also provides a platform for entertainment, with movies, sitcoms, and reality TV shows offering a welcome respite from the stresses of daily life. Furthermore, news programs and current affairs shows keep viewers informed about local and global events, enabling them to stay abreast of the latest developments.However, excessive television viewing has been associated with several negative effects, particularly among certain individuals. Some people become so engrossed in television that they spend an inordinate amount of time watching TV, often at the expense of other activities, such as exercise, reading, or socializing. This can lead to a sedentary lifestyle, contributing to obesity, diabetes, and other health problems. Additionally, some individuals develop unhealthy eating habits, such as eating in front of the TV, which can lead to mindless snacking and poor nutrition.Moreover, excessive television viewing can also have a profound impact on children's cognitive and social development. Studies have shown that children who watch too much TV are more likely to experience attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, social isolation, and decreased academic performance. Parents and caregivers must, therefore, ensure that children maintain a balance between TV viewing and other activities that promote physical and mental well-being.In conclusion, television is a double-edged sword, offering numerous benefits while also posing significant risks. While it can educate, entertain, and inform, excessive viewing can have far-reaching negative consequences. It is essential to maintain a balance between TV viewing and other aspects of life to reap its benefits while minimizing its negative effects.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the folowing statement? At universities and colleges, sports and social activities are just as important as classes and libraries and should receive equal financial support
human: University students can be divided into two groups, one group with less interest to study and the other which include hard working students. Usually the second group's members do not have enough time to do exercise. We all know doing exercise for at least 30 minutes form the basis of the healthy and happy life. But I don't think that equal amount of money should be spent on academic issues like libraries and laboratories and physical or social activities.First, in my view spending too much money for equipping the gyms or constructing football/basketball courts are really not necessary to encourage students to do sports. For example, my roommate, Mary, always wakes up 6 in the morning and spends 1 hour doing sport in the park which is near our dormitory. When she gets to the dorm, she is really full of energy and after taking a shower, she is ready to start a good day. As you see, she is doing exercise without spending a cent. What the university should do is informing the students the benefits of doing sport by hanging some posters in the campus, inviting some athletes to lecture for students and encourage them to spend some time for their body and health.In addition, students choose their major based on their interests. The university should provide the best equipment needed for physical education students. Because their major in completely involved in physical activities. In contrast, for an engineer or a medicine student I do not find it fair enough to equip gyms instead of their laboratories, because it really make the students enthusiastic to use innovative technology to learn and maybe find new things in their field.Finally, spending money on social activities looks like wasting money. For students who want to gather with their friends or want to go out to meet new people, university programs are the last place they would choose. For example when I and my friends want to spend time with each other, we prefer to go out of university to the places where we do not want to be disturbed by any familiar people. In conclusion, I do not deny the importance of doing sports in the success of university students, but I think both sports and social activities should not receive equal amount of money with libraries and laboratories.
llm: The university student body can be broadly categorized into two distinct groups: those who exhibit a lack of interest in their academic pursuits and those who are diligent and hardworking. While both types of students have their own set of needs, it is essential to recognize the importance of balancing academic and extracurricular activities in fostering a holistic educational experience.Regular physical exercise is widely acknowledged as a crucial component of a healthy and happy lifestyle. Investing a minimum of 30 minutes in physical activity daily can have a profound impact on both physical and mental well-being. However, it is equally important to acknowledge the significance of academic infrastructure, such as libraries and laboratories, in providing students with the necessary resources to excel in their studies.In this context, it is not entirely justifiable to allocate equal amounts of money to academic and physical or social activities. While physical and social activities are essential for the overall development of students, academic infrastructure should be given priority. Libraries and laboratories provide students with the necessary tools and resources to engage in critical thinking, research, and experimentation, which are fundamental to the learning process.Moreover, investing in academic infrastructure can have long-term benefits, such as improving student outcomes and enhancing the reputation of the institution. In contrast, while physical and social activities are important, they can be facilitated through more cost-effective means, such as partnerships with local community centers or outdoor activities that do not require significant investments.In conclusion, while both academic and physical or social activities are essential for university students, it is not prudent to allocate equal amounts of money to both. Academic infrastructure, such as libraries and laboratories, should be given priority, as they provide students with the necessary resources to excel in their studies and have long-term benefits for the institution.

question: Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
human: Nowadays, it is often claimed that attending classes has a lot of benefits for students and provide them with a variety of learning opportunities (options) as well. On the contrary to this popular belief, there are still those who subscribe to this view that having a choice for attending classes enable students to study at home and through this way they do not waste their time for commuting and also they can save their money. However, I am inclined to believe that being present at classes seems a wiser option.First and foremost, I truly believe that being present at classes provide students with opportunity of communicating with other students that is beneficial for understanding new material by reviewing them throughout the free times in college. Also, they can help each other for learning materials better. However, if they do not attend classes they cannot use the help of others for assisting them to comprehend difficult problems. Another significant fact which should be taken into consideration is that by the help of teachers, students can understand ideas faster and easier since teachers explain them thoroughly in the class and after that give them a lot of examples to clarify the points. In this way attending classes not only wastes their time but also facilitates their understanding process that takes them less time for comprehending materials in comparison with self-study. Finally yet importantly, appearing in class makes students more conscientious since they have to obey class’s disciplines and they practice to be more perseverance in the process of doing their assignments. However, the ones who choose to study at home do not have any discipline for their studies and cannot force themselves to study in particular times. Through this way, they may miss some important parts in virtue of the chaotic and incoherent study. On the basis of the points mentioned above, I convinced that communicating and studying with peer group is a good way for learning materials. Moreover, teachers have a conspicuous role in assisting students for learning materials that being present at classes is a requisite for benefiting it. Also, attending to classes makes students more attentive and have them to do their studies on time that this attitude lead them to success.
llm: Attending classes is a vital part of a student's educational journey, offering numerous benefits and a wide range of learning opportunities. While some may argue that attending classes is a necessary evil, others firmly believe that being present in class is the wiser option. This essay will examine the advantages of attending classes, highlighting the benefits of in-person learning and the drawbacks of relying solely on self-study.First and foremost, attending classes provides students with the opportunity to interact with their peers, which is essential for grasping new material.
