By pushing through our discomfort and completing these tasks, we can develop valuable skills, build relationships, and establish ourselves as dedicated and reliable professionals.Interestingly, doing something that we don't initially enjoy can sometimes lead to unexpected enjoyment. When we challenge ourselves to engage in an activity that we think we won't like, we may discover hidden passions or talents. For example, a person who thinks they hate public speaking may find that after delivering a few presentations, they begin to enjoy the rush of adrenaline and the sense of accomplishment that comes with sharing their ideas with others. Similarly, someone who dislikes team sports may discover that they enjoy the camaraderie and sense of belonging that comes with being part of a team.In conclusion, while it's natural to want to avoid activities that we don't enjoy, it's essential to recognize that sometimes, it's necessary to push through our discomfort to achieve our goals. By doing so, we can develop valuable skills, build relationships, and even discover new passions and talents.

question: Some young adults want independence from their parents as soon as possible. Other young adults prefer to live with their families for a longer time. Which of the solutions do you think is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: As young people gets older they tend to seek more freedom and want to live on their own. But, the issue of what is the right age for young adults to leave their parents and start living on their own is a contentious one. Personally, I believe that young adults should live with their parents for a longer period of time.Living on your own is a huge financial commitment. At younger age people are less likely to get a high paying job, so It can be a difficult task to pay for rent, food, utilities and other expenses to sustain yourself. So, I believe that living with parents is a wise choice for adults until they get a head start to their professional career with a reasonable income.Another advantage of living with parents for a longer period of time is the enhanced emotional attachment with them. Parents have valuable advice to their children as they go through the changes in their adult life. Living together develops the environment of discussing adult's physiological and psychological changes face to face with their parents. Young adults will feel reluctant to discuss such problems with their parents if they move out and live on their own, and thus missing the valuable input of their parents.While some critics may argue that, young adults living with parents will not be free to do what they want. However, I believe that most young adults are inclined to take unprecedented advantages of the freedom they have. It is good thing if living with parents does not give freedom for young people to party all night, smoke or do drugs. In a nutshell, I believe that young adults should only consider living on their own only after they are sure they could sustain on their own. It is unwise to trade the opportunity of living with parents for a longer period of time for some late night parties or drugs. Thus, to cope with the physiological and psychological changes of adult life, to make financial life a less struggle and to prevent oneself digress from their destined path, it is important for young adults to live with their parents for a longer period of time.
llm: The age-old debate surrounding the ideal time for young adults to leave their parents' nest has long been a contentious issue. While some argue that independence should be attained at a relatively young age, others contend that staying with family for a longer period is more beneficial. As a young adult myself, I firmly believe that living with parents for an extended period is the most advantageous choice.On one hand, the desire for freedom and autonomy is a natural aspect of growing up. Many young adults yearn to spread their wings and experience life on their own terms, free from the perceived constraints of living with family. However, I strongly believe that this eagerness to leave the nest often stems from a lack of preparedness for the realities of independent living. The transition from a sheltered life under parental guidance to a self-sufficient one can be overwhelming, leading to unnecessary stress and financial struggles.On the other hand, living with parents for a longer period allows young adults to gradually develop essential life skills, such as financial management, cooking, and time management, under the watchful eyes of their guardians. This enables them to navigate the challenges of adulthood with greater confidence and competence. Moreover, staying with family also provides an opportunity to build stronger relationships with parents, fostering a deeper understanding and respect for one another.While the idea of independence may seem appealing, I firmly believe that young adults should live with their parents for a longer period. Not only does this provide a smoother transition into adulthood, but it also allows for a more stable and secure environment in which to grow and develop. Ultimately, the benefits of extended family living far outweigh the perceived benefits of premature independence, making it the more prudent choice for young adults.

question: Nowadays the way many people interact with each other has changed because of technology. In what ways has technology affected the types of relationships people make? Has this become a positive or negative development.
human: Nowadays, the Earth has become like a small village. In the course of the last hundred years, the way majority of people communicate with each other has been altered significantly because of technology. But there are vast amount of disputes whether it is positive or negative. From my point of view, this development was a very positive one in spite of its some drawbacks.To begin with, nowadays, to keep in touch with loved ones in faraway places has become easy than ever. Technology revolutionized the way we communicate and in present, it is almost possible to do everything without tete-a-tete. By means of some software such as Skype, MSN, Whatsapp we can get in touch with everybody whenever we want. For example, in earlier times, people didn't leave for faraway places, because they could easily get lost. This is also one salient prove that the development of technology was a very positive.Further, by means of some communication tools, it has become very easy to make new friends. According to statistics, 40% of people met even their life partners via Internet. In this sense, Internet is a basic tool to keep in touch with old and make new friends.However, the other side of the coin is that, by communicating via Internet or phone, we cannot express our ideas and feelings fully, because during such conversations, some of our words can make a completely different sense. As a result, the rate of divorces is increasing day by day. By way of conclusion, I once again restate my position that the development of technology impacted on the means of communication among people very positively by making it easier and more comfortable.
llm: The past hundred years have witnessed a profound transformation in the way people communicate with one another, primarily driven by the rapid advancement of technology. In my opinion, this development has been overwhelmingly positive, despite some drawbacks.To begin with, technology has made it easier than ever to stay in touch with loved ones in faraway places. Gone are the days of relying on traditional postal services, which often took days or even weeks to deliver letters. With the advent of email, social media, and messaging apps, people can now communicate with each other in real-time, regardless of geographical distance. This has been particularly beneficial for those with family and friends living abroad, allowing them to maintain strong relationships despite physical distance.Furthermore, technology has also enabled people to connect with others who share similar interests and passions. Online communities and forums have sprouted up around various hobbies and topics, providing a platform for like-minded individuals to share ideas, knowledge, and experiences. This has not only expanded people's social circles but also fostered a sense of belonging and identity.Another significant advantage of technology is its ability to facilitate remote communication for professional purposes. Video conferencing tools and instant messaging apps have made it possible for colleagues to collaborate and conduct business meetings from anywhere in the world. This has opened up new opportunities for remote work and has greatly increased productivity.Of course, there are some drawbacks to this development. The over-reliance on technology has led to concerns about social isolation, decreased face-to-face interaction, and the spread of misinformation. However, in my opinion, these concerns are far outweighed by the numerous benefits that technology has brought to the way we communicate.In conclusion, the impact of technology on communication has been a profoundly positive one, allowing people to connect with each other in ways that were previously unimaginable. While there are some potential downsides, I firmly believe that the advantages of this development make it an overall net gain for society.

question: With the increasing use and development of new technology, many machines are now able to do the work which people used to perform. What are the advantages and disadvantages of this trend?
human: The issue of whether using of machine are bring many advantages to society is of great concern to many people. In my opinion, although using machines have many benefits, we cannot ignore its negative effects.It is undoubted that machines can bring many benefits. For one thing, machines are more effective than human. Not like human, machines do not need rest, which means they can work as long as employers want and consistently produce high quality products without any mistakes. For another, using machines can save company's money. Because machines never ask for salary, over-time pay or pension, so employers do not need to spend money on employee's welfare. The company only needs some technicians to make sure machines are working on the right track or replace some part when machines are not working. However, the disadvantages of machines that bring to us should not be neglected by people. To start with, because of extensive of using machines, many people loss their job. Especially in large population countries, high unemployment rate may cause crime and social instability. Apart from this, using of machines are also pose serious pollution and energy dissipation. For example, nowadays people prefer to use dish-washing machine to wash dishes and plates rather than hand washing. But they did not know that compared with hand washing dish-washing machine consume at least 2 times water and electricity to wash these tableware. As you can imagine, if thousands of families use dish-washing machines, how many water and how much electricity will be wasted!In conclusion, although we cannot deny machines are play a vital role in people living and working, problems posed by machines should draws more attentions as well.
llm: The advent of machines has undoubtedly brought numerous benefits to society. One of the primary advantages of machines is their unparalleled effectiveness compared to humans. Unlike humans, machines do not require rest, which means they can work tirelessly around the clock as long as their employers desire. This unique ability enables machines to consistently produce high-quality products without any mistakes.In contrast, humans are prone to fatigue, which can lead to decreased productivity and accuracy. As humans work for extended periods, their concentration and attention to detail may wane, resulting in subpar performance. Machines, on the other hand, maintain their optimal functioning level at all times, ensuring that every product that rolls off the assembly line meets the highest standards.Moreover, machines can perform tasks with precision and speed that would be impossible for humans to match. For instance, in manufacturing, machines can assemble complex components with ease, whereas humans would struggle to keep up with the demanding pace. This increased efficiency translates to faster production times, lower costs, and ultimately, lower prices for consumers.Another significant benefit of machines is their ability to work in hazardous environments that would be dangerous for humans. For example, in mining and construction, machines can operate in extreme conditions, such as high temperatures or toxic atmospheres, without risking human lives. By taking on these tasks, machines have significantly improved workplace safety and reduced the number of accidents.In conclusion, the benefits of machines to society are multifaceted and far-reaching. Their ability to work tirelessly, produce high-quality products, and perform tasks with precision and speed make them invaluable assets in various industries. As technology continues to advance, it is likely that machines will become even more integrated into our daily lives, leading to further improvements in efficiency, productivity, and safety.

question: In the last 20 years there have been significant developments in the field of information technology (IT), for example, the World Wide Web and communication by email. However, future developments in IT are likely to have more negative effects than positive. To what extent do you agree with this view?
human: Decade after decade, every day, scientists discover magnificent devices in the field of IT, such as interactive boards, multicore computers and laptops, tablets, which have an incredible resolution and also mobile phones, which have the power of a computer. World Wide Web and communication via email are some of the positive sides of information technology, however, there are some negative aspects.Firstly, connecting people by email is easy and fast. In addition, World Wide Web offers humanity to access to information, which they want to know for less than 10 seconds. These are two of the benefits, why IT is useful.Besides, nowadays technology is entering into our society really quick and scientists develop robots, which help people cope with their problems or just invent coffee machines, engines with integrated computers and etc. For example, before centeries, there were not washing machines, which clean your clothes, while a person do another job.Secondly, there are some drawbacks about this issue. Scientists believe that one day people will face their developments, for instance robots, and they will not succeed to control them. All this inventions will try to take control of the Earth.In conclusion, I agree that IT discoveries are likely to have more disadvantages than benefits and people should know how to use their developments properly.
llm: The rapid advancements in Information Technology (IT) have transformed the way we live, work, and interact with one another. Every day, scientists discover and develop magnificent devices that revolutionize the field of IT. Interactive boards, multicore computers, laptops, and tablets with incredible resolution are just a few examples of the innovative technologies that have made our lives easier and more efficient.Interactive boards, for instance, have transformed the way we learn and teach. With the ability to write, draw, and project images, these boards have made classrooms more engaging and interactive. Multicore computers, on the other hand, have increased processing power, enabling us to perform multiple tasks simultaneously with greater speed and accuracy. Laptops and tablets, with their high-resolution displays, have made it possible to work, play, and communicate on the go.However, despite the numerous benefits of IT, there are also some negative aspects that cannot be ignored. One of the major concerns is the impact of IT on our social skills and relationships. The increased reliance on technology has led to a decline in face-to-face interactions, resulting in social isolation and decreased empathy. Cyberbullying, online harassment, and the spread of misinformation are also serious issues that need to be addressed.Furthermore, the rapid obsolescence of IT devices has contributed to electronic waste, posing a significant threat to the environment. The constant need for upgrades and new devices has led to a culture of disposability, where devices are discarded without consideration for their environmental impact.In conclusion, while the advancements in IT have brought about numerous benefits and improvements to our lives, it is essential to acknowledge and address the negative aspects of these technologies. By being aware of the potential drawbacks, we can work towards creating a more balanced and sustainable relationship with IT, ensuring that its benefits are enjoyed by all, while minimizing its negative impacts on society and the environment.

question: Many people believe that media coverage of celebrities is having a negative effect on children. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: Today, celebrities appear to become a spotlight of the mass media. Almost half of the news coverage on television and the Internet is devoted to the celebrity gossip. Not surprisingly, many people are worried that this attention to the famous people has an impact on them, especially on their children. This essay will compare both negative and positive consequences of this effect on infants.Fame is a great responsibility for public people as their admirers are very sensitive to any acts of their idols. Celebrity scandals and gossips can quickly reach the public which perceive it very negatively. This means that celebrities who received attention for overuse of drugs or alcohol are likely to get public disgrace. Therefore, children may see that this behavior is inexcusable.On the other hand, too much news coverage to famous people seems to have a negative influence on the choice of children of their future professions. As recent surveys showed, inspired by the fame and wealth, children now prefer more to become an actor/actress or a sports star than it was in the past. Many schools for preparation of so-called stars and various advertisements about famous people may mislead with the fact that this profession is highly required and easy reachable. This may confuse children who should not choose their future job because of the influence of the mass media, but from the basis of their own interests.In conclusion, parents should be more worried about their children's attitudes to the 'cult of celebrity'. They should teach their children how to distinguish shortcoming stars from truly talented ones and to put right priorities in life.
llm: The world of celebrities has always been a subject of fascination for many. The constant media attention on famous personalities has led to a growing concern among the public, particularly parents, about the impact of this phenomenon on children. On one hand, fame can be a double-edged sword for public figures, as their every move is scrutinized by their admirers. This brings a great deal of responsibility on their shoulders, as their actions can have a profound influence on their fans, especially the young and impressionable ones.On the other hand, excessive media coverage of celebrities seems to have a negative influence on the career choices of children. Many youngsters are inspired by the glitz and glamour of the celebrity world and aspire to become famous themselves. This can lead to a lack of interest in more conventional and stable professions, such as medicine, engineering, or teaching. Instead, they may pursue careers in the entertainment industry, which are often highly competitive and uncertain. This trend can have far-reaching consequences, as it may lead to a shortage of skilled professionals in essential fields.Moreover, the constant exposure to celebrity culture can also lead to unrealistic expectations and a distorted view of reality. Children may become disillusioned with the more mundane aspects of life and instead, crave the fame, wealth, and luxury that they see portrayed in the media. This can result in a lack of appreciation for the value of hard work, dedication, and perseverance, which are essential qualities for success in any field.In conclusion, while fame can bring many benefits, it is crucial that public figures recognize the responsibility that comes with their celebrity status. Parents, educators, and the media must also work together to promote a balanced view of the world, highlighting the importance of diverse career choices and the value of hard work and dedication. Only then can we ensure that the next generation is well-rounded, realistic, and equipped to make a positive impact on society.

question: Some people argue that the technology such as mobile phone (cell phone) destroys social interaction. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Recently, there has been a social concern in regards to whether mobile phones have a negative effect in our social communication. Indeed, mobile phones have been widely used for people of all ages, bringing convenience and entertainment into our life. However, as far as I am concerned, I strongly agree with the view that this great invention causes many social problems.In the first place, spending too much time on phones may exert adverse effects on social life. In the first place, as people increasingly tend to focus and relay on phones, they may lose their interest on daily activities like meeting with their friends so that distraction may be developed during study or social activities. Moreover, continuous use of mobile phone may damage both eyesight and physical posture of the children.Furthermore, there are many types of games available in the phone and many of them are very aggressive in nature such as "Iron man". In those games, children are rewarded for being more violent, and this violence is repeated again and again. For instance, many games involve children helping their character to kill or shoot, which many lead to increased aggressive feelings, thoughts and behaviours. Therefore, the hardship of communication may be developed.However, other people may perceive this issue from different viewpoint. With rapid development of the internet, people are able to enjoy quick electronic communication via internet. For instance, as lots of chatting apps available online such as "Weichat", people tend to send instant messages free of charge by using their phones rather than face to face communication. Therefore, mobile phones have shortened the distance of communication.After having considered all the problems that I have discussed above, we can finally draw a conclusion that although mobile phones brings convenience of communication, they also contribute to some social problems.
llm: The proliferation of mobile phones has revolutionized the way people of all ages communicate, access information, and seek entertainment. However, despite the numerous benefits that mobile phones have brought to our lives, I strongly concur with the notion that this invention has given rise to a multitude of social problems.First and foremost, the excessive reliance on mobile phones has led to a decline in people's interest in daily activities. With the constant stream of notifications, updates, and endless scrolling, individuals are spending an inordinate amount of time glued to their screens, sacrificing face-to-face interactions and hands-on experiences. This trend is particularly concerning among the younger generation, who are missing out on valuable opportunities for socialization, learning, and personal growth. As people become increasingly enamored with their phones, they risk becoming disengaged from the world around them, leading to a sense of isolation and disconnection.Furthermore, the prolonged use of mobile phones has been linked to a host of physical and visual problems, particularly among children. Staring at screens for extended periods can lead to eye strain, headaches, and decreased eyesight, while the sedentary nature of phone use contributes to poor posture, back pain, and a range of other musculoskeletal issues. These health concerns are compounded by the fact that children are spending more time indoors, glued to their screens, rather than engaging in outdoor activities that promote physical and mental well-being. As a result, it is imperative that parents, educators, and policymakers take steps to mitigate these risks, promoting responsible phone use and encouraging a balance between technology and traditional activities.

question: Modern forms of communication such as email and messaging have reduced the amount of time people spend seeing their friends. This has had a negative effect on their social lives. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Undoubtedly, the movement of modern forms of communication has changed better, which help people to interact to others, such as email and messaging without limitation time. I totally agree that using of these soft devices have cut much of time people need to see with their relatives. However, it is had some demerits on their social lives.Mentioned to societies life style, they constantly use these kinds of electronic letter for making fellowship or just continuing theirs what they already had. Obviousness, there are other ways like social media that they could to use it for meeting theirs buddies such as Twitter and Facebook, also make the communication become feasible and limitless of time.Another perspective, using of these facilities has influenced netizens to keep themselves becoming unsociable. It caused they were swept away by virtual atmosphere, so they do not do much social live interactions with others. The consequence of this case made some people become geek, as too much of using email and messaging, without direct contacts. However, people have had own minded to keep connection with their friends as a good relationship, meet them and talk by face to face directly.In conclusion, I admittedly and strongly agree that the merits of email and messaging have reduced amount of ours time to communicate to. Besides, we need to make sure for the real gathering with our colleague.
llm: The advent of modern forms of communication has revolutionized the way people interact with each other. The advent of the internet, email, and instant messaging has made it possible for people to connect with others across the globe without any limitations of time and space. These technological advancements have undoubtedly changed the way we communicate for the better.On the one hand, modern forms of communication have numerous benefits. Email and messaging apps have made it possible for people to stay in touch with friends and family who live far away. These platforms have also enabled people to connect with others who share similar interests and passions, thereby expanding their social circle. Moreover, the ease and speed of communication have enabled people to stay updated about current events, news, and trends. For instance, social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook have become essential tools for staying informed about local and global news.On the other hand, the increasing reliance on modern forms of communication has had some negative impacts on social lives. One of the most significant demerits is the decline in face-to-face communication. People are spending more time interacting with their screens than with real-life individuals. This has led to a decline in deep, meaningful relationships and an increase in feelings of loneliness and isolation. Furthermore, the constant need to be connected and responsive has led to a culture of instant gratification, where people expect immediate responses and attention. This has resulted in a decline in attention span and an increase in stress levels.In conclusion, modern forms of communication have undoubtedly changed the way we interact with each other for the better. However, it is essential to acknowledge the negative impacts of these technologies on our social lives. To strike a balance, it is crucial to use these technologies judiciously and make an effort to maintain face-to-face communication and nurture meaningful relationships.

question: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Other believe that children who are taught to co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults.
human: It is undeniable that children have an innocent mind, and they requires a proper guidance at a specific time to make them understand the value of life. Some people think that it is better to make them competitive, while other believes to make them co-operative. Both these factors have their own values, and have been discussed in detail below:Competitive children are more likely to be confident enough to handle the situations independently. This factor initially arises from the school, where teacher encourages student to feel more competitive through the grading system, and this is the place where children are trying to get on the top by scoring the highest marks. This factor will lead them to be successful in their lives ahead, but will also restrict them in many ways. For example, MNCs are mainly focusing on a team work, and a person with the competitive mind would be having a difficulty in managing the situation with the team.However, those who wants to create a sense of co-operation in their children is a symbol that they want to make them sensible enough in their lives ahead. Although, they will not be having a pace and an eager to get on the top as the competitors do, but they shall have an art of managing different situations of life with the help of a team.In my opinion, though competitive children will be far more clever and faster than the co-operative child in an initial level, but it will not help them to be on the success path for the long run; while on the contrary, co-operative child will have a potential of structuring and implementing new and innovative ideas with the help of a team.To conclude, I would say that people should create a sense of co-operation in their children to make them feel more accomplished in life.
llm: **The Duality of Childhood: Balancing Competition and Cooperation**As children grow and develop, they begin to exhibit distinct personality traits that shape their approach to challenges and interactions. Two such fundamental characteristics are competitiveness and cooperativeness. While these traits may seem mutually exclusive, research suggests that they serve distinct purposes, and children who exhibit both qualities can reap benefits in different aspects of life.**Competitive Children: Independent Problem-Solvers**Children who exhibit competitive tendencies are often more confident in their abilities and more likely to take risks. This confidence enables them to handle situations independently, relying on their own judgment and resourcefulness. When faced with a challenge, they are more inclined to persevere and push themselves to achieve their goals. As a result, competitive children tend to develop strong problem-solving skills, which serve them well in individual pursuits such as academics, sports, or entrepreneurship. Their independent nature also allows them to navigate uncertain situations, think critically, and make decisions without relying on others.**Cooperative Children: Innovative Team Players**On the other hand, cooperative children are adept at working collaboratively with others, fostering an environment of mutual support and respect. This ability to collaborate enables them to structure and implement innovative ideas, leveraging the diverse perspectives and skills of their teammates. Cooperative children are more likely to excel in group projects, community service, or creative endeavors that require collective brainstorming and problem-solving. By working together, they can pool their knowledge, share ideas, and build on each other's strengths to create something greater than the sum of its parts.**Conclusion**In conclusion, both competitive and cooperative traits hold significant value in childhood development. While competitive children develop the confidence and independence to tackle challenges on their own, cooperative children learn to harness the power of teamwork, creativity, and collective innovation. By recognizing and nurturing these diverse strengths, parents, educators, and caregivers can help children cultivate a balanced approach to life, enabling them to excel in various contexts and become well-rounded, effective individuals. Ultimately, embracing both competition and cooperation can equip children with the skills, confidence, and creativity needed to succeed in an increasingly complex and interconnected world.

question: Nowadays the way many people interact with each other has changed because of technology. In what ways has technology affected the types of relationships people make? Has this become a positive or negative development?
human: Nowadays, the variety of communication systems used widely. As technology develops, it has negative influences in many respects. However, I strongly agree with that the technology has large positive effects on relationships between people. The main advantage is that technology has enabled people stay in contact with each other more closely. While public use the Internet or smart phone to share information to each other at different positions. Instead of using letters, technology advanced not only gives us more spare time but also convenient and efficient. More, even if family members who are in different countries, they also can use the Internet to connect each others, especially though the images or videos, they can feel close. Furthermore, technology is also essential for students, live in remote districts, shared the valuable natural resources with friends. Another issue is that in the ever-accelerated updating of science and technology, technology provides opportunities for people to establish the social network. In the past, people might have had pen friends in other countries, but now, thanks to the social networking websites, people can easily to find someone who has similar interests. Also, they can connect with friends who have been out of touch for a long time by using the Internet. In this way, technology is beneficial to humanity develops positive relationships. In conclusion, I agree with that the technology has more optimal effects on people's interaction, because it helps ordinary people to make new friends and to maintain relationships.
llm: The rapid development of technology has brought about a multitude of both positive and negative impacts on various aspects of our lives. While some argue that technology has detrimental effects, I firmly believe that it has a profoundly positive influence on relationships between people.On the one hand, it is undeniable that technology has some negative consequences. For instance, excessive social media usage can lead to social isolation, decreased attention span, and a decline in face-to-face communication skills. Additionally, the constant stream of information can be overwhelming, causing stress and anxiety. However, when it comes to interpersonal relationships, I strongly believe that technology has a net positive effect.Technology has made it easier for people to stay connected, regardless of geographical distance. Social media platforms, messaging apps, and video conferencing tools have enabled us to maintain relationships with friends and family who may be physically far away. This has been especially beneficial for people who have moved away from their hometowns or have loved ones living abroad. Moreover, technology has also enabled people to connect with others who share similar interests and hobbies, fostering a sense of community and belonging.Furthermore, technology has also facilitated communication and collaboration in both personal and professional settings. Email, instant messaging, and project management tools have made it possible to work together seamlessly, regardless of location. This has not only improved productivity but also strengthened relationships between colleagues and clients.In conclusion, while technology has its drawbacks, its positive effects on relationships between people far outweigh the negative. By facilitating communication, connection, and collaboration, technology has bridged geographical gaps and fostered a sense of community and belonging. As technology continues to evolve, I am excited to see how it will further shape and improve our relationships with others.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: With the development of technology, whether or not it is still necessary to protect the traditional skills and lifestyles leads to a drastic controversy which is becoming a public concern, especially considering the significant impact taken by technology. As far as I am concerned, the importance of traditions should be valued and paid attention to.Traditional skills and lifestyles play important role in modern society, in terms of healthcare, environmental protection and cultural inherit. Although technology takes convenience to humankind, it also contributes to unhealthy behaviors of life, like sedentary lifestyle. Instead, traditional ways of life is a great complimentary for modern life and highlight the importance of work life balance. Meanwhile, due to the fact that traditional skills rely little on fossil energy, it is more environmentally-friendly, which should be promoted to reduce the threat of climate change. Furthermore those tradition-related things convey traditional culture and values. These are important foundation of modern civilization. Protection of tradition can provide the possibility to better understand ancient culture and utilize them to tackle modern problems.Some people who hold different viewpoints may advocate that protecting traditions consume too much financial budget compared with the incoming it takes. In spite of the fact this kind of business bring limited contribution to government finance, it should be emphasized that the expense is trivial compared with the potential value of traditions. Therefore the government authorities and education institutes should work closely together to promote the traditional skills and ways of life, so as to make people to realize the value of them.All in all, protection of tradition is not only important for the entire society currently, but also contributes to the next generation.
llm: The significance of traditional skills and lifestyles in modern society cannot be overstated. Despite the rapid pace of technological advancements and urbanization, these time-honored practices continue to play a vital role in healthcare, environmental protection, and cultural inheritance.In the realm of healthcare, traditional practices have proven to be invaluable. For instance, the use of herbal medicine and natural remedies has been shown to be effective in treating various ailments, from common colds to chronic diseases. Furthermore, the emphasis on holistic wellness, mental balance, and spiritual harmony in traditional cultures has contributed to the development of alternative therapies and stress management techniques. By embracing these traditional approaches, modern healthcare can provide more comprehensive and sustainable solutions to the growing healthcare needs of our populations.Environmental protection is another area where traditional skills and lifestyles have much to offer. Indigenous communities, for example, have long lived in harmony with nature, employing sustainable practices such as permaculture, agroforestry, and eco-friendly agriculture. These methods not only preserve biodiversity but also promote climate resilience and mitigate the effects of pollution. By learning from these traditional practices, we can develop more effective strategies for environmental conservation and sustainable development.The preservation of traditional skills and lifestyles also ensures the continuation of cultural heritage and inheritance. By safeguarding ancient customs, languages, and art forms, we can gain a deeper understanding of the cultural context in which they evolved. This, in turn, allows us to appreciate the wisdom and ingenuity of our ancestors and apply their knowledge to address contemporary challenges.In conclusion, traditional skills and lifestyles remain essential components of modern society. By embracing and protecting these practices, we can tap into the collective wisdom of our ancestors, foster a more holistic approach to healthcare, promote environmental sustainability, and preserve the rich cultural tapestry of our global community. As we move forward in this rapidly changing world, it is imperative that we cherish and learn from the timeless traditions that have shaped human history.

question: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Others believe that children who are taught to be co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
human: In present educational system there are variety of competitions in academic area and athletic area for children to attend, which could stimulating the will of children to learn and to achieve the best of them, and also be able to teach them teamwork skill. However, some people think it is better to make children be competitive than cooperative, both the values have its arguments.A strong competition sense helps children having urge to learn or to practice for being the best among peers, and this factor is initially arises from the schools and parents, to encourage children to get the highest scores through the grading system. Even though a competitive child is usually more motivated to pursue a goal or to face difficulties independently, but it is also risky that children are becoming too competitive to cooperating with others. Being competitive leads them to success, but could also restrict them in many ways. For example, it might be hard for a competitive person to deal or manage in a team work project.On the other hand, cooperation is also an essential quality for children, no matter in school activities or in communities. Having a good cooperating spirit helps kids to communicate and get along with others, which gives them more possibility to solve problems or to achieve a goal easily by working as a team. After all, in society, there is hardly anyone who could has big achievement by oneself. For example, famous singers or movie stars, despite of their talent to make them successful, there are always a team to manage works or deal with things.In my point of view, though competitive child would have more motivation and perspective that leads them to success, but it would not help them much once they enter to society or company which required more about skill of team work. To sum up, I would say that schools and adults should put a sense of cooperation in children to make them becoming a useful adult whether in society or community.
llm: The age-old debate surrounding the values of competitiveness and cooperation in children has sparked intense discussion among parents, educators, and experts. While some argue that fostering a competitive spirit in children is essential for their success, others believe that cooperation is the key to their development. In this essay, we will explore the arguments for both perspectives.On one hand, instilling a sense of competitiveness in children can have numerous benefits. A strong competitive drive can motivate children to learn, practice, and strive to be the best among their peers. This, in turn, can lead to improved academic performance, better time management, and a stronger work ethic. Moreover, a competitive spirit can prepare children for the realities of the adult world, where competition is a natural part of personal and professional life. For instance, in sports, competitions, and other extracurricular activities, children learn to set goals, push themselves to achieve them, and develop resilience in the face of setbacks.On the other hand, cooperation is an equally essential quality for children to develop. In school activities, group projects, and community service, children learn the value of teamwork, communication, and mutual respect. Cooperation teaches children to appreciate different perspectives, empathize with others, and work towards a common goal. Furthermore, cooperation is vital in building strong relationships, resolving conflicts, and creating a sense of belonging. For example, in group projects, children learn to delegate tasks, rely on each other's strengths, and celebrate each other's successes.In conclusion, both competitiveness and cooperation are valuable qualities that children should develop. While a competitive spirit can drive children to achieve their best, cooperation is essential for building strong relationships, achieving common goals, and creating a sense of community. Ultimately, a balanced approach that nurtures both competitiveness and cooperation is necessary for children to become well-rounded, successful, and socially responsible individuals. By acknowledging the merits of both values, parents and educators can provide children with the tools they need to thrive in all aspects of life.

question: Some people think that advertising give more harms than good to our society. Other refute this. Discuss both views and give your opinion
human: On these days, with the assistance of advertisement, people easily purchase the best products with detailed information and instruction for their requirement. Although some people claim that the advantages of advertising are outweigh the advantages, I believe that advertisement bring more benefits than harms to our lives.On the one hand, it is clear that most advertisements so exaggerate the quality of their products that they often ignore some negative effects of what they sell. In addition to this, all of things are advertised as the best ones result in the confusing for users in picking out the most suitable goods. For example, some kinds of shampoo, namely Sunsilk, Clear, Dove are publicized as magic items to recreate injured hair with the number of other benefits. However, the fact is that not all customers are satisfied with what they bought under the introduction from advertisement. On the other hand, it is undeniable fact that advertising market gives lots of working opportunities from producers, writers to models and cameramen for all of people as long as their qualification adapt to the demands. Moreover, advertisement enables to support users in getting accustomed to enterprises and know thoroughly items sold from these producers. Take Coca cola for an example, this drinking firm is well-known as one of companies invested a major part of their money in advertising. No wonder why this drinking title becomes more and more familiar with customers around the world. Last but not least, online advertisement is one of the easiest approaches due to their potential gains such as cheaper cost, convenience and easily observing.To sum up, everything has its own gains and losses and advertisement is not an exception. From my point of view, advertising will be better if producers and advertisers are more honest in producing advertisements to give people the general view on one product.
llm: The Impact of Advertisement on Our Lives: Weighing the Advantages and HarmsThe debate surrounding the impact of advertisement on our lives has sparked intense discussion in recent years. On one hand, some people argue that the advantages of advertisement far outweigh the potential harms it may cause. On the other hand, it is undeniable that the advertising market provides numerous working opportunities for individuals from diverse professions, including producers, writers, models, and cameramen.One of the primary benefits of advertisement is its ability to inform consumers about new products and services, allowing them to make informed purchasing decisions. Advertisement also plays a crucial role in promoting competition among businesses, driving innovation and improvement in product quality. Moreover, the advertising industry provides a platform for creative expression, enabling individuals to showcase their artistic skills and talent.The rise of online advertisement has further amplified the benefits of advertisement. Online advertisement offers several advantages, including lower costs, convenience, and ease of monitoring. With the click of a button, businesses can reach a vast audience, track the effectiveness of their campaigns, and make adjustments in real-time. This has made online advertisement an attractive option for businesses of all sizes, from small startups to multinational corporations.However, it is essential to acknowledge the potential harms of advertisement. Excessive exposure to advertisement can lead to consumerism, materialism, and a distorted perception of reality. Furthermore, some advertisement may promote unhealthy or unsustainable lifestyles, contributing to social and environmental problems.In conclusion, while advertisement may have its drawbacks, the advantages it offers, including the provision of working opportunities and the promotion of competition, cannot be overlooked. As the advertising market continues to evolve, it is crucial to strike a balance between the benefits and harms of advertisement, ensuring that its impact on our lives is positive and sustainable.

question: Some modern artists receive huge sums of money for the things they create, while other struggle to survive. Government should take steps to resolve this unfair situation. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: The amount of money people earning sometimes is unfair. In a field of art, modern artist may receive high salary for their masterpiece creation while labors should be break their bone for years to get similar amount of money. Although some people view that government should be take a responsibility for this unfair situation, critics against such view. I agree that in this occasion the government is not granted to hand in.Proficiency brings perfectness in terms of art work. It is true while the modern artists who implement their creative thinking onto high value creation are paid with immense sum by the art collector. Also, the high sum which modern artists receive is related to the quality instead of the quantity and their rare talent. For example, a 15 centimeter Buddha temple made by hand is granted times in comparison with factory production. On the other hand, modern artists also devote themselves find a unique concept in which ordinary people cannot do, such making impossible become possible. Pieter Padang, Minion creator, has brilliant idea to alter part of song lyric "I swear" become "underwear" when the Minion sing in Despicable Me. He granted huge sums for such idea.Striking contrast, labor working in the merchandise factory receive coin of dollar even they make a hundred of 15 cm Buddha temples a day. In any case, a musician playing "I swear" several times receives different earnings that Padang got because the musician re-plays the song without any creation. Moreover, government cannot equalize the price of creation of modern artist because there is no certain parameter to value it, art value is about taste.Having said that the huge sums of modern artists receives related to their struggle in the field of art, while the term of struggle might different with other field of job. I agree that government cannot take steps to make the salary between modern artists and other job similar because art price is about taste.
llm: The art world has long been plagued by a glaring disparity in compensation, where modern artists can command exorbitant sums for their creations, while laborers toil for years to earn a fraction of that amount. This stark contrast has sparked heated debates about the role of government in addressing this perceived unfairness.Proponents of government intervention argue that it is the state's responsibility to ensure a more equitable distribution of wealth and opportunities. They contend that the government should implement policies to support laborers and artists alike, providing a safety net and resources to help them achieve financial stability. By doing so, the government can help bridge the gap between the haves and have-nots, promoting a more just and equal society.However, critics of government intervention argue that such measures would stifle creativity and innovation in the art world. They posit that the free market dictates the value of art, and that government interference would only serve to distort this natural process. Moreover, they argue that government support for artists would lead to a proliferation of mediocrity, as the emphasis would shift from creating art for art's sake to creating art for government funding.Furthermore, critics argue that laborers and artists are not mutually exclusive categories, and that many artists are also laborers, struggling to make ends meet. They suggest that rather than relying on government handouts, artists and laborers should focus on developing their skills, networking, and marketing themselves to increase their earning potential.In conclusion, the debate surrounding government responsibility in addressing the pay disparity between modern artists and laborers is complex and multifaceted. While some argue that government intervention is necessary to promote fairness and equality, others contend that such measures would undermine the very fabric of the art world. Ultimately, a balanced approach that supports both artists and laborers, while also promoting innovation and creativity, is necessary to address this pressing issue.

question: People tend to work longer hours nowadays. Working long hours has a negative effect on themselves, their families and the society, so working hours should be restricted. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Working longer hours is becoming prevalent in these days. There is a saying in my native village, "Health is Wealth". I believe many of people including me are not really considering the importance of health. The need for increased working hours might be because of enhanced competitive environment and desire to acquire much money and promotion. However, people working for extended hours have been found having adverse effects on their health and personal life. In my opinion, a balance between personal and professional life should be created by restricting maximum number of working hours. First of all, many of us would agree to the fact that people; who prefer working longer hours, do not find time to focus on their health. By working too long, they often become tired, lazy and reluctant to carry out physical exercise in order to remain fit and healthy and eventually loose health and become sick. Moreover, they become extensively addicted to their work and become workaholic type persons. The repercussion are so severe that their families and friends remain deprived off their attention and in the end they end up losing balance between their family and personal life.Secondly, these workaholic people do not spend time for the contribution of society by actively participating in any social campaign. As they usually remain busy in their office so they do not find leisure time for such social activities. For instance, I would take my boss's example; he has been working for extended hours in office for many years. Recently, his health and personal life was drastically affected as he broke up with his wife and his family life has totally been in chaos and cries. He started regretting afterwards and now trying to manage his work but it seems to be too late for him.To conclude this, I would strongly emphasis and recommend, Government must include the clause of maximum number of working hours in its Labor Law and enforce to all companies for ensuring their employees do not spend extended hours in companies. This will help in uplift of society, and bring the lost equilibrium between personal and professional life of each individual person.
llm: The Impact of Extended Working Hours on Health and Personal LifeIn today's fast-paced world, it has become increasingly common for people to work extended hours, often sacrificing their personal lives for the sake of their careers. However, research has shown that this trend has severe consequences on both physical and mental health, as well as personal relationships. Prolonged working hours can lead to a decline in overall well-being, making individuals more susceptible to various health problems.One of the primary effects of extended working hours is the depletion of energy levels. When people work for long periods, they often become exhausted, leading to a lack of motivation to engage in physical activities. Regular exercise is essential for maintaining a healthy lifestyle, but the tiredness and laziness caused by prolonged work hours can make it challenging for individuals to prioritize physical fitness. As a result, they may experience weight gain, decreased cardiovascular health, and other related problems.Furthermore, working extended hours can also lead to addiction. When individuals become overly invested in their work, they can develop a workaholic mentality, prioritizing their job above all else. This can lead to an imbalance in their personal and professional life, causing strain on relationships with family and friends. The constant pressure to meet deadlines and the stress associated with prolonged work hours can also contribute to mental health issues, such as anxiety and depression.In conclusion, working extended hours can have severe and long-lasting effects on an individual's health and personal life. It is essential for employers and employees to recognize the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance. By promoting flexible working hours, providing resources for stress management, and encouraging physical activity, we can mitigate the adverse effects of prolonged work hours and foster a healthier, more balanced lifestyle.

question: A successful person is one who has earned a lot of money. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: It's such a common definition of a successful person is one who has earned a lot of money, especially in nowadays society. Each individual visualize success differently. Still, my term of a successful man is one who has certain achievements in life rather than the one with a high income.Money is undeniably pivotal, but ways of earning it is also various. A person's great prosperity does not state that he has gained it ethically by himself. Nevertheless, a man can only achieve his accomplishment through hard-working, dedication and passion. Whether it is a personal or a social achievement, that man is laudable.More importantly, the more beneficial for the society his achievement is, the more successful he is considered. For instance, Thomas Edison is undeniably considered as one of the greatest inventors in the 20th century since his invention's productivity is countless useful for mankind. On the other hand, the fact of knowing a man's utilization of his money remains in the dark. Therefore, judging a person by his income is difficult, especially in the success aspect.In conclusion, using only money as a scale to measure a man's success is impossible despite the fact that it is the essential in basic needs. Yet, it is the common scene that a man can be publicly considered successful when his achievements, which can only accomplished by passion, dedication and ethics, are helpful not only for himself.
llm: The notion of success is often misconstrued with wealth and material possessions. However, a successful man is not solely defined by his bank account or the digits on his paycheck. Rather, it is the accomplishments and achievements that one attains in life that truly measure success.Money, undoubtedly, plays a significant role in our lives, providing us with the means to sustain ourselves and our loved ones. Nevertheless, the ways of earning it are diverse and varied. One can accumulate wealth through a myriad of means, but it is the value and purpose behind one's work that truly matters.A man who has dedicated his life to a craft or a cause, pouring his heart and soul into it, is far more successful than one who merely accumulates wealth without passion or purpose. The former may not have a hefty bank account, but his sense of fulfillment and accomplishment far surpasses that of the latter.It is through hard work, dedication, and passion that one can truly achieve their goals and aspirations. A man who is driven by a sense of purpose, who strives to make a positive impact, and who perseveres through adversity, is the epitome of success. His accomplishments may not be measured in dollars and cents, but in the positive difference he has made in the lives of others.In conclusion, a successful man is not solely defined by his income or material possessions. Rather, it is the value and purpose behind his work, and the accomplishments he achieves through hard work, dedication, and passion, that truly measure his success. It is time we redefine our notion of success and recognize the true value of a life well-lived, a life of purpose, and a life of meaningful achievement.

question: Question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which there are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowdays, people's choice of consumption is heavily affected by various of advertising on television, street, magazine etc. This argument may be true that people will be swayed by the advertising and buy things they do not need it for their life. For example, in most asian countries, advertisement company usually hire popular singers or actors to advertise the products to boosts the sales, and some people, especially adolescent may buy things from their favourite singer advertised to support their idol instead of to fill their needs.In addition, products usually look more gorgeous and with good quality in advertisement, people are more likely to buy goods impulsively without a second thought. A good advertisement can convince people to believe that it is what they want, even though it is not the real needs of the society. And there are always people purchase particular products swayed by advertising which makes it a trend to follow for other people who is unnecessarily need it.However, buying habit is a very personal things for individuals, the advertisement is not the only cause for people to buy, sometimes it depends on one's needs and ability of consumption. It is unlikely to buy things impulsively for adults who have concern of arranging disposable income. Most of them have to allocate the money if they doing other purchase. On the other hand, children and adolescents who is not economic independence is more possible to buy things impulsively without considering whether they need it or not, since they do not have financial pressure from life and ability to define what is necessary.In my opinion, I think buying habit is people's choice to make, not entirely affected by advertisements. But for children or adolescents who is not mentally develop, it might be hard for them not to swayed by advertising. So it is important that government needs to impose rules on particularly advertisement company (for example, toys company) to avoid youngster have bias thought on what they really need.
llm: The Impact of Advertising on Consumption HabitsIn today's world, advertising has become an integral part of our daily lives. We are constantly bombarded with advertisements on television, streets, magazines, and social media. It is often argued that these advertisements significantly influence people's consumption choices, leading them to buy things they don't necessarily need. While this argument holds some truth, it is essential to acknowledge that buying habits are highly personal and dependent on individual needs and consumption abilities.On one hand, advertising can indeed shape people's consumption patterns. Advertisers use various tactics to make products appealing, such as eye-catching visuals, catchy slogans, and celebrity endorsements. These tactics can create a desire for a product, even if it's not a necessity. For instance, a person may see an advertisement for a new smartphone and feel pressure to upgrade, even if their current phone is still functional. In this sense, advertising can be seen as a driving force behind consumerism, encouraging people to buy more than they need.On the other hand, it is crucial to recognize that buying habits are complex and multi-faceted. While advertising can influence people's choices, it is not the sole determining factor. Individuals have unique needs, preferences, and financial capabilities that shape their consumption decisions. For example, a person may prioritize buying a new laptop for work purposes over a luxury item advertised on television. In this case, their consumption choice is driven by their needs and priorities, rather than solely by advertising.Moreover, people's consumption abilities, such as their income and financial situation, also play a significant role in determining their buying habits. A person may see an advertisement for a high-end product, but their financial constraints may prevent them from making the purchase. In this sense, advertising may not be as influential as other factors, such as financial reality, in shaping consumption choices.In conclusion, while advertising can undoubtedly influence people's consumption habits, it is essential to acknowledge the complexity of individual needs, preferences, and financial capabilities that shape these habits. Advertising is just one of many factors that contribute to consumption decisions, and its impact should not be overstated. By recognizing the multifaceted nature of buying habits, we can better understand the intricate relationships between advertising, individual needs, and consumption choices.

question: Some people think that by paying taxes they made enough contribution to their society. TO what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Paying taxes is the obligation of citizens in almost every country. Some people believe that they have made enough contribution to the country by doing that. Personally, I tend to disagree with this view.To start with, all people who are able to work should pay tax to the government, as it is the most important source of government's revenue, which is mainly used to serve all citizens. For example, a large proportion of the tax is spent on national defence and in maintaining social stability, so that every one can work and live in a peaceful environment. The tax is also used to pay the salaries of workers working in public service sectors, such as teachers and police officers. Although these workers do not produce profit directly, what they do is for the well-being of the whole society.However, I would argue that citizens have other important responsibilities to fulfil apart from paying tax. As we know, there are impoverished or disabled people in every society, needing help and support from others. It is true that the government can provide some fund to ease their difficulties, but such financial help is usually far from enough. In such case, aids from more capable or wealthier citizens are particularly crucial, which are a great complement to government support. Another responsibility all citizens should take is to maintain social stability together with the police force. There are criminals in every society, and the number of policemen the government can hire is limited. So it is quite necessary for the local residents to take actions and ensure the safety of the communities, by doing things like reporting suspicious activities to the police department.In conclusion, it is a significant obligation of citizens to pay tax to the government. Other than that, they have other critical obligations to take, in order to make our society function in an ordered way.
llm: In most countries, paying taxes is a mandatory obligation for citizens. This financial contribution enables governments to provide essential public services, infrastructure, and social welfare programs. However, while paying taxes is a vital civic duty, I firmly believe that citizens have other equally important responsibilities to fulfill beyond contributing to the state's coffers.One such responsibility is to support vulnerable members of society. In every community, there exist individuals who are struggling to make ends meet, such as the impoverished, disabled, and marginalized. These individuals often rely on the kindness and generosity of others to survive. As citizens, it is our moral obligation to lend a helping hand, whether through volunteering, donating to charitable causes, or simply offering emotional support.Moreover, citizens have a responsibility to engage in their communities and promote social cohesion. This can be achieved by participating in local initiatives, advocating for social justice, and fostering a sense of belonging among residents. By doing so, citizens can help build stronger, more resilient communities that are better equipped to address social and economic challenges.Another important responsibility is to protect the environment and preserve natural resources for future generations. This can be achieved by adopting sustainable lifestyles, reducing carbon footprints, and supporting eco-friendly policies. By taking ownership of our environmental responsibilities, citizens can contribute to a healthier, more sustainable planet.In conclusion, while paying taxes is a fundamental obligation of citizens, it is by no means the only responsibility we bear. By acknowledging and fulfilling our duties to support vulnerable members of society, engage in our communities, and protect the environment, we can build a more compassionate, equitable, and sustainable world. By recognizing the breadth of our civic responsibilities, we can work towards creating a brighter future for all.

question: School should teach children the academic subje cts which have a close relationship with their future careers, so other subjects like music and sports are not important. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: People have many different views about what subjects should be taught in school. Although I accept that students have to study many subjects in school, I disagree with the idea that unimportant subjects such as music and sports should be got rid of the program.Many people believe that students only need to study academic subjects like mathematics, physics because these subject are necessary for students' future. This is understandable when labor market now has high competition; students have to meet requirements regard of qualification. In addition, the unemployment rate is always high, so their parents want children to study these subjects which can help students have a job. Although those above reasons are acceptable, I would argue that there are many things much more important than having a job. Firstly, studying music, art or sports is also very important to students. This enables students to develop their potentials through discovering the natural world around them. Secondly, to get a job in labor market, not only do students require hard skills but also soft skills such as teamwork, presentation. For instance, through taking part in a sport, students can understand team spirit and learn lessons about teamwork skills. Therefore, these subjects might fulfil the students' ability. Finally, children's future do not depend heavily on the academic subjects they study in school, it is the result of their efforts and capacity.In conclusion, although the academic subjects play a primary role in nurturing children, it seem to me that the effects of learning music, sports are profound.
llm: The notion that students should solely focus on academic subjects like mathematics and physics because they are essential for securing a job is a widely held belief. However, I strongly disagree with this perspective, arguing that there are far more important aspects of life that require attention and nurturing.While it is undeniable that academic subjects provide a solid foundation for future careers, it is crucial to acknowledge that there is more to life than just employment. The pursuit of knowledge, personal growth, and well-being are equally, if not more, important than securing a job. By prioritizing academic subjects over other areas of study, we risk neglecting the development of essential life skills, creativity, and emotional intelligence.Subjects like music, art, and physical education, often considered "non-academic," play a vital role in shaping individuals into well-rounded, empathetic, and innovative thinkers. Music, for instance, has been shown to enhance cognitive skills, boost memory, and promote cultural understanding. Similarly, art and physical education foster creativity, teamwork, and self-discipline, all of which are valuable assets in both personal and professional life.Furthermore, an overemphasis on academic subjects can lead to burnout, stress, and a narrow perspective on life. Students who are encouraged to explore a broad range of subjects, including those often deemed "non-academic," are more likely to develop a deeper understanding of themselves and the world around them. This, in turn, enables them to make more informed decisions about their future, including their career choices.In conclusion, while academic subjects are undoubtedly important, it is essential to recognize that there are many aspects of life that are equally, if not more, significant than securing a job. By providing students with a balanced education that includes a range of subjects, we can help them develop into thoughtful, creative, and well-rounded individuals, equipped to thrive in all areas of life.

question: Some people believe that information available in the internet will end the era of newspapers and magazines. Do you agree or disagree? Give your own opinion and examples.
human: Digital media has been extremely popular among people around the globe. With this advancement, newspapers and magazines are struggling to justify their existence. Some believe that traditional paper media will come to an end very soon due to the increased usage of internet based media. But many other still thinks they are going to stay. I agree to the argument that newspapers and magazines will be history with the time. I will establish my view by analysing how internet presents the information about the current affair so fast and the accessibility to the historical news.A very important responsibility of media is to publish information about the current affairs as quickly as possible specially when there is a crisis. This helps readers to get updated and act accordingly. For example, when the aircraft MH 370 went missing, everyone wanted to know the details about this tragic incident. The friends and families of passengers and crews were impatient to know the truth. In such situations, newspapers and magazines can not respond as fast as digital media. Instead of waiting for next publication, people can get trustworthy information about the current incidents from internet within an hour or two. This explains why digital media will rule over paper and magazines.People often want to access news from past for various reasons like to prepare for research, satisfy interest, etc. For example, one research fellow may want to know how a small village named Oramaki in Japan was suffering after Second World War. It is very difficult to get this sort of information from past in newspapers and magazines as one has to know before where to look at. But internet provides efficient search facility where one can search the topic and get the details. This feature of digital media is not supported by newspapers and magazines.To conclude, the fast responding internet media with vast information will be replacing newspapers and magazines as new and information provider for valid reasons. Though considering the current infrastructure and mindset of people, paper media will continue for another few years.
llm: The rapid proliferation of internet-based media has sparked a contentious debate about the future of traditional paper media. While some pundits argue that newspapers and magazines will continue to thrive, I firmly believe that these stalwarts of journalism will eventually become relics of the past.On the one hand, the internet has revolutionized the way we consume information. With just a few clicks, we can access a vast array of news sources, articles, and magazines from around the world. Online news portals and social media platforms have made it possible for us to stay informed about current events in real-time, rendering traditional paper media's delayed reporting obsolete. Moreover, online content is often more dynamic, interactive, and tailored to individual interests, making it a more appealing option for many readers.On the other hand, some argue that traditional paper media still has its advantages. Newspapers and magazines offer a tactile experience, allowing readers to disconnect from screens and engage with physical content. Moreover, many publications have a loyal readership that values the editorial curation and in-depth analysis that traditional media provides. However, I believe that these advantages are not enough to stem the tide of digital migration.As technology continues to advance, online media will only become more sophisticated and user-friendly. Already, many publications are shifting their focus to digital platforms, and it's likely that this trend will only accelerate in the future. Furthermore, the environmental impact of paper media, from deforestation to waste generation, will increasingly become a concern for eco-conscious readers.In conclusion, while traditional paper media still has its loyal adherents, I firmly believe that the writing is on the wall. As internet-based media continues to evolve and improve, it's likely that newspapers and magazines will eventually become a thing of the past. As we move forward in this digital age, it's essential to acknowledge the shift and adapt to the changing media landscape.

question: When choosing a job, the salary is the most important consideration. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: In many societies, choice of a job depends on the size of the salary offered. Nevertheless, while I admit that the salary is very pivotal factor, I claim that there are other equally vital aspects that need to be considered in this regard.To begin with, I agree that in order for people to cover their daily and general needs they need money as well. However, aspects such as: friendly colleagues, environment and work-place condition, sometimes, have even more impact on person's happiness and quality of life.
